verses.text: In the beginning God made heaven and earth. The earth was invisible and unfinished; and darkness was over the deep.
parts: In the beginning God made heaven and earth.
The earth was invisible and unfinished; and darkness was over the deep.

verses.text: Then God said, “Let there be light”; and there was light.
parts: Then God said, “Let there be light”; and there was light.

verses.text: God saw the light; it was good; and God divided the light from the darkness.
parts: God saw the light; it was good; and God divided the light from the darkness.

verses.text: God called the light Day; the darkness He called Night; and there was evening and morning, one day.
parts: God called the light Day; the darkness He called Night; and there was evening and morning, one day.

verses.text: Then God said, “Let there be a firmament in the midst of the water, and let it divide the water from the water”; and it was so.
parts: Then God said, “Let there be a firmament in the midst of the water, and let it divide the water from the water”; and it was so.

verses.text: Thus God made the firmament, and God divided the water under the firmament from the water above the firmament.
parts: Thus God made the firmament, and God divided the water under the firmament from the water above the firmament.

verses.text: So God called the firmament Heaven, and God saw that it was good; and there was evening and morning, the second day.
parts: So God called the firmament Heaven, and God saw that it was good; and there was evening and morning, the second day.

verses.text: Then God said, “Let the water under heaven be gathered together into one place, and let the dry land appear”; and it was so.

verses.text: So God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters He called Seas; and God saw that it was good.

verses.text: So evening and morning were the third day.
parts: So evening and morning were the third day.

verses.text: Then God said, “Let the earth bring forth the living creature according to its kind: the quadrupeds, the creeping things, and the wild animals of the earth according to their kind.” It was so. parts: And Noah was five hundred years old, and he begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that men began to exist in great numbers on the earth, and daughters were born to them.
parts: Now it came to pass that men began to exist in great numbers on the earth, and daughters were born to them.

verses.text: So when the sons of God saw the daughters of men were beautiful, they took wives for themselves of all they chose.
parts: So when the sons of God saw the daughters of men were beautiful, they took wives for themselves of all they chose.

verses.text: Then the Lord God said, “My Spirit shall not remain with these people forever, for they are flesh.
parts: Then the Lord God said, “My Spirit shall not remain with these people forever, for they are flesh.

verses.text: Now there were giants on the earth in those days, and also afterward, when the sons of God came in to the daughters of men and they bore children to them.
parts: Now there were giants on the earth in those days, and also afterward, when the sons of God came in to the daughters of men and they bore children to them.

verses.text: Then the Lord God saw man's wickedness, that it was great in the earth, and every intent of the thoughts within his heart was only evil continually. So God was grieved that He had made man on the earth, and He thought this over. Then God said, “I will blot out man whom I created from the face of the earth, from man to cattle, and from the creeping things to the birds of heaven, for I am grieved I made them.” But Noah found grace in the presence of the Lord God.
parts: Then the Lord God saw man's wickedness, that it was great in the earth, and every intent of the thoughts within his heart was only evil continually.
So God was grieved that He had made man on the earth, and He thought this over.
Then God said, “I will blot out man whom I created from the face of the earth, from man to cattle, and from the creeping things to the birds of heaven, for I am grieved I made them.”
But Noah found grace in the presence of the Lord God.

verses.text: So God was grieved that He had made man on the earth, and He thought this over.
parts: So God was grieved that He had made man on the earth, and He thought this over.

verses.text: Then God said, “I will blot out man whom I created from the face of the earth, from man to cattle, and from the creeping things to the birds of heaven, for I am grieved I made them.”
parts: Then God said, “I will blot out man whom I created from the face of the earth, from man to cattle, and from the creeping things to the birds of heaven, for I am grieved I made them.”

verses.text: But Noah found grace in the presence of the Lord God.
parts: But Noah found grace in the presence of the Lord God.

verses.text: This is the genealogy of Noah.
parts: This is the genealogy of Noah.

verses.text: So Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
parts: So Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.text: Now the earth was corrupt before God and filled with unrighteousness. Thus the Lord God looked upon the earth, and indeed it was corrupt; for all flesh corrupted their way on the earth.
parts: Now the earth was corrupt before God and filled with unrighteousness.
Thus the Lord God looked upon the earth, and indeed it was corrupt; for all flesh corrupted their way on the earth.

verses.text: Thus the Lord God looked upon the earth, and indeed it was corrupt; for all flesh corrupted their way on the earth.
parts: Thus the Lord God looked upon the earth, and indeed it was corrupt; for all flesh corrupted their way on the earth.

verses.text: Then God said to Noah, “The end of all flesh has come before Me, for the earth is filled with unrighteousness through them; and behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
parts: Then God said to Noah, “The end of all flesh has come before Me, for the earth is filled with unrighteousness through them; and behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

verses.text: Make yourself an ark of square timber.
parts: Make yourself an ark of square timber.

verses.text: Thus you shall make the ark: three hundred cubits in length, fifty cubits in breadth, and thirty cubits in height.
parts: Thus you shall make the ark: three hundred cubits in length, fifty cubits in breadth, and thirty cubits in height.

verses.text: Now when you assemble the ark, you shall gradually finish it up to a cubit at the top, and set the door in its side.
parts: Now when you assemble the ark, you shall gradually finish it up to a cubit at the top, and set the door in its side.

verses.text: And behold, I am bringing a flood of water on the earth, to destroy from under heaven all flesh in which is the breath of life.
parts: And behold, I am bringing a flood of water on the earth, to destroy from under heaven all flesh in which is the breath of life.

verses.text: But I will establish My covenant with you; and you shall go into the ark—you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.
parts: But I will establish My covenant with you; and you shall go into the ark—you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.

verses.text: From every living thing of all flesh you shall bring two of every kind into the ark, to keep them alive with you; they shall be male and female.
parts: From every living thing of all flesh you shall bring two of every kind into the ark, to keep them alive with you; they shall be male and female.

verses.text: Of the birds after their kind, of animals after their kind, and of every creeping thing on the earth after its kind, two of every kind, they will enter into the ark with you, male and female, to keep them alive.
parts: Of the birds after their kind, of animals after their kind, and of every creeping thing on the earth after its kind, two of every kind, they will enter into the ark with you, male and female, to keep them alive.

verses.text: You shall also take for yourself all kinds of food to eat, and you shall gather it both for yourself and for them.”
parts: You shall also take for yourself all kinds of food to eat, and you shall gather it both for yourself and for them.”

verses.text: Thus Noah did according to all the Lord God commanded him, so he did.
parts: Thus Noah did according to all the Lord God commanded him, so he did.

verses.text: Then the Lord God said to Noah, “Enter the ark, you and all your family, because I have seen you righteous before Me in this generation. You shall also bring with you into the ark the clean cattle by sevens, male and female; and the unclean cattle by twos, male and female; and the clean birds of heaven by twos, male and female, to keep seed alive on the face of all the earth.
parts: Then the Lord God said to Noah, “Enter the ark, you and all your family, because I have seen you righteous before Me in this generation.
You shall also bring with you into the ark the clean cattle by sevens, male and female; and the unclean cattle by twos, male and female;
and the clean birds of heaven by twos, male and female, to keep seed alive on the face of all the earth.

verses.text: For after seven more days I will cause it to rain on the earth forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out from the face of the earth every living thing I made.”
parts: For after seven more days I will cause it to rain on the earth forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out from the face of the earth every living thing I made.”

verses.text: So Noah did all the Lord God commanded him.
parts: So Noah did all the Lord God commanded him.

verses.text: Now Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth. Then Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, entered the ark because of the flood waters.
parts: Now Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.
Then Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, entered the ark because of the flood waters.

verses.text: Then Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, entered the ark because of the flood waters.
parts: Then Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, entered the ark because of the flood waters.

verses.text: Also the clean and unclean birds, the clean and unclean cattle, and everything that creeps on the earth,
parts: Also the clean and unclean birds, the clean and unclean cattle, and everything that creeps on the earth,

verses.text: entered with Noah into the ark, two by two, male and female, as God commanded him.
parts: entered with Noah into the ark, two by two, male and female, as God commanded him.

verses.text: Then it came to pass after seven days, the waters of the flood came upon the earth.
parts: Then it came to pass after seven days, the waters of the flood came upon the earth.

verses.text: In the six-hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day, all the fountains of the great deep were broken up, and the floodgates of heaven were opened.
parts: In the six-hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day, all the fountains of the great deep were broken up, and the floodgates of heaven were opened.

verses.text: Then it rained on the earth forty days and forty nights.
parts: Then it rained on the earth forty days and forty nights.

verses.text: On the very same day Noah and his wife, his sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and their wives entered the ark.
parts: On the very same day Noah and his wife, his sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and their wives entered the ark.

verses.text: Also, all the wild animals after their kind, all cattle after their kind, every creeping thing moving upon the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind,
parts: Also, all the wild animals after their kind, all cattle after their kind, every creeping thing moving upon the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind,

verses.text: entered the ark with Noah, two by two, of all flesh in which is the breath of life.
parts: entered the ark with Noah, two by two, of all flesh in which is the breath of life.

verses.text: So those that entered, male and female of all flesh, went in as God commanded him.
parts: So those that entered, male and female of all flesh, went in as God commanded him.

verses.text: Now the flood was on the earth forty days and forty nights.
parts: Now the flood was on the earth forty days and forty nights.

verses.text: So the waters prevailed and greatly increased on the earth, and the ark moved about on the surface of the waters.
parts: So the waters prevailed and greatly increased on the earth, and the ark moved about on the surface of the waters.

verses.text: The waters prevailed exceedingly on the earth, and all the high mountains under the whole heaven were covered.
parts: The waters prevailed exceedingly on the earth, and all the high mountains under the whole heaven were covered.

verses.text: The waters prevailed fifteen cubits upward, and covered all the high mountains.
parts: The waters prevailed fifteen cubits upward, and covered all the high mountains.

verses.text: And all flesh died that moves on the earth: birds and cattle, wild animals, and every creeping thing that moves on the earth, and every man.
parts: And all flesh died that moves on the earth: birds and cattle, wild animals, and every creeping thing that moves on the earth, and every man.

verses.text: Thus all things in whose nostrils was the breath of life, and everything on dry land, died.
parts: Thus all things in whose nostrils was the breath of life, and everything on dry land, died.

verses.text: So He blotted out all living things on the face of the earth: both man and cattle, creeping things and the birds of heaven.
parts: So He blotted out all living things on the face of the earth: both man and cattle, creeping things and the birds of heaven.

verses.text: Now the waters prevailed on the earth one hundred and fifty days.
parts: Now the waters prevailed on the earth one hundred and fifty days.

verses.text: Then God remembered Noah, and whatever was with him in the ark: all the wild animals, all the cattle, all the birds, and all the creeping things.
parts: Then God remembered Noah, and whatever was with him in the ark: all the wild animals, all the cattle, all the birds, and all the creeping things.

verses.text: The fountains of the deep and the floodgates of heaven were also stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained.
parts: The fountains of the deep and the floodgates of heaven were also stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained.

verses.text: And the waters receded continually from the earth.
parts: And the waters receded continually from the earth.

verses.text: Then the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the mountains of Ararat.
parts: Then the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the mountains of Ararat.

verses.text: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month.
parts: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month.

verses.text: So it came to pass, at the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark he had made.
parts: So it came to pass, at the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark he had made.

verses.text: Then he sent out a raven, which kept going to and fro until the waters dried up from the earth.
parts: Then he sent out a raven, which kept going to and fro until the waters dried up from the earth.

verses.text: He also sent out from himself a dove, to see if the waters had receded from the face of the ground.
parts: He also sent out from himself a dove, to see if the waters had receded from the face of the ground.

verses.text: But the dove found no resting place for the sole of her foot, and she returned to him in the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth.
parts: But the dove found no resting place for the sole of her foot, and she returned to him in the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth.

verses.text: Then he waited yet another seven days, and again he sent out the dove from the ark.
parts: Then he waited yet another seven days, and again he sent out the dove from the ark.

verses.text: The dove returned to him in the evening, and behold, a freshly plucked olive leaf was in her mouth; and Noah knew the waters had receded from the earth.
parts: The dove returned to him in the evening, and behold, a freshly plucked olive leaf was in her mouth; and Noah knew the waters had receded from the earth.

verses.text: So he waited yet another seven days and again sent out the dove; however, she did not return to him any more.
parts: So he waited yet another seven days and again sent out the dove; however, she did not return to him any more.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the six hundred and first year of Noah's life, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth; and Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked, and indeed, the surface of the ground was dry.
parts: And it came to pass in the six hundred and first year of Noah's life, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth; and Noah removed the covering of the ark and looked, and indeed, the surface of the ground was dry.

verses.text: Now in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dried.
parts: Now in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dried.

verses.text: Then the Lord God spoke to Noah, saying, “Go out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and their wives with you.
parts: Then the Lord God spoke to Noah, saying, “Go out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and their wives with you.

verses.text: “Go out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and their wives with you.
parts: “Go out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and their wives with you.

verses.text: Also, bring out with you every living thing of all flesh: birds and cattle and every creeping thing that moves upon the earth, so they may abound on the earth, and increase and multiply on the earth.”
parts: Also, bring out with you every living thing of all flesh: birds and cattle and every creeping thing that moves upon the earth, so they may abound on the earth, and increase and multiply on the earth.”

verses.text: So Noah went out, along with his wife and his sons and their wives.
parts: So Noah went out, along with his wife and his sons and their wives.

verses.text: Every animal, every bird, and every creeping thing that moves upon the earth, according to their kind, went out of the ark.
parts: Every animal, every bird, and every creeping thing that moves upon the earth, according to their kind, went out of the ark.

verses.text: Then Noah built an altar to God, and took of every clean animal and of every clean bird, and offered whole burnt offerings on the altar.
parts: Then Noah built an altar to God, and took of every clean animal and of every clean bird, and offered whole burnt offerings on the altar.

verses.text: So the Lord God smelled a sweet aroma.
parts: So the Lord God smelled a sweet aroma.

verses.text: While the earth remains, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and spring shall not cease by day or by night.”
parts: While the earth remains, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and spring shall not cease by day or by night.”

verses.text: Thus God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Increase and multiply, and fill the earth, and have dominion over it. For the dread and fear of you shall be upon all the wild animals of the earth, all the birds of heaven, all that move upon the earth, and all the fish of the sea.
parts: Thus God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Increase and multiply, and fill the earth, and have dominion over it.
For the dread and fear of you shall be upon all the wild animals of the earth, all the birds of heaven, all that move upon the earth, and all the fish of the sea.

verses.text: Every moving thing that lives shall be food for you.
parts: Every moving thing that lives shall be food for you.

verses.text: But you shall not eat flesh with its lifeblood.
parts: But you shall not eat flesh with its lifeblood.

verses.text: Surely for your lifeblood I will demand a reckoning; from the hand of all the wild animals I will require it; and I will require the life of man at the hand of his fellow man.
parts: Surely for your lifeblood I will demand a reckoning; from the hand of all the wild animals I will require it; and I will require the life of man at the hand of his fellow man.

verses.text: Whoever sheds man's blood, by man his blood shall be shed; because I made man in God's image.
parts: Whoever sheds man's blood, by man his blood shall be shed; because I made man in God's image.

verses.text: So then, increase and multiply; and fill the earth and have dominion over it.”
parts: So then, increase and multiply; and fill the earth and have dominion over it.”

verses.text: Then God spoke to Noah and his sons with him, saying, “Behold, I am establishing My covenant with you and with your seed after you, and every living creature with you: the birds, the cattle, and all the wild animals of the earth, of all that came out of the ark with you.
parts: Then God spoke to Noah and his sons with him, saying,

“Behold, I am establishing My covenant with you and with your seed after you, and every living creature with you: the birds, the cattle, and all the wild animals of the earth, of all that came out of the ark with you.

verses.text: “Behold, I am establishing My covenant with you and with your seed after you,
parts: “Behold, I am establishing My covenant with you and with your seed after you,

verses.text: and every living creature with you: the birds, the cattle, and all the wild animals of the earth, of all that came out of the ark with you.
parts: and every living creature with you: the birds, the cattle, and all the wild animals of the earth, of all that came out of the ark with you.

verses.text: Thus I will establish My covenant with you, and never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of the flood; nor shall there ever again be a flood to destroy the earth.”
parts: Thus I will establish My covenant with you, and never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of the flood; nor shall there ever again be a flood to destroy the earth.”

verses.text: Then the Lord God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between Me and you, and every living creature with you, for perpetual generations:
parts: Then the Lord God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between Me and you, and every living creature with you, for perpetual generations:

verses.text: I am setting My rainbow in the cloud, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.
parts: I am setting My rainbow in the cloud, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.

verses.text: It shall be, when I bring a cloud over the earth, the rainbow shall be seen in the cloud;
parts: It shall be, when I bring a cloud over the earth, the rainbow shall be seen in the cloud;

verses.text: and I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature of all flesh; the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.
parts: and I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature of all flesh; the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.

verses.text: My rainbow shall be in the cloud, and I will certainly remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh on the earth.”
parts: My rainbow shall be in the cloud, and I will certainly remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh on the earth.”

verses.text: Again God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I established between Me and all flesh on the earth.”
parts: Again God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I established between Me and all flesh on the earth.”

verses.text: Now the sons of Noah who went out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and Ham was the father of Canaan. These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.
parts: Now the sons of Noah who went out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and Ham was the father of Canaan.
These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.

verses.text: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.
parts: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole earth was populated.

verses.text: Then Noah began to be a husbandman, and he planted a vineyard.
parts: Then Noah began to be a husbandman, and he planted a vineyard.

verses.text: So he drank of the wine and was drunk and naked in his house.
parts: So he drank of the wine and was drunk and naked in his house.

verses.text: Now Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.
parts: Now Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.

verses.text: But Shem and Japheth took a garment, laid it on both their shoulders, and walking backwards they covered their father's nakedness.
parts: But Shem and Japheth took a garment, laid it on both their shoulders, and walking backwards they covered their father's nakedness.

verses.text: Thus when Noah became sober and knew what his younger son had done to him,
parts: Thus when Noah became sober and knew what his younger son had done to him,

verses.text: he said:
parts: he said:

verses.text: He also said,
parts: He also said,

verses.text: Now Noah lived three hundred and fifty years after the flood.
parts: Now Noah lived three hundred and fifty years after the flood.

verses.text: So all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years, and he died.
parts: So all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years, and he died.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Noah's sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and sons were born to them after the flood.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Noah's sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth, and sons were born to them after the flood.

verses.text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Elisa, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
parts: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Elisa, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

verses.text: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
parts: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

verses.text: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim, and Rhodians.
parts: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim, and Rhodians.

verses.text: From these the coastal nations were separated into their lands, each according to his language, in their tribes and nations.
parts: From these the coastal nations were separated into their lands, each according to his language, in their tribes and nations.

verses.text: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
parts: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

verses.text: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabtechah; and the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
parts: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabtechah; and the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

verses.text: Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a giant on the earth.
parts: Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a giant on the earth.

verses.text: He was a giant, a hunter before the Lord God; therefore they would say, “As Nimrod the giant, the hunter before the Lord.”
parts: He was a giant, a hunter before the Lord God; therefore they would say, “As Nimrod the giant, the hunter before the Lord.”

verses.text: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
parts: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

verses.text: From that land he went to Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,
parts: From that land he went to Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

verses.text: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the principal city).
parts: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the principal city).

verses.text: Mizraim begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
parts: Mizraim begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

verses.text: Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and the Caphtorim).
parts: Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and the Caphtorim).

verses.text: Canaan begot Sidon his firstborn, and the Chettite;
parts: Canaan begot Sidon his firstborn, and the Chettite;

verses.text: the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite;
parts: the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite;

verses.text: the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite;
parts: the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite;

verses.text: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
parts: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

verses.text: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon as you go toward Gerar, as far as Gaza; then as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.
parts: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon as you go toward Gerar, as far as Gaza; then as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.

verses.text: These were the sons of Ham, according to their tribes, according to their languages, in their countries and in their nations.
parts: These were the sons of Ham, according to their tribes, according to their languages, in their countries and in their nations.

verses.text: Now sons were also born to Shem himself, the father of all the sons of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder. The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram and Cainan.
parts: Now sons were also born to Shem himself, the father of all the sons of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder.
The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram and Cainan.

verses.text: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram and Cainan.
parts: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram and Cainan.

verses.text: The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
parts: The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

verses.text: Arphaxad begot Cainan, and Cainan begot Salah, and Salah begot Eber.
parts: Arphaxad begot Cainan, and Cainan begot Salah, and Salah begot Eber.

verses.text: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother's name was Joktan.
parts: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother's name was Joktan.

verses.text: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
parts: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
parts: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
parts: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab.
parts: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab.

verses.text: And their dwelling place was from Mesha as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.
parts: And their dwelling place was from Mesha as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.

verses.text: These were the sons of Shem, according to their tribes, according to their languages, in their countries, according to their nations.
parts: These were the sons of Shem, according to their tribes, according to their languages, in their countries, according to their nations.

verses.text: These were the tribes of Noah's sons, according to their genealogy, in their nations; and from these the coastal nations were divided on the earth after the flood.
parts: These were the tribes of Noah's sons, according to their genealogy, in their nations; and from these the coastal nations were divided on the earth after the flood.

verses.text: Now the whole earth was one language and one speech.
parts: Now the whole earth was one language and one speech.

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and dwelt there.
parts: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and dwelt there.

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and bake them with fire.” They had brick for stone and asphalt for mortar.
parts: Then they said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and bake them with fire.” They had brick for stone and asphalt for mortar.

verses.text: They also said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower, whose top will reach to heaven; and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered abroad over the face of the whole earth.”
parts: They also said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower, whose top will reach to heaven; and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered abroad over the face of the whole earth.”

verses.text: But the Lord came down to see the city and the tower the sons of men built.
parts: But the Lord came down to see the city and the tower the sons of men built.

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Indeed, the people are one race and one language, and they have begun to do what they said.
parts: Then the Lord said, “Indeed, the people are one race and one language, and they have begun to do what they said.

verses.text: Come, let Us go down there and confuse their language, so they may not understand one another's speech.”
parts: Come, let Us go down there and confuse their language, so they may not understand one another's speech.”

verses.text: So the Lord scattered them abroad from there over the face of all the earth, and they ceased building the city and the tower.
parts: So the Lord scattered them abroad from there over the face of all the earth, and they ceased building the city and the tower.

verses.text: Therefore its name is called Babel, because there the Lord confused the languages of all the earth; and from there the Lord God scattered them abroad over the face of all the earth.
parts: Therefore its name is called Babel, because there the Lord confused the languages of all the earth; and from there the Lord God scattered them abroad over the face of all the earth.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Shem: Shem was one hundred years old, and begot Arphaxad two years after the flood. After he begot Arphaxad, Shem lived five hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Shem: Shem was one hundred years old, and begot Arphaxad two years after the flood.
After he begot Arphaxad, Shem lived five hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: After he begot Arphaxad, Shem lived five hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Arphaxad, Shem lived five hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Arphaxad lived one hundred and thirty-five years, and begot Cainan.
parts: Now Arphaxad lived one hundred and thirty-five years, and begot Cainan.

verses.text: After he begot Cainan, Arphaxad lived four hundred and thirty years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Cainan, Arphaxad lived four hundred and thirty years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Salah lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Eber.
parts: Now Salah lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Eber.

verses.text: After he begot Eber, Salah lived three hundred and thirty years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Eber, Salah lived three hundred and thirty years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Eber lived one hundred and thirty-four years, and begot Peleg.
parts: Now Eber lived one hundred and thirty-four years, and begot Peleg.

verses.text: After he begot Peleg, Eber lived three hundred and seventy years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Peleg, Eber lived three hundred and seventy years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Peleg lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Reu.
parts: Now Peleg lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Reu.

verses.text: After he begot Reu, Peleg lived two hundred and nine years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Reu, Peleg lived two hundred and nine years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Reu lived one hundred and thirty-two years, and begot Serug.
parts: Now Reu lived one hundred and thirty-two years, and begot Serug.

verses.text: After he begot Serug, Reu lived two hundred and seven years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Serug, Reu lived two hundred and seven years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Serug lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Nahor.
parts: Now Serug lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot Nahor.

verses.text: After he begot Nahor, Serug lived two hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Nahor, Serug lived two hundred years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Nahor lived seventy-nine years, and begot Terah.
parts: Nahor lived seventy-nine years, and begot Terah.

verses.text: After he begot Terah, Nahor lived one hundred and twenty-nine years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.
parts: After he begot Terah, Nahor lived one hundred and twenty-nine years, and begot sons and daughters; and he died.

verses.text: Now Terah lived seventy years, and begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
parts: Now Terah lived seventy years, and begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Terah: Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran begot Lot.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Terah: Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran begot Lot.

verses.text: So Haran died before his father Terah in his native land, in Ur of the Chaldeans.
parts: So Haran died before his father Terah in his native land, in Ur of the Chaldeans.

verses.text: Then Abram and Nahor took wives: the name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.
parts: Then Abram and Nahor took wives: the name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.

verses.text: But Sarai was barren, and had no child.
parts: But Sarai was barren, and had no child.

verses.text: Now Terah took his son Abram and his grandson Lot, the son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, his son Abram's wife, and led them out from Ur of the Chaldeans, to go to the land of Canaan; and they came to Haran and dwelt there.
parts: Now Terah took his son Abram and his grandson Lot, the son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, his son Abram's wife, and led them out from Ur of the Chaldeans, to go to the land of Canaan; and they came to Haran and dwelt there.

verses.text: So the days of Terah were two hundred and five years, and Terah died in Haran.
parts: So the days of Terah were two hundred and five years, and Terah died in Haran.

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Abram, “Get out of your country, from your kindred and from your father's house, to a land I will show you. I will make you a great nation; I will bless you and make your name great; and you shall be a blessing.
parts: Now the Lord said to Abram, “Get out of your country, from your kindred and from your father's house, to a land I will show you.
I will make you a great nation; I will bless you and make your name great; and you shall be a blessing.

verses.text: I will bless those who bless you, and curse those who curse you; and in you all the tribes of the earth shall be blessed.”
parts: I will bless those who bless you, and curse those who curse you; and in you all the tribes of the earth shall be blessed.”

verses.text: Then Abram departed as the Lord said to him, and Lot went with him.
parts: Then Abram departed as the Lord said to him, and Lot went with him.

verses.text: So Abram took Sarai his wife and Lot his brother's son and all their possessions and every soul they acquired in Haran, and they departed for the land of Canaan.
parts: So Abram took Sarai his wife and Lot his brother's son and all their possessions and every soul they acquired in Haran, and they departed for the land of Canaan.

verses.text: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, as far as the oak of Moreh.
parts: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, as far as the oak of Moreh.

verses.text: Then the Lord appeared to Abram and said, “To your seed I will give this land.” And there Abram built an altar to the Lord, who appeared to him.
parts: Then the Lord appeared to Abram and said, “To your seed I will give this land.” And there Abram built an altar to the Lord, who appeared to him.

verses.text: So he moved from there to the mountain east of Bethel, and he pitched his tent with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east; and there he built an altar to the Lord and called on the name of the Lord.
parts: So he moved from there to the mountain east of Bethel, and he pitched his tent with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east; and there he built an altar to the Lord and called on the name of the Lord.

verses.text: Then Abram journeyed, going on still toward the South.
parts: Then Abram journeyed, going on still toward the South.

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to dwell there, for the famine was severe in the land.
parts: Now there was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to dwell there, for the famine was severe in the land.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when he was close to entering Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, “Indeed I know you are a beautiful woman.
parts: So it came to pass, when he was close to entering Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, “Indeed I know you are a beautiful woman.

verses.text: Therefore it will happen, when the Egyptians see you, so they will say, ‘This is his wife’; and they will kill me, but they will let you live.
parts: Therefore it will happen, when the Egyptians see you, so they will say, ‘This is his wife’; and they will kill me, but they will let you live.

verses.text: Therefore say you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and I may live because of you.”
parts: Therefore say you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and I may live because of you.”

verses.text: So it was, when Abram came into Egypt, the Egyptians saw the woman, that she was very beautiful.
parts: So it was, when Abram came into Egypt, the Egyptians saw the woman, that she was very beautiful.

verses.text: The princes of Pharaoh also saw her and commended her to Pharaoh.
parts: The princes of Pharaoh also saw her and commended her to Pharaoh.

verses.text: Now he treated Abram well for her sake, and gave him sheep, oxen, donkeys, male and female servants, mules and camels.
parts: Now he treated Abram well for her sake, and gave him sheep, oxen, donkeys, male and female servants, mules and camels.

verses.text: But the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.
parts: But the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.

verses.text: So Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me?
parts: So Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me?

verses.text: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister’?
parts: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister’?

verses.text: So Pharaoh commanded his men concerning Abram; and they sent him away, with his wife and all he had.
parts: So Pharaoh commanded his men concerning Abram; and they sent him away, with his wife and all he had.

verses.text: Now Abram went up from Egypt to the South, he and his wife and all he had, and Lot with him. Abram was very rich in cattle, silver, and gold.
parts: Now Abram went up from Egypt to the South, he and his wife and all he had, and Lot with him.
Abram was very rich in cattle, silver, and gold.

verses.text: So he went on his journey from the South as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent was at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
parts: So he went on his journey from the South as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent was at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,

verses.text: to the place of the altar he made there at the beginning.
parts: to the place of the altar he made there at the beginning.

verses.text: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks and herds and tents.
parts: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks and herds and tents.

verses.text: But the land was not able to support them, so they might dwell together, for their possessions were so great they could not dwell together.
parts: But the land was not able to support them, so they might dwell together, for their possessions were so great they could not dwell together.

verses.text: So strife arose between the herdsmen of Abram's livestock and those of Lot.
parts: So strife arose between the herdsmen of Abram's livestock and those of Lot.

verses.text: So Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are brethren.
parts: So Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are brethren.

verses.text: Is not the whole land before you?
parts: Is not the whole land before you?

verses.text: Thus Lot lifted his eyes and saw all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered everywhere (before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah), like the garden of God, like the land of Egypt as you go toward Zoar. Then Lot chose all the plain of Jordan for himself, and journeyed east.
parts: Thus Lot lifted his eyes and saw all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered everywhere (before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah), like the garden of God, like the land of Egypt as you go toward Zoar.
Then Lot chose all the plain of Jordan for himself, and journeyed east.

verses.text: Then Lot chose all the plain of Jordan for himself, and journeyed east.
parts: Then Lot chose all the plain of Jordan for himself, and journeyed east.

verses.text: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan, but Lot dwelt in the cities of the plain and pitched his tent even as far as Sodom.
parts: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan, but Lot dwelt in the cities of the plain and pitched his tent even as far as Sodom.

verses.text: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinful before God.
parts: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinful before God.

verses.text: Then God said to Abram, after Lot separated from him, “Lift your eyes now and look from the place where you are—northward, southward, eastward, and westward; for all the land you see I give to you and your seed forever.
parts: Then God said to Abram, after Lot separated from him, “Lift your eyes now and look from the place where you are—northward, southward, eastward, and westward;
for all the land you see I give to you and your seed forever.

verses.text: for all the land you see I give to you and your seed forever.
parts: for all the land you see I give to you and your seed forever.

verses.text: And I will make your seed as the dust of the earth; that if a man could number the dust of the earth, then your seed also could be numbered.
parts: And I will make your seed as the dust of the earth; that if a man could number the dust of the earth, then your seed also could be numbered.

verses.text: Arise, walk in the land through its length and its breadth, for I will give it to you.”
parts: Arise, walk in the land through its length and its breadth, for I will give it to you.”

verses.text: Then Abram moved his tent, and went and dwelt by the oak of Mamre in Hebron, and built an altar there to the Lord.
parts: Then Abram moved his tent, and went and dwelt by the oak of Mamre in Hebron, and built an altar there to the Lord.

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the reign of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations, that they made war with Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
parts: Now it came to pass in the reign of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations, that they made war with Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).

verses.text: All these joined together in the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Salt Sea).
parts: All these joined together in the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Salt Sea).

verses.text: Twelve years they served Chedor- laomer, and in the thirteenth they rebelled.
parts: Twelve years they served Chedor- laomer, and in the thirteenth they rebelled.

verses.text: Now in the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer and the kings with him came and cut down the giants in Ashteroth Karnaim and strong nations with them: the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
parts: Now in the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer and the kings with him came and cut down the giants in Ashteroth Karnaim and strong nations with them: the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

verses.text: and the Horites in the mountains of Seir, as far as El Paran, which is by the wilderness.
parts: and the Horites in the mountains of Seir, as far as El Paran, which is by the wilderness.

verses.text: Then they turned back and came to En Mishpat (that is, Kadesh), and cut down all the princes of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazezon Tamar.
parts: Then they turned back and came to En Mishpat (that is, Kadesh), and cut down all the princes of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazezon Tamar.

verses.text: Now the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) went out and joined together in battle in the Valley of Siddim against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of nations, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.
parts: Now the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) went out and joined together in battle in the Valley of Siddim against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of nations, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.

verses.text: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of nations, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.
parts: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of nations, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.

verses.text: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of asphalt pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled and fell in there; but those left fled to the mountains.
parts: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of asphalt pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled and fell in there; but those left fled to the mountains.

verses.text: Then they took all the cavalry of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their provisions, and went their way.
parts: Then they took all the cavalry of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their provisions, and went their way.

verses.text: They also took Lot, Abram's brother's son who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
parts: They also took Lot, Abram's brother's son who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.

verses.text: Then one who escaped came and told Abram the Hebrew, who at that time dwelt by the oak of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner; and they were allies with Abram.
parts: Then one who escaped came and told Abram the Hebrew, who at that time dwelt by the oak of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol and brother of Aner; and they were allies with Abram.

verses.text: Now when Abram heard his brother Lot was taken captive, he armed his three hundred and eighteen trained servants, born in his own house, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
parts: Now when Abram heard his brother Lot was taken captive, he armed his three hundred and eighteen trained servants, born in his own house, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.

verses.text: So he divided his forces against them by night, and he and his servants attacked and pursued them as far as Hobah, north of Damascus.
parts: So he divided his forces against them by night, and he and his servants attacked and pursued them as far as Hobah, north of Damascus.

verses.text: So he brought back all the cavalry of Sodom, and also brought back his brother Lot and his goods, as well as the women and the people.
parts: So he brought back all the cavalry of Sodom, and also brought back his brother Lot and his goods, as well as the women and the people.

verses.text: Then the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley), after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings with him.
parts: Then the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley), after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings with him.

verses.text: Now Melchizedek the king of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was the priest of God Most High.
parts: Now Melchizedek the king of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was the priest of God Most High.

verses.text: He blessed Abram and said, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth;
parts: He blessed Abram and said, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth;

verses.text: and blessed be God Most High, who delivered your enemies into your hands.” Then Abram gave him a tithe of all.
parts: and blessed be God Most High, who delivered your enemies into your hands.” Then Abram gave him a tithe of all.

verses.text: Now the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, and keep the cavalry for yourself.”
parts: Now the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, and keep the cavalry for yourself.”

verses.text: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have raised my hand to God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,
parts: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have raised my hand to God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,

verses.text: that I will take nothing of yours, from a thread to a sandal strap, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich’—
parts: that I will take nothing of yours, from a thread to a sandal strap, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich’—

verses.text: except only what the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.”
parts: except only what the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.”

verses.text: After these things the Word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision, saying, “Do not be afraid, Abram.
parts: After these things the Word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision, saying, “Do not be afraid, Abram.

verses.text: But Abram said, “Lord, what will You give me, seeing I go childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus, the son of Masek, my domestic maidservant?”
parts: But Abram said, “Lord, what will You give me, seeing I go childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus, the son of Masek, my domestic maidservant?”

verses.text: Then Abram said, “Look, You have given me no offspring; indeed, my household servant is my heir.”
parts: Then Abram said, “Look, You have given me no offspring; indeed, my household servant is my heir.”

verses.text: And immediately the Voice of the Lord came to him, saying, “This one shall not be your heir, but the One who will come from your own body shall be your heir.” Then He brought him outside and said to him, “Look now toward heaven, and count the stars if you are able to number them.” And He said to him, “So shall your seed be.” And Abram believed God, and He accounted it to him for righteousness. Then He said to him, “I am the God who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land to inherit it.” And he said, “Master and Lord, how will I know I will inherit it?” So He said to him, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.” So he brought all these to Him and cut them in half, down the middle, and placed each piece opposite the other; but he did not cut the birds in two.
parts: And immediately the Voice of the Lord came to him, saying, “This one shall not be your heir, but the One who will come from your own body shall be your heir.”
Then He brought him outside and said to him, “Look now toward heaven, and count the stars if you are able to number them.” And He said to him, “So shall your seed be.”
And Abram believed God, and He accounted it to him for righteousness.
Then He said to him, “I am the God who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land to inherit it.”
And he said, “Master and Lord, how will I know I will inherit it?”

So He said to him, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.” So he brought all these to Him and cut them in half, down the middle, and placed each piece opposite the other; but he did not cut the birds in two.

verses.text: Then He brought him outside and said to him, “Look now toward heaven, and count the stars if you are able to number them.” And He said to him, “So shall your seed be.”
parts: Then He brought him outside and said to him, “Look now toward heaven, and count the stars if you are able to number them.” And He said to him, “So shall your seed be.”

verses.text: And Abram believed God, and He accounted it to him for righteousness.
parts: And Abram believed God, and He accounted it to him for righteousness.

verses.text: Then He said to him, “I am the God who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land to inherit it.”
parts: Then He said to him, “I am the God who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans, to give you this land to inherit it.”

verses.text: And he said, “Master and Lord, how will I know I will inherit it?”
parts: And he said, “Master and Lord, how will I know I will inherit it?”

verses.text: So He said to him, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.”
parts: So He said to him, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.”

verses.text: So he brought all these to Him and cut them in half, down the middle, and placed each piece opposite the other; but he did not cut the birds in two.
parts: So he brought all these to Him and cut them in half, down the middle, and placed each piece opposite the other; but he did not cut the birds in two.

verses.text: And when the vultures came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away.
parts: And when the vultures came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away.

verses.text: Now around sunset, a trance fell upon Abram; and behold, horror and great darkness fell upon him.
parts: Now around sunset, a trance fell upon Abram; and behold, horror and great darkness fell upon him.

verses.text: Then He said to Abram, “Know for certain that your seed will be strangers in a land not their own, and will serve them; and they will afflict and humble them four hundred years.
parts: Then He said to Abram, “Know for certain that your seed will be strangers in a land not their own, and will serve them; and they will afflict and humble them four hundred years.

verses.text: Also, the nation they serve I will judge; and afterward, they shall come out with great possessions.
parts: Also, the nation they serve I will judge; and afterward, they shall come out with great possessions.

verses.text: But as for you, you shall go to your fathers in peace, buried in a good old age.
parts: But as for you, you shall go to your fathers in peace, buried in a good old age.

verses.text: Then in the fourth generation they shall return here, for the sin of the Amorites is not yet filled up.”
parts: Then in the fourth generation they shall return here, for the sin of the Amorites is not yet filled up.”

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the sun went down, that there was a flame, and behold, there appeared a smoking oven and lamps of fire that passed between those divided pieces.
parts: And it came to pass, when the sun went down, that there was a flame, and behold, there appeared a smoking oven and lamps of fire that passed between those divided pieces.

verses.text: On the same day, the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, “I will give this land to your seed, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the River Euphrates—
parts: On the same day, the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, “I will give this land to your seed, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the River Euphrates—

verses.text: the Kenites, the Kenezzites, the Kadmonites,
parts: the Kenites, the Kenezzites, the Kadmonites,

verses.text: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
parts: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

verses.text: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Euaites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”
parts: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Euaites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”

verses.text: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children, but she had an Egyp-tian maidservant, whose name was Hagar. So Sarai said to Abram, “See now, the Lord has restrained me from bearing children.
parts: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children, but she had an Egyp-tian maidservant, whose name was Hagar.
So Sarai said to Abram, “See now, the Lord has restrained me from bearing children.

verses.text: Then Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar her maid, the Egyptian, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife, after Abram dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan.
parts: Then Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar her maid, the Egyptian, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife, after Abram dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan.

verses.text: So he went in to Hagar, and she conceived.
parts: So he went in to Hagar, and she conceived.

verses.text: Then Sarai said to Abram, “My wrong be upon you!
parts: Then Sarai said to Abram, “My wrong be upon you!

verses.text: Thus Abram said to Sarai, “Indeed, your maid is in your hand; do with her as you please.” So when Sarai dealt harshly with her, she fled from her presence.
parts: Thus Abram said to Sarai, “Indeed, your maid is in your hand; do with her as you please.” So when Sarai dealt harshly with her, she fled from her presence.

verses.text: Now the Angel of the Lord found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, by the spring on the way to Shur. Then He said, “Hagar, Sarai's maid, where have you come from, and where are you going?” She replied, “I am fleeing from the presence of my mistress Sarai.” The Angel of the Lord then said to her, “Return to your mistress, and humble yourself under her hand.” Again, the Angel of the Lord said to her, “I will surely multiply your seed exceedingly, that it may not be counted because of its multitude.” Once again, the Angel of the Lord said to her:
parts: Now the Angel of the Lord found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, by the spring on the way to Shur.
Then He said, “Hagar, Sarai's maid, where have you come from, and where are you going?” She replied, “I am fleeing from the presence of my mistress Sarai.”
The Angel of the Lord then said to her, “Return to your mistress, and humble yourself under her hand.”
Again, the Angel of the Lord said to her, “I will surely multiply your seed exceedingly, that it may not be counted because of its multitude.”
Once again, the Angel of the Lord said to her:

verses.text: Then He said, “Hagar, Sarai's maid, where have you come from, and where are you going?” She replied, “I am fleeing from the presence of my mistress Sarai.”
parts: Then He said, “Hagar, Sarai's maid, where have you come from, and where are you going?” She replied, “I am fleeing from the presence of my mistress Sarai.”

verses.text: The Angel of the Lord then said to her, “Return to your mistress, and humble yourself under her hand.”
parts: The Angel of the Lord then said to her, “Return to your mistress, and humble yourself under her hand.”

verses.text: Again, the Angel of the Lord said to her, “I will surely multiply your seed exceedingly, that it may not be counted because of its multitude.”
parts: Again, the Angel of the Lord said to her, “I will surely multiply your seed exceedingly, that it may not be counted because of its multitude.”

verses.text: Once again, the Angel of the Lord said to her:
parts: Once again, the Angel of the Lord said to her:

verses.text: Then Hagar called the name of the Lord who spoke to her, “You-Are-the-God-Who-Sees-Me”; for she said, “I have seen the One who appeared to me face to face.” Therefore, she called the well the-Well-of-Him-I-Saw-Before-Me; observe, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
parts: Then Hagar called the name of the Lord who spoke to her, “You-Are-the-God-Who-Sees-Me”; for she said, “I have seen the One who appeared to me face to face.”
Therefore, she called the well the-Well-of-Him-I-Saw-Before-Me; observe, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

verses.text: Therefore, she called the well the-Well-of-Him-I-Saw-Before-Me; observe, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
parts: Therefore, she called the well the-Well-of-Him-I-Saw-Before-Me; observe, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

verses.text: So Hagar bore Abram a son; and Abram named his son whom Hagar bore Ishmael.
parts: So Hagar bore Abram a son; and Abram named his son whom Hagar bore Ishmael.

verses.text: Now Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
parts: Now Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.

verses.text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am your God; be pleasing before Me and blameless. I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly.” Then Abram fell on his face, and God talked with him, saying, “As for Me, behold, My covenant is with you, and you shall be a father of many nations.
parts: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am your God; be pleasing before Me and blameless.
I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly.”
Then Abram fell on his face, and God talked with him, saying, “As for Me, behold, My covenant is with you, and you shall be a father of many nations.

verses.text: No longer shall your name be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham; for I have made you a father of many nations.
parts: No longer shall your name be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham; for I have made you a father of many nations.

verses.text: I will make you exceedingly fruitful; and I will make nations of you, and kings shall come from you.
parts: I will make you exceedingly fruitful; and I will make nations of you, and kings shall come from you.

verses.text: I will establish My covenant between Me and you and your seed after you in their generations, for an everlasting covenant, to be your God and the God of your seed after you.
parts: I will establish My covenant between Me and you and your seed after you in their generations, for an everlasting covenant, to be your God and the God of your seed after you.

verses.text: Also I will give you and your seed after you the land you are occupying as a sojourner, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.”
parts: Also I will give you and your seed after you the land you are occupying as a sojourner, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.”

verses.text: Then God said to Abraham, “As for you, you shall keep My covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations.
parts: Then God said to Abraham, “As for you, you shall keep My covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations.

verses.text: This is the covenant you shall keep, between Me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations: Every male child among you shall be circumcised;
parts: This is the covenant you shall keep, between Me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations: Every male child among you shall be circumcised;

verses.text: and you shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin.
parts: and you shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin.

verses.text: A child of eight days old shall be circumcised by you—every male child throughout your genealogy, he who is born in your house or bought with money from any foreigner not of your seed.
parts: A child of eight days old shall be circumcised by you—every male child throughout your genealogy, he who is born in your house or bought with money from any foreigner not of your seed.

verses.text: He who is born in your house, and he who is bought with your money must be circumcised; and My covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
parts: He who is born in your house, and he who is bought with your money must be circumcised; and My covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

verses.text: And the uncircumcised male child, who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin on the eighth day, that soul shall be cut off from his people; for he has broken My covenant.”
parts: And the uncircumcised male child, who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin on the eighth day, that soul shall be cut off from his people; for he has broken My covenant.”

verses.text: Then God said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.
parts: Then God said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.

verses.text: And I will bless her and also give you a son by her; and I will bless him, and he shall become nations; and kings of peoples shall be from him.”
parts: And I will bless her and also give you a son by her; and I will bless him, and he shall become nations; and kings of peoples shall be from him.”

verses.text: Then Abraham fell on his face and laughed, and said in his mind, “Shall a child be born to a man who is one hundred years old, and shall Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear a child?”
parts: Then Abraham fell on his face and laughed, and said in his mind, “Shall a child be born to a man who is one hundred years old, and shall Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear a child?”

verses.text: And Abraham said to God, “Oh, that Ishmael might live before You!”
parts: And Abraham said to God, “Oh, that Ishmael might live before You!”

verses.text: Then God said, “No, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall call his name Isaac; and I will establish My covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.
parts: Then God said, “No, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall call his name Isaac; and I will establish My covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.

verses.text: As for Ishmael, I have heard you.
parts: As for Ishmael, I have heard you.

verses.text: But My covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this time next year.”
parts: But My covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this time next year.”

verses.text: So God finished talking with Abraham and departed from him.
parts: So God finished talking with Abraham and departed from him.

verses.text: So Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham's house, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins that very same day, as God said to him.
parts: So Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham's house, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins that very same day, as God said to him.

verses.text: Now Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
parts: Now Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

verses.text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
parts: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

verses.text: That very same day Abraham was circumcised, and his son Ishmael.
parts: That very same day Abraham was circumcised, and his son Ishmael.

verses.text: Also, all the men of his house, born in the house or bought with money from a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
parts: Also, all the men of his house, born in the house or bought with money from a foreigner, were circumcised with him.

verses.text: Then God appeared to him at the oak of Mamre, as he was sitting in the tent door during the noon hour. So he lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, three men stood before him; and when he saw them, he ran from the tent door to meet them, and bowed himself to the ground, and said, “O Lord, if I have now found grace in Your sight, do not pass by Your servant.
parts: Then God appeared to him at the oak of Mamre, as he was sitting in the tent door during the noon hour.

So he lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, three men stood before him; and when he saw them, he ran from the tent door to meet them, and bowed himself to the ground, and said, “O Lord, if I have now found grace in Your sight, do not pass by Your servant.

verses.text: Let water be brought, and let them wash Your feet, while You cool Yourselves under the tree.
parts: Let water be brought, and let them wash Your feet, while You cool Yourselves under the tree.

verses.text: And I will bring bread for You to eat.
parts: And I will bring bread for You to eat.

verses.text: So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah and said, “Quickly, make ready three measures of fine meal; knead it and make cakes.”
parts: So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah and said, “Quickly, make ready three measures of fine meal; knead it and make cakes.”

verses.text: Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a young calf, tender and good, gave it to his servant, and he hastened to prepare it.
parts: Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a young calf, tender and good, gave it to his servant, and he hastened to prepare it.

verses.text: He also took butter and milk and the calf he prepared, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree as they ate.
parts: He also took butter and milk and the calf he prepared, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree as they ate.

verses.text: Then He said to him, “Where is Sarah your wife?” He replied, “Here, in the tent.” Again He said, “I will certainly return to you according to the time of life, and behold, Sarah your wife shall have a son.” (Sarah was listening in the tent door behind him.) Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age; and Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.
parts: Then He said to him, “Where is Sarah your wife?” He replied, “Here, in the tent.”

Again He said, “I will certainly return to you according to the time of life, and behold, Sarah your wife shall have a son.” (Sarah was listening in the tent door behind him.) Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age; and Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.

verses.text: Again He said, “I will certainly return to you according to the time of life, and behold, Sarah your wife shall have a son.” (Sarah was listening in the tent door behind him.)
parts: Again He said, “I will certainly return to you according to the time of life, and behold, Sarah your wife shall have a son.” (Sarah was listening in the tent door behind him.)

verses.text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age; and Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.
parts: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age; and Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.

verses.text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, “I have not yet had a child until now, and my lord is old also?”
parts: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, “I have not yet had a child until now, and my lord is old also?”

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh within herself, saying, ‘Shall I surely bear a child, since I am old?’
parts: Then the Lord said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh within herself, saying, ‘Shall I surely bear a child, since I am old?’

verses.text: Is anything impossible with God?
parts: Is anything impossible with God?

verses.text: But Sarah denied she had laughed, for she was afraid, saying, “I did not laugh”; but He said, “No, but you did laugh.”
parts: But Sarah denied she had laughed, for she was afraid, saying, “I did not laugh”; but He said, “No, but you did laugh.”

verses.text: Then the men rose from there and looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and Abraham went along and escorted them on their journey.
parts: Then the men rose from there and looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and Abraham went along and escorted them on their journey.

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Shall I hide from Abraham, My servant, what I am about to do?
parts: Then the Lord said, “Shall I hide from Abraham, My servant, what I am about to do?

verses.text: But Abraham shall surely become a great and populous nation, and in him all the nations of the earth shall be blessed.
parts: But Abraham shall surely become a great and populous nation, and in him all the nations of the earth shall be blessed.

verses.text: For I know he will order his sons and his house after him.
parts: For I know he will order his sons and his house after him.

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah has been completed, and their sins are exceedingly great.
parts: Then the Lord said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah has been completed, and their sins are exceedingly great.

verses.text: Therefore, I will go down now and see whether or not they are carrying out the outcry coming to Me concerning them.”
parts: Therefore, I will go down now and see whether or not they are carrying out the outcry coming to Me concerning them.”

verses.text: Then the men turned away from there and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained before the Lord. So Abraham drew near and said, “Would You also destroy the righteous with the ungodly? Suppose there were fifty righteous within the city; would You also destroy the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous in it?
parts: Then the men turned away from there and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained before the Lord.
So Abraham drew near and said, “Would You also destroy the righteous with the ungodly?
Suppose there were fifty righteous within the city; would You also destroy the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous in it?

verses.text: So Abraham drew near and said, “Would You also destroy the righteous with the ungodly?
