parts: So Abraham drew near and said, “Would You also destroy the righteous with the ungodly?

verses.text: Suppose there were fifty righteous within the city; would You also destroy the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous in it?
parts: Suppose there were fifty righteous within the city; would You also destroy the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous in it?

verses.text: Far be it from You to do such a thing as this, to slay the righteous with the wicked, that the righteous should be as the wicked; far be it from You!
parts: Far be it from You to do such a thing as this, to slay the righteous with the wicked, that the righteous should be as the wicked; far be it from You!

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.”
parts: Then the Lord said, “If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.”

verses.text: So Abraham answered and said, “Indeed now, I who am but dust and ashes have taken it upon myself to speak to the Lord:
parts: So Abraham answered and said, “Indeed now, I who am but dust and ashes have taken it upon myself to speak to the Lord:

verses.text: But suppose there were five less than the fifty righteous; would You destroy all of the city for lack of five?” He replied, “If I find there forty-five, I will not destroy it.”
parts: But suppose there were five less than the fifty righteous; would You destroy all of the city for lack of five?” He replied, “If I find there forty-five, I will not destroy it.”

verses.text: Again he spoke to Him and said, “But suppose there should be forty found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of forty.”
parts: Again he spoke to Him and said, “But suppose there should be forty found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of forty.”

verses.text: Then he said, “Let not the Lord be offended, and I will speak: Suppose thirty should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it if I should find thirty there.”
parts: Then he said, “Let not the Lord be offended, and I will speak: Suppose thirty should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it if I should find thirty there.”

verses.text: Again he said, “Since I have permission to speak to the Lord, suppose twenty should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of twenty.”
parts: Again he said, “Since I have permission to speak to the Lord, suppose twenty should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of twenty.”

verses.text: Then he said, “Let not the Lord be offended, and I will speak but once more, suppose ten should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of the ten.”
parts: Then he said, “Let not the Lord be offended, and I will speak but once more, suppose ten should be found there?” So He said, “I would not destroy it for the sake of the ten.”

verses.text: So the Lord went His way as soon as He finished speaking with Abraham; and Abraham returned to his place.
parts: So the Lord went His way as soon as He finished speaking with Abraham; and Abraham returned to his place.

verses.text: Now the two angels came to Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom.
parts: Now the two angels came to Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom.

verses.text: Then he said, “Behold, my lords, turn in to your servant's house and rest and wash your feet; then you may rise early and go on your way.” But they said, “No, but we will spend the night in the open square.”
parts: Then he said, “Behold, my lords, turn in to your servant's house and rest and wash your feet; then you may rise early and go on your way.” But they said, “No, but we will spend the night in the open square.”

verses.text: But he insisted strongly; so they turned in to him and entered his house.
parts: But he insisted strongly; so they turned in to him and entered his house.

verses.text: Now before they went to sleep, the men of the city, the Sodomites, both old and young, all the people from every quarter, surrounded the house.
parts: Now before they went to sleep, the men of the city, the Sodomites, both old and young, all the people from every quarter, surrounded the house.

verses.text: Thus they called to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight?
parts: Thus they called to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight?

verses.text: But Lot went out to them through the doorway, shut the door behind him,
parts: But Lot went out to them through the doorway, shut the door behind him,

verses.text: and said, “By no means, my brethren, do not act wickedly.
parts: and said, “By no means, my brethren, do not act wickedly.

verses.text: I have two daughters who have not known a man; let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you wish; only do nothing to these men, since this is the reason they have come under the protection of my roof.”
parts: I have two daughters who have not known a man; let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you wish; only do nothing to these men, since this is the reason they have come under the protection of my roof.”

verses.text: But they said, “Stand back!
parts: But they said, “Stand back!

verses.text: But the men reached out their hands, pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.
parts: But the men reached out their hands, pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.

verses.text: Then they struck the men at the doorway of the house with blindness, both small and great, and they became weary trying to find the door.
parts: Then they struck the men at the doorway of the house with blindness, both small and great, and they became weary trying to find the door.

verses.text: Now the men said to Lot, “Have you anyone else here in the city: sons-in-law, sons, daughters, or anyone?
parts: Now the men said to Lot, “Have you anyone else here in the city: sons-in-law, sons, daughters, or anyone?

verses.text: For we will destroy this place, because their outcry has become great before the Lord, and the Lord sent us to destroy it.”
parts: For we will destroy this place, because their outcry has become great before the Lord, and the Lord sent us to destroy it.”

verses.text: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Get up, get out of this place; for the Lord is about to wipe out this city!” But to his sons-in-law he seemed to be joking.
parts: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Get up, get out of this place; for the Lord is about to wipe out this city!” But to his sons-in-law he seemed to be joking.

verses.text: Now when the morning dawned, the angels urged Lot to hurry, saying, “Arise, take your wife and the two daughters you have, and get out, lest you be destroyed with the transgressions of the city.” But they were thrown into confusion, and the Lord being merciful to him, the angels seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and two daughters, and brought them outside the city.
parts: Now when the morning dawned, the angels urged Lot to hurry, saying, “Arise, take your wife and the two daughters you have, and get out, lest you be destroyed with the transgressions of the city.” But they were thrown into confusion, and the Lord being merciful to him, the angels seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and two daughters, and brought them outside the city.

verses.text: But they were thrown into confusion, and the Lord being merciful to him, the angels seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and two daughters, and brought them outside the city.
parts: But they were thrown into confusion, and the Lord being merciful to him, the angels seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and two daughters, and brought them outside the city.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when they had brought them outside, they said, “Escape for your life!
parts: So it came to pass, when they had brought them outside, they said, “Escape for your life!

verses.text: Then Lot said to them, “I pray, O Lord,
parts: Then Lot said to them, “I pray, O Lord,

verses.text: since Your servant found mercy in Your sight, and You magnified Your righteousness which You showed me by saving my life, nevertheless, I cannot escape to the mountains, lest some evil overtake me and I die.
parts: since Your servant found mercy in Your sight, and You magnified Your righteousness which You showed me by saving my life, nevertheless, I cannot escape to the mountains, lest some evil overtake me and I die.

verses.text: See now, this city, which is small, is near enough to flee to for refuge, and I shall escape there (is it not a little one?) and my soul shall live.”
parts: See now, this city, which is small, is near enough to flee to for refuge, and I shall escape there (is it not a little one?) and my soul shall live.”

verses.text: And He said to him, “See, I have acquiesced to you on this matter also, in that I will not overthrow this city, concerning which you have spoken.
parts: And He said to him, “See, I have acquiesced to you on this matter also, in that I will not overthrow this city, concerning which you have spoken.

verses.text: Therefore, hurry to escape there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” For this reason he called the name of that city Zoar.
parts: Therefore, hurry to escape there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” For this reason he called the name of that city Zoar.

verses.text: Now the sun rose upon the earth when Lot entered Zoar.
parts: Now the sun rose upon the earth when Lot entered Zoar.

verses.text: Then the Lord rained brimstone and fire on Sodom and Gomorrah from the Lord out of heaven.
parts: Then the Lord rained brimstone and fire on Sodom and Gomorrah from the Lord out of heaven.

verses.text: Thus He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and whatever grew on the ground.
parts: Thus He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and whatever grew on the ground.

verses.text: But his wife looked back behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.
parts: But his wife looked back behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.

verses.text: Then Abraham rose early in the morning and went to the place where he had stood before the Lord.
parts: Then Abraham rose early in the morning and went to the place where he had stood before the Lord.

verses.text: Then he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain; and he saw, and behold, a flame was ascending from the land, like the smoke of a furnace.
parts: Then he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain; and he saw, and behold, a flame was ascending from the land, like the smoke of a furnace.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when God wiped out all the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the destruction, when the Lord overthrew the cities where Lot had dwelt.
parts: So it came to pass, when God wiped out all the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the destruction, when the Lord overthrew the cities where Lot had dwelt.

verses.text: Then Lot with his two daughters went up from Zoar and settled in the mountains; for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he dwelt in a cave with his two daughters.
parts: Then Lot with his two daughters went up from Zoar and settled in the mountains; for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he dwelt in a cave with his two daughters.

verses.text: Now the firstborn said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man on the earth to come in to us, as is the custom of all the earth.
parts: Now the firstborn said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man on the earth to come in to us, as is the custom of all the earth.

verses.text: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may raise up seed from our father.”
parts: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may raise up seed from our father.”

verses.text: So they made their father drink wine that night, and the elder went in and lay with her father, and he did not know when she lay down or when she arose.
parts: So they made their father drink wine that night, and the elder went in and lay with her father, and he did not know when she lay down or when she arose.

verses.text: It happened on the next day, the elder said to the younger, “Indeed, I slept with our father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go in and lie with him, that we may raise up seed from our father.”
parts: It happened on the next day, the elder said to the younger, “Indeed, I slept with our father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go in and lie with him, that we may raise up seed from our father.”

verses.text: So they made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger went in and slept with him; but he did not know when she lay down or when she arose.
parts: So they made their father drink wine that night also, and the younger went in and slept with him; but he did not know when she lay down or when she arose.

verses.text: Thus both the daughters of Lot conceived by their father.
parts: Thus both the daughters of Lot conceived by their father.

verses.text: Then the elder bore a son and called his name Moab, saying, “He is from my father.” He is the father of the Moabites to this present day.
parts: Then the elder bore a son and called his name Moab, saying, “He is from my father.” He is the father of the Moabites to this present day.

verses.text: Now the younger also bore a son and called his name Ammon, saying, “The son of my family.” He is the father of the Ammonites to this present day.
parts: Now the younger also bore a son and called his name Ammon, saying, “The son of my family.” He is the father of the Ammonites to this present day.

verses.text: Now Abraham journeyed from there to the South, and dwelt between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned among the Gerarites. Then Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “She is my wife,” lest at a given time the men of the city should kill him because of her.
parts: Now Abraham journeyed from there to the South, and dwelt between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned among the Gerarites.
Then Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “She is my wife,” lest at a given time the men of the city should kill him because of her.

verses.text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, “Indeed, you are a dead man because of the woman you have taken, for she is a man's wife.”
parts: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, “Indeed, you are a dead man because of the woman you have taken, for she is a man's wife.”

verses.text: Now Abimelech had not come near her; and he said, “O Lord, will You destroy an ignorant and just nation?
parts: Now Abimelech had not come near her; and he said, “O Lord, will You destroy an ignorant and just nation?

verses.text: Did he not say to me, ‘She is my sister,’ and did she not say to me, ‘He is my brother’?
parts: Did he not say to me, ‘She is my sister,’ and did she not say to me, ‘He is my brother’?

verses.text: Then God said to him in a dream, “Yes, I know you did this with a clean heart, and I spared you that you might not sin against Me; therefore, I did not allow you to touch her.
parts: Then God said to him in a dream, “Yes, I know you did this with a clean heart, and I spared you that you might not sin against Me; therefore, I did not allow you to touch her.

verses.text: Now therefore, restore the man's wife, for he is a prophet; and he will pray for you, and you shall live.
parts: Now therefore, restore the man's wife, for he is a prophet; and he will pray for you, and you shall live.

verses.text: So Abimelech rose early in the morning, called all his servants, and told all these things in their hearing; and the men were very much afraid.
parts: So Abimelech rose early in the morning, called all his servants, and told all these things in their hearing; and the men were very much afraid.

verses.text: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us?
parts: Then Abimelech called Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us?

verses.text: Again Abimelech said to Abraham, “What possessed you to do this thing?”
parts: Again Abimelech said to Abraham, “What possessed you to do this thing?”

verses.text: Abraham replied, “Because I thought, surely the worship of God is not in this place; and they will kill me on account of my wife.
parts: Abraham replied, “Because I thought, surely the worship of God is not in this place; and they will kill me on account of my wife.

verses.text: But indeed, she truly is my sister.
parts: But indeed, she truly is my sister.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, I said to her, ‘This righteousness shall you do for me: in every place we enter, say of me, “He is my brother.” ’ ”
parts: So it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, I said to her, ‘This righteousness shall you do for me: in every place we enter, say of me, “He is my brother.” ’ ”

verses.text: Then Abimelech took one thousand pieces of silver, sheep, oxen, and male and female servants, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored Sarah his wife to him.
parts: Then Abimelech took one thousand pieces of silver, sheep, oxen, and male and female servants, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored Sarah his wife to him.

verses.text: Thus Abimelech said to Abraham, “See, my land is before you; dwell where it pleases you.”
parts: Thus Abimelech said to Abraham, “See, my land is before you; dwell where it pleases you.”

verses.text: Then to Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver, which will vindicate your honor before all those with you.
parts: Then to Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver, which will vindicate your honor before all those with you.

verses.text: So Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech, his wife, and his female servants.
parts: So Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech, his wife, and his female servants.

verses.text: for the Lord closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.
parts: for the Lord closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.

verses.text: Now the Lord visited Sarah as He said, and the Lord did for Sarah as He had spoken. For Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in old age, at the set time, of which God had spoken to him. So Abraham called the name of his son born to him—whom Sarah bore to him—Isaac.
parts: Now the Lord visited Sarah as He said, and the Lord did for Sarah as He had spoken.
For Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in old age, at the set time, of which God had spoken to him.
So Abraham called the name of his son born to him—whom Sarah bore to him—Isaac.

verses.text: Then Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God commanded him.
parts: Then Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God commanded him.

verses.text: Now Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
parts: Now Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.

verses.text: And Sarah said, “God has made me laugh; all who hear will laugh with me.”
parts: And Sarah said, “God has made me laugh; all who hear will laugh with me.”

verses.text: She also said, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children?
parts: She also said, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children?

verses.text: So the child grew and was weaned; and Abraham made a great feast on the same day Isaac was weaned.
parts: So the child grew and was weaned; and Abraham made a great feast on the same day Isaac was weaned.

verses.text: Now Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, who was born to Abraham, playing with Isaac her son.
parts: Now Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, who was born to Abraham, playing with Isaac her son.

verses.text: Therefore she said to Abraham, “Cast out this maidservant and her son, for the son of this maidservant shall not be heir with my son Isaac.”
parts: Therefore she said to Abraham, “Cast out this maidservant and her son, for the son of this maidservant shall not be heir with my son Isaac.”

verses.text: And the matter was very displeasing in Abraham's sight because of his son.
parts: And the matter was very displeasing in Abraham's sight because of his son.

verses.text: But God said to Abraham, “Do not let it be displeasing in your sight because of your son and your maidservant.
parts: But God said to Abraham, “Do not let it be displeasing in your sight because of your son and your maidservant.

verses.text: Yet I will also make a great nation of the son of your maidservant, because he is your seed.”
parts: Yet I will also make a great nation of the son of your maidservant, because he is your seed.”

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning, and took bread and a skin of water; and putting it on her shoulder, he gave it and the boy to Hagar, and sent her away.
parts: So Abraham rose early in the morning, and took bread and a skin of water; and putting it on her shoulder, he gave it and the boy to Hagar, and sent her away.

verses.text: When the water in the skin was used up, she placed the boy under one of the shrubs.
parts: When the water in the skin was used up, she placed the boy under one of the shrubs.

verses.text: Then she went and sat down across from him at a distance of about a bowshot; for she said to herself, “Let me not see the death of the boy.” So she sat opposite him, and lifted her voice and wept.
parts: Then she went and sat down across from him at a distance of about a bowshot; for she said to herself, “Let me not see the death of the boy.” So she sat opposite him, and lifted her voice and wept.

verses.text: But God heard the voice of the lad from the place where he was.
parts: But God heard the voice of the lad from the place where he was.

verses.text: Arise, lift up the lad and hold him with your hand, for I will make him a great nation.”
parts: Arise, lift up the lad and hold him with your hand, for I will make him a great nation.”

verses.text: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water.
parts: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water.

verses.text: Thus God was with the lad; and he grew and dwelt in the desert, and became an archer.
parts: Thus God was with the lad; and he grew and dwelt in the desert, and became an archer.

verses.text: He dwelt in the Wilderness of Paran; and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
parts: He dwelt in the Wilderness of Paran; and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

verses.text: Now it came to pass at that time that Abimelech, and his friend Ochozath, and Phichol, the commander-in-chief of his army, spoke to Abraham, saying, “God is with you in all you do.
parts: Now it came to pass at that time that Abimelech, and his friend Ochozath, and Phichol, the commander-in-chief of his army, spoke to Abraham, saying, “God is with you in all you do.

verses.text: Now therefore, swear to me by God that you will not deal falsely with me, or with my offspring, or with my posterity; but that according to the righteousness I did to you, you will do to me and to the land in which you have dwelt.”
parts: Now therefore, swear to me by God that you will not deal falsely with me, or with my offspring, or with my posterity; but that according to the righteousness I did to you, you will do to me and to the land in which you have dwelt.”

verses.text: So Abraham said, “I swear.”
parts: So Abraham said, “I swear.”

verses.text: Then Abraham rebuked Abimelech because of a well of water Abimelech's servants had seized.
parts: Then Abraham rebuked Abimelech because of a well of water Abimelech's servants had seized.

verses.text: Abimelech replied, “I do not know who did this thing; you did not tell me, nor had I heard of it until today.”
parts: Abimelech replied, “I do not know who did this thing; you did not tell me, nor had I heard of it until today.”

verses.text: So Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.
parts: So Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.

verses.text: Then Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
parts: Then Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.

verses.text: Thus Abimelech asked Abraham, “Why have you placed these seven ewe lambs by themselves?”
parts: Thus Abimelech asked Abraham, “Why have you placed these seven ewe lambs by themselves?”

verses.text: He replied, “You must take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, to witness that I dug this well.”
parts: He replied, “You must take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, to witness that I dug this well.”

verses.text: Therefore he called that place, the Well of Oath, because the two of them swore an oath there.
parts: Therefore he called that place, the Well of Oath, because the two of them swore an oath there.

verses.text: Thus they made a covenant at the Well of Oath.
parts: Thus they made a covenant at the Well of Oath.

verses.text: Then Abraham planted a field at the Well of Oath, and there he called on the name of the Lord, the eternal God.
parts: Then Abraham planted a field at the Well of Oath, and there he called on the name of the Lord, the eternal God.

verses.text: So Abraham stayed in the land of the Philistines many days.
parts: So Abraham stayed in the land of the Philistines many days.

verses.text: Now it came to pass after these things that God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!
parts: Now it came to pass after these things that God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!

verses.text: Then He said, “Take now your beloved son, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a whole burnt offering on one of the mountains I tell you.”
parts: Then He said, “Take now your beloved son, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a whole burnt offering on one of the mountains I tell you.”

verses.text: So Abraham rose early in the morning and saddled his donkey; and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son; and he split firewood for the whole burnt offering, and arose and went to the place God told him. Then on the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and saw the place afar off.
parts: So Abraham rose early in the morning and saddled his donkey; and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son; and he split firewood for the whole burnt offering, and arose and went to the place God told him.
Then on the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and saw the place afar off.

verses.text: Then on the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and saw the place afar off.
parts: Then on the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and saw the place afar off.

verses.text: Thus Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; the lad and I will go yonder and worship, and we will come back to you.”
parts: Thus Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; the lad and I will go yonder and worship, and we will come back to you.”

verses.text: So Abraham took the firewood of the whole burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son.
parts: So Abraham took the firewood of the whole burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son.

verses.text: Then Isaac spoke to Abraham his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” Then he said, “Look, the fire and the firewood, but where is the sheep for a whole burnt offering?”
parts: Then Isaac spoke to Abraham his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am, my son.” Then he said, “Look, the fire and the firewood, but where is the sheep for a whole burnt offering?”

verses.text: And Abraham said, “My son, God will provide for Himself the sheep for a whole burnt offering.” So the two of them went together.
parts: And Abraham said, “My son, God will provide for Himself the sheep for a whole burnt offering.” So the two of them went together.

verses.text: They came to the place where God had told him.
parts: They came to the place where God had told him.

verses.text: Then Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slay his son.
parts: Then Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slay his son.

verses.text: But the Angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham!
parts: But the Angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham!

verses.text: He then replied, “Do not lay your hand on the lad, or do anything to him, for now I know you fear God, since for My sake you have not spared your beloved son.”
parts: He then replied, “Do not lay your hand on the lad, or do anything to him, for now I know you fear God, since for My sake you have not spared your beloved son.”

verses.text: Then Abraham lifted his eyes and looked, and there behind him a ram was caught in a thicket by its horns.
parts: Then Abraham lifted his eyes and looked, and there behind him a ram was caught in a thicket by its horns.

verses.text: Thus Abraham called the name of the place The-Lord-Has-Appeared; as it is said to this day, “In the mountain the Lord was seen.”
parts: Thus Abraham called the name of the place The-Lord-Has-Appeared; as it is said to this day, “In the mountain the Lord was seen.”

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time out of heaven, and said, “By Myself I have sworn, says the Lord, because you did this thing, and for My sake did not spare your beloved son, I will certainly bless you, and assuredly multiply your seed as the stars of heaven and as the sand on the seashore; and your seed shall inherit the cities of their enemies. In your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed, because you obeyed My voice.” So Abraham returned to his servants, and they rose and went together to the Well of Oath; and Abraham dwelt at the Well of Oath.
parts: Then the Angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time out of heaven, and said, “By Myself I have sworn, says the Lord, because you did this thing, and for My sake did not spare your beloved son,
I will certainly bless you, and assuredly multiply your seed as the stars of heaven and as the sand on the seashore; and your seed shall inherit the cities of their enemies.

verses.text: Now it came to pass after these things that it was told Abraham, saying, “Indeed, Milcah also has borne sons to your brother Nahor: Huz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.” And Bethuel begot Rebekah.
parts: Now it came to pass after these things that it was told Abraham, saying, “Indeed, Milcah also has borne sons to your brother Nahor: Huz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.” And Bethuel begot Rebekah.

parts: And Bethuel begot Rebekah.

verses.text: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Thahash, and Ma-achah.
parts: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Thahash, and Ma-achah.

headers: The Death and Burial of Sarah

verses.text: Now Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years. Then Sarah died in the city of Kirjath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.
parts: Now Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years.
Then Sarah died in the city of Kirjath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.

verses.text: Then Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spoke to the sons of Heth, saying,
parts: Then Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spoke to the sons of Heth, saying,

verses.text: “I am a sojourner and a stranger among you.
parts: “I am a sojourner and a stranger among you.

verses.text: So the sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying,
parts: So the sons of Heth answered Abraham, saying,

verses.text: “Hear us, my Lord, you are a king from God among us; bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places.
parts: “Hear us, my Lord, you are a king from God among us; bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places.

verses.text: Then Abraham stood and bowed himself to the people of the land, the sons of Heth.
parts: Then Abraham stood and bowed himself to the people of the land, the sons of Heth.

verses.text: Thus he spoke with them, saying, “If you have it in mind for me to bury my dead out of my sight, then listen to me, and speak on my behalf to Ephron the son of Zohar,
parts: Thus he spoke with them, saying, “If you have it in mind for me to bury my dead out of my sight, then listen to me, and speak on my behalf to Ephron the son of Zohar,

verses.text: that he may give me the cave of Mach-pelah, which he has at the end of his field.
parts: that he may give me the cave of Mach-pelah, which he has at the end of his field.

verses.text: Now Ephron was sitting among the sons of Heth; and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the presence of the sons of Heth, and of all who entered at the gate of the city, saying, “No, my Lord, hear me, I give you both the field and the cave within it; I give it to you in the presence of all my fellow citizens.
parts: Now Ephron was sitting among the sons of Heth; and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the presence of the sons of Heth, and of all who entered at the gate of the city, saying, “No, my Lord, hear me, I give you both the field and the cave within it; I give it to you in the presence of all my fellow citizens.

verses.text: “No, my Lord, hear me, I give you both the field and the cave within it; I give it to you in the presence of all my fellow citizens.
parts: “No, my Lord, hear me, I give you both the field and the cave within it; I give it to you in the presence of all my fellow citizens.

verses.text: Then Abraham bowed himself before the people of the land,
parts: Then Abraham bowed himself before the people of the land,

verses.text: and he spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If you are for me, hear me.
parts: and he spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If you are for me, hear me.

verses.text: Ephron then answered Abraham, saying to him,
parts: Ephron then answered Abraham, saying to him,

verses.text: “My lord, listen to me, the land is worth four hundred silver drachmas; but what is that between you and me?
parts: “My lord, listen to me, the land is worth four hundred silver drachmas; but what is that between you and me?

verses.text: So Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out the silver for Ephron, which he had mentioned in the hearing of the sons of Heth, the four hundred silver drachmas, currency of the merchants.
parts: So Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out the silver for Ephron, which he had mentioned in the hearing of the sons of Heth, the four hundred silver drachmas, currency of the merchants.

verses.text: Thus the field of Ephron in Machpelah, which was opposite Mamre, the field and the cave in it, and all the trees in the field, which were within all the surrounding borders, were deeded to Abraham as his possession in the presence of the sons of Heth, before all who entered the city.
parts: Thus the field of Ephron in Machpelah, which was opposite Mamre, the field and the cave in it, and all the trees in the field, which were within all the surrounding borders, were deeded to Abraham as his possession in the presence of the sons of Heth, before all who entered the city.

verses.text: to Abraham as his possession in the presence of the sons of Heth, before all who entered the city.
parts: to Abraham as his possession in the presence of the sons of Heth, before all who entered the city.

verses.text: Then after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which was opposite Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
parts: Then after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which was opposite Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.

verses.text: So the field and the cave in it were deeded to Abraham by the sons of Heth as property for a burial place.
parts: So the field and the cave in it were deeded to Abraham by the sons of Heth as property for a burial place.

verses.text: Now Abraham was old, well advanced in age; and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.
parts: Now Abraham was old, well advanced in age; and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.

verses.text: So Abraham said to the oldest servant of his house, who ruled over all that he had, “Put your hand under my thigh,
parts: So Abraham said to the oldest servant of his house, who ruled over all that he had, “Put your hand under my thigh,

verses.text: and I will make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son Isaac from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell;
parts: and I will make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son Isaac from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell;

verses.text: but you shall go to my land where I was born, and to my tribe, and take from there a wife for my son Isaac.”
parts: but you shall go to my land where I was born, and to my tribe, and take from there a wife for my son Isaac.”

verses.text: And the servant said to him, “Perhaps the woman will not be willing to follow me to this land.
parts: And the servant said to him, “Perhaps the woman will not be willing to follow me to this land.

verses.text: But Abraham said to him, “Beware that you do not take my son back there.
parts: But Abraham said to him, “Beware that you do not take my son back there.

verses.text: The Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, who took me from my father's house and from the land where I was born, and who spoke to me and swore to me, saying, ‘To you and your seed I give this land,’ He will send His Angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.
parts: The Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, who took me from my father's house and from the land where I was born, and who spoke to me and swore to me, saying, ‘To you and your seed I give this land,’ He will send His Angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.

verses.text: And if the woman is not willing to follow you, then you will be released from this oath; only do not take my son back there.”
parts: And if the woman is not willing to follow you, then you will be released from this oath; only do not take my son back there.”

verses.text: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his lord, and swore to him concerning this matter.
parts: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his lord, and swore to him concerning this matter.

verses.text: Then the servant took ten of his lord's camels and some of all his goods and departed, and he went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.
parts: Then the servant took ten of his lord's camels and some of all his goods and departed, and he went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.

verses.text: And he made his camels kneel down outside the city by a well of water at evening time, the time when women go out to draw water.
parts: And he made his camels kneel down outside the city by a well of water at evening time, the time when women go out to draw water.

verses.text: Then he said, “O Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, give me success this day, and show mercy to my lord Abraham.
parts: Then he said, “O Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, give me success this day, and show mercy to my lord Abraham.

verses.text: Behold, here I stand by the well of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.
parts: Behold, here I stand by the well of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.

verses.text: Now let it be that the virgin to whom I say, ‘Let down your pitcher that I may drink,’ and she says, ‘Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink’—let her be the one You appointed for Your servant Isaac.
parts: Now let it be that the virgin to whom I say, ‘Let down your pitcher that I may drink,’ and she says, ‘Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink’—let her be the one You appointed for Your servant Isaac.

verses.text: Thus it happened, before he finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out with her pitcher on her shoulder.
parts: Thus it happened, before he finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out with her pitcher on her shoulder.

verses.text: Now the virgin was very beautiful to behold, and she was a virgin, for no man had known her.
parts: Now the virgin was very beautiful to behold, and she was a virgin, for no man had known her.

verses.text: Then the servant ran to meet her and said, “Let me drink a little water from your pitcher.”
parts: Then the servant ran to meet her and said, “Let me drink a little water from your pitcher.”

verses.text: So she said, “Drink, my lord.” Then she quickly let her pitcher down to her hand, and gave him a drink.
parts: So she said, “Drink, my lord.” Then she quickly let her pitcher down to her hand, and gave him a drink.

verses.text: When she finished giving him a drink, she said, “I will also draw water for your camels, until they finish drinking.”
parts: When she finished giving him a drink, she said, “I will also draw water for your camels, until they finish drinking.”

verses.text: Thus she quickly emptied her pitcher into the trough, ran back to the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
parts: Thus she quickly emptied her pitcher into the trough, ran back to the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.

verses.text: And the man, wondering at her, remained silent so as to know whether the Lord had made his journey prosperous or not.
parts: And the man, wondering at her, remained silent so as to know whether the Lord had made his journey prosperous or not.

verses.text: So it was, when the camels finished drinking, the man took golden earrings, each a drachma in weight, and two bracelets for her wrists, ten pieces of gold in their weight,
parts: So it was, when the camels finished drinking, the man took golden earrings, each a drachma in weight, and two bracelets for her wrists, ten pieces of gold in their weight,

verses.text: and said, “Whose daughter are you?
parts: and said, “Whose daughter are you?

verses.text: So she said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, Milcah's son, whom she bore to Nahor.”
parts: So she said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, Milcah's son, whom she bore to Nahor.”

verses.text: Moreover she said to him, “We have both straw and feed enough, and room to lodge.”
parts: Moreover she said to him, “We have both straw and feed enough, and room to lodge.”

verses.text: Then the man bowed down his head and worshiped the Lord.
parts: Then the man bowed down his head and worshiped the Lord.

verses.text: And he said, “Blessed is the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who has not allowed His righ-teousness and His truth to forsake my lord.
parts: And he said, “Blessed is the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who has not allowed His righ-teousness and His truth to forsake my lord.

verses.text: So the young woman ran and told her mother's household these things.
parts: So the young woman ran and told her mother's household these things.

verses.text: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban, and he ran out to the man by the well.
parts: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban, and he ran out to the man by the well.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when he saw the earrings and the bracelets on his sister's wrists, and when he heard the words of his sister Rebekah, saying, “Thus the man spoke to me,” that he went to the man, as he stood by the camels at the well.
parts: So it came to pass, when he saw the earrings and the bracelets on his sister's wrists, and when he heard the words of his sister Rebekah, saying, “Thus the man spoke to me,” that he went to the man, as he stood by the camels at the well.

verses.text: Laban said to him, “Come in, O blessed of the Lord!
parts: Laban said to him, “Come in, O blessed of the Lord!

verses.text: Then the man came to the house and unloaded the camels, and provided straw and feed for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men with him.
parts: Then the man came to the house and unloaded the camels, and provided straw and feed for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men with him.

verses.text: Bread was then set before them to eat, but he said, “I will not eat until I have told my business.” And he said, “Speak on.”
parts: Bread was then set before them to eat, but he said, “I will not eat until I have told my business.” And he said, “Speak on.”

verses.text: So he said, “I am Abraham's servant.
parts: So he said, “I am Abraham's servant.

verses.text: The Lord has blessed my lord greatly, and he has become great; and He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.
parts: The Lord has blessed my lord greatly, and he has become great; and He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.

verses.text: And Sarah my lord's wife bore a son to my lord when he was old; and to him he has given all he has.
parts: And Sarah my lord's wife bore a son to my lord when he was old; and to him he has given all he has.

verses.text: Now my lord made me swear an oath, saying, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I sojourn;
parts: Now my lord made me swear an oath, saying, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I sojourn;

verses.text: but you shall go to my father's house and to my tribe, and take a wife for my son.’
parts: but you shall go to my father's house and to my tribe, and take a wife for my son.’

verses.text: And I said to my lord, ‘Perhaps the woman will not return with me.’
parts: And I said to my lord, ‘Perhaps the woman will not return with me.’

verses.text: But he said to me, ‘The Lord, before whom I walk, will send His Angel with you and prosper your way; and you shall take a wife for my son from my tribe and from my father's house.
parts: But he said to me, ‘The Lord, before whom I walk, will send His Angel with you and prosper your way; and you shall take a wife for my son from my tribe and from my father's house.

verses.text: You will be clear from this oath when you arrive at my tribe; for if they will not give her to you, then you will be released from my oath.’
parts: You will be clear from this oath when you arrive at my tribe; for if they will not give her to you, then you will be released from my oath.’

verses.text: “So I came to the well today and said, ‘O Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, if You will now prosper the way I go, behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass that when the daughters of the men come to draw water, and the virgin to whom I will say, “Give me a little water from your pitcher to drink,” and she says to me, “Drink, and I will draw for your camels also,”—let her be the woman whom the Lord has appointed for His own servant Isaac; and in this I will know You have dealt mercifully with my lord Abraham.’ But before I finished speaking in my mind, there was Rebekah, coming out with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down to the well and drew water And I said to her, ‘Let me drink.’ And she made haste and let her pitcher down from her shoulder and said, ‘Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink.’ So I drank, and she gave the camels a drink also.

verses.text: Then I asked her, and said, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.’ So I put the earrings on her and the bracelets on her wrists.
parts: Then I asked her, and said, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.’ So I put the earrings on her and the bracelets on her wrists.

verses.text: “Thus being well pleased I worshiped the Lord, and blessed the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who led me in the way of truth, to take the daughter of my lord's brother for his son.
parts: “Thus being well pleased I worshiped the Lord, and blessed the Lord, the God of my lord Abraham, who led me in the way of truth, to take the daughter of my lord's brother for his son.

verses.text: Now if you will deal mercifully and justly with my lord, tell me.
parts: Now if you will deal mercifully and justly with my lord, tell me.

verses.text: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, “The command comes from the Lord; we cannot speak to you either good or bad.
parts: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, “The command comes from the Lord; we cannot speak to you either good or bad.

verses.text: Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be your lord's son's wife, as the Lord has spoken.”
parts: Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be your lord's son's wife, as the Lord has spoken.”

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Abraham's servant heard their words, that he bowed to the earth and worshiped the Lord.
parts: And it came to pass, when Abraham's servant heard their words, that he bowed to the earth and worshiped the Lord.

verses.text: Then the servant brought out jewelry of silver and gold and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah.
parts: Then the servant brought out jewelry of silver and gold and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah.

verses.text: And he and the men with him ate and drank and stayed all night.
parts: And he and the men with him ate and drank and stayed all night.

verses.text: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the virgin remain with us about ten days; after that she may go.”
parts: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the virgin remain with us about ten days; after that she may go.”

verses.text: And he said to them, “Do not hinder me, since the Lord has prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my lord.”
parts: And he said to them, “Do not hinder me, since the Lord has prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my lord.”

verses.text: So they said, “We will call the young woman and ask her personally.”
parts: So they said, “We will call the young woman and ask her personally.”

verses.text: Then they called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” She said, “I will go.”
parts: Then they called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” She said, “I will go.”

verses.text: Thus they sent away Rebekah their sister and her goods and Abraham's servant and those with him.
parts: Thus they sent away Rebekah their sister and her goods and Abraham's servant and those with him.

verses.text: They blessed Rebekah their sister and said to her, “Our sister, may you become the mother of thousands of myriads, and may your seed possess the gates of their enemies.”
parts: They blessed Rebekah their sister and said to her, “Our sister, may you become the mother of thousands of myriads, and may your seed possess the gates of their enemies.”

verses.text: Then Rebekah and her maids arose, and rode on the camels and went with the man.
parts: Then Rebekah and her maids arose, and rode on the camels and went with the man.

verses.text: Now Isaac came through the desert to the Well of the Vision, for he dwelt in the South. Isaac then went out to meditate in the field in the evening, and he lifted his eyes and saw camels coming.
parts: Now Isaac came through the desert to the Well of the Vision, for he dwelt in the South.
Isaac then went out to meditate in the field in the evening, and he lifted his eyes and saw camels coming.

parts: Isaac then went out to meditate in the field in the evening, and he lifted his eyes and saw camels coming.

verses.text: Then Rebekah lifted her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from her camel;
parts: Then Rebekah lifted her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from her camel;

verses.text: for she had said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field to meet us?” The servant said, “It is my lord.” So she took a veil and covered herself.
parts: for she had said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field to meet us?” The servant said, “It is my lord.” So she took a veil and covered herself.

verses.text: Now the servant told Isaac all the things he had done.
parts: Now the servant told Isaac all the things he had done.

verses.text: Thus Isaac brought Rebekah into his mother Sarah's tent, and he took her and she became his wife.
parts: Thus Isaac brought Rebekah into his mother Sarah's tent, and he took her and she became his wife.

verses.text: Now Abraham again took a wife, and her name was Keturah. So she bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
parts: Now Abraham again took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
So she bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

verses.text: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan.
parts: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan.

verses.text: And the sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abidah, and Eldaah.
parts: And the sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abidah, and Eldaah.

verses.text: Now Abraham gave all his possessions to Isaac. But Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his concubines; and while he was still living, he sent them eastward, away from Isaac his son, to the country of the east.
parts: Now Abraham gave all his possessions to Isaac.
But Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his concubines; and while he was still living, he sent them eastward, away from Isaac his son, to the country of the east.

verses.text: But Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his concubines; and while he was still living, he sent them eastward, away from Isaac his son, to the country of the east.
parts: But Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his concubines; and while he was still living, he sent them eastward, away from Isaac his son, to the country of the east.

verses.text: After these things, the sum of years Abraham lived were one hundred and seventy-five years. Then Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, old and full of days and was added to his people.
parts: After these things, the sum of years Abraham lived were one hundred and seventy-five years.
Then Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, old and full of days and was added to his people.

verses.text: Then Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, old and full of days and was added to his people.
parts: Then Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, old and full of days and was added to his people.

verses.text: So his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, opposite Mamre, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite,
parts: So his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, opposite Mamre, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite,

verses.text: the field and the cave Abraham purchased from the sons of Heth.
parts: the field and the cave Abraham purchased from the sons of Heth.

verses.text: Thus it came to pass, after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt at the Well of the Vision.
parts: Thus it came to pass, after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt at the Well of the Vision.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar, Sarah's maidservant, bore to Abraham.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar, Sarah's maidservant, bore to Abraham.

verses.text: These were the names of Ishmael's sons, by their names, according to their families: Ishmael's firstborn, Nebajoth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
parts: These were the names of Ishmael's sons, by their names, according to their families: Ishmael's firstborn, Nebajoth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
parts: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

verses.text: Hadar, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kede-mah.
parts: Hadar, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kede-mah.

verses.text: These were the sons of Ishmael, and these were their names, by their towns and settlements, twelve princes according to their nations.
parts: These were the sons of Ishmael, and these were their names, by their towns and settlements, twelve princes according to their nations.

verses.text: These were the years of Ishmael's life: one hundred and thirty-seven years; and he breathed his last and died, and was added to his people.
parts: These were the years of Ishmael's life: one hundred and thirty-seven years; and he breathed his last and died, and was added to his people.

verses.text: (He dwelt opposite Egypt, from Havilah as far as Shur, as you go toward Assyria, and dwelt separate from all his brothers.)
parts: (He dwelt opposite Egypt, from Havilah as far as Shur, as you go toward Assyria, and dwelt separate from all his brothers.)

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Isaac, Abraham's son.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Isaac, Abraham's son.

verses.text: Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah as his wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Mesopotamia, and the sister of Laban the Syrian.
parts: Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah as his wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Mesopotamia, and the sister of Laban the Syrian.

verses.text: Now Isaac pleaded with the Lord for his wife, because she was barren; and God granted his plea, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
parts: Now Isaac pleaded with the Lord for his wife, because she was barren; and God granted his plea, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

verses.text: But the children struggled together within her; and she said, “If all is well, why am I like this?” So she went to inquire of the Lord.
parts: But the children struggled together within her; and she said, “If all is well, why am I like this?” So she went to inquire of the Lord.

verses.text: And the Lord said to her:
parts: And the Lord said to her:

verses.text: Thus, when her days were fulfilled to give birth, indeed, there were twins in her womb.
parts: Thus, when her days were fulfilled to give birth, indeed, there were twins in her womb.

verses.text: Now the firstborn came out red.
parts: Now the firstborn came out red.

verses.text: Afterward his brother came out, and his hand took hold of Esau's heel; so she called his name Jacob.
parts: Afterward his brother came out, and his hand took hold of Esau's heel; so she called his name Jacob.

verses.text: So the boys grew.
parts: So the boys grew.

verses.text: Now Isaac loved Esau because he ate his venison, but Rebekah loved Jacob.
parts: Now Isaac loved Esau because he ate his venison, but Rebekah loved Jacob.

verses.text: Then Jacob cooked a stew; and Esau came in from the field, and was weary.
parts: Then Jacob cooked a stew; and Esau came in from the field, and was weary.

verses.text: So Esau said to Jacob, “Let me taste this red stew, for I am exhausted.” Therefore his name was called Edom.
parts: So Esau said to Jacob, “Let me taste this red stew, for I am exhausted.” Therefore his name was called Edom.

verses.text: But Jacob said to Esau, “Sell me your birthright today.”
parts: But Jacob said to Esau, “Sell me your birthright today.”

verses.text: Esau replied, “Look, I am about to die.
parts: Esau replied, “Look, I am about to die.

verses.text: Then Jacob said, “Swear to me today.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
parts: Then Jacob said, “Swear to me today.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land, besides the first famine in the days of Abraham; and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.
parts: Now there was a famine in the land, besides the first famine in the days of Abraham; and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.

verses.text: Then the Lord appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; live in the land where I will tell you.
parts: Then the Lord appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; live in the land where I will tell you.

verses.text: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; for to you and your seed I give all these lands; and I will perform the oath I swore to Abraham your father.
parts: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; for to you and your seed I give all these lands; and I will perform the oath I swore to Abraham your father.

verses.text: And I will make your seed multiply as the stars of heaven; I will give your seed all these lands; and in your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed;
parts: And I will make your seed multiply as the stars of heaven; I will give your seed all these lands; and in your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed;

verses.text: because Abraham your father obeyed My voice and kept My charge, My commandments, My ordinances, and My laws.”
parts: because Abraham your father obeyed My voice and kept My charge, My commandments, My ordinances, and My laws.”

verses.text: So Isaac dwelt in Gerar.
parts: So Isaac dwelt in Gerar.

verses.text: Now the men of the place asked about his wife, and he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “She is my wife,” lest the men of the place should kill him for Rebekah, because she was beautiful to behold.
parts: Now the men of the place asked about his wife, and he said, “She
my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “She is my wife,” lest the men of the place should kill him for Rebekah, because she was beautiful to behold.

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of Gerar looked through a window and saw Isaac, showing endearment to Rebekah his wife.
parts: Now it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of Gerar looked through a window and saw Isaac, showing endearment to Rebekah his wife.

verses.text: Then Abimelech called Isaac and said, “Quite obviously she is your wife; so how could you say, ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac said to him, “Because I said to myself, ‘Lest I should die on account of her.’ ”
parts: Then Abimelech called Isaac and said, “Quite obviously she is your wife; so how could you say, ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac said to him, “Because I said to myself, ‘Lest I should die on account of her.’ ”

verses.text: Thus Abimelech said, “Why have you done this to us?
parts: Thus Abimelech said, “Why have you done this to us?

verses.text: So Abimelech charged all his people, saying, “He who touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.”
parts: So Abimelech charged all his people, saying, “He who touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.”

verses.text: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year a hundredfold; and the Lord blessed him.
parts: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year a hundredfold; and the Lord blessed him.

verses.text: The man began to prosper, and continued prospering until he became very prosperous;
parts: The man began to prosper, and continued prospering until he became very prosperous;

verses.text: for he had herds of sheep and oxen and many fields.
parts: for he had herds of sheep and oxen and many fields.

verses.text: Now the Philis-tines had stopped up all the wells his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, and they had filled them with earth.
parts: Now the Philis-tines had stopped up all the wells his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, and they had filled them with earth.

verses.text: Then Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you are much mightier than we.”
parts: Then Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you are much mightier than we.”

verses.text: Then Isaac departed from there and pitched his tent in the Valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
parts: Then Isaac departed from there and pitched his tent in the Valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

verses.text: Again, Isaac dug the wells of water they had dug in the days of Abraham his father, for the Philistines had stopped them up after the death of Abraham.
parts: Again, Isaac dug the wells of water they had dug in the days of Abraham his father, for the Philistines had stopped them up after the death of Abraham.

verses.text: Also, Isaac's servants dug in the valley of Gerar, and found a well of fresh water there.
parts: Also, Isaac's servants dug in the valley of Gerar, and found a well of fresh water there.

verses.text: But the herdsmen of Gerar fought with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” So he called the name of the well Injustice, because they quarreled with him.
parts: But the herdsmen of Gerar fought with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” So he called the name of the well Injustice, because they quarreled with him.

verses.text: Then they dug another well, and they quarreled over that one also.
parts: Then they dug another well, and they quarreled over that one also.

verses.text: So he moved from there and dug another well, and they did not fight over it.
parts: So he moved from there and dug another well, and they did not fight over it.

verses.text: Then he went up from there to the Well of Oath.
parts: Then he went up from there to the Well of Oath.

verses.text: Now the Lord appeared to him the same night and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham; do not fear, for I am with you.
parts: Now the Lord appeared to him the same night and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham; do not fear, for I am with you.

verses.text: So he built an altar there and called on the name of the Lord; and he pitched his tent there; and there Isaac's servants dug a well.
parts: So he built an altar there and called on the name of the Lord; and he pitched his tent there; and there Isaac's servants dug a well.

verses.text: Then Abimelech came to him from Gerar with Ahuzzath his friend, and Phichol the commander-in-chief of his army.
parts: Then Abimelech came to him from Gerar with Ahuzzath his friend, and Phichol the commander-in-chief of his army.

verses.text: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, since you hate me and have sent me away from you?”
parts: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, since you hate me and have sent me away from you?”

verses.text: But they said, “We have certainly seen the Lord is with you.
parts: But they said, “We have certainly seen the Lord is with you.

verses.text: that you will do us no harm, since we have not touched you, and since we have done nothing to you but good, and have sent you away in peace.
parts: that you will do us no harm, since we have not touched you, and since we have done nothing to you but good, and have sent you away in peace.

verses.text: So he made them a feast, and they ate and drank.
parts: So he made them a feast, and they ate and drank.

verses.text: Then they arose early in the morning and swore an oath with one another; and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
parts: Then they arose early in the morning and swore an oath with one another; and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

verses.text: It came to pass the same day, Isaac's servants came and told him about the well they dug, and said to him, “We have found water.”
parts: It came to pass the same day, Isaac's servants came and told him about the well they dug, and said to him, “We have found water.”

verses.text: So he called it, Oath; therefore, the name of the city is the Well of Oath to this day.
parts: So he called it, Oath; therefore, the name of the city is the Well of Oath to this day.

verses.text: Now when Esau was forty years old, he took as wives Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite. But they were contentious with Isaac and Rebekah.
parts: Now when Esau was forty years old, he took as wives Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite.
But they were contentious with Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.text: But they were contentious with Isaac and Rebekah.
parts: But they were contentious with Isaac and Rebekah.

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Isaac was old and his eyes were so dim he could not see, that he called Esau his older son and said to him, “My son.” And he answered him, “Here I am.” Then he said, “Behold now, I am old.
parts: Now it came to pass, when Isaac was old and his eyes were so dim he could not see, that he called Esau his older son and said to him, “My son.” And he answered him, “Here I am.”
Then he said, “Behold now, I am old.

verses.text: Now therefore, take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field and hunt game for me.
parts: Now therefore, take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field and hunt game for me.

verses.text: Then make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me that I may eat, that my soul may bless you before I die.”
parts: Then make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me that I may eat, that my soul may bless you before I die.”

verses.text: Now Rebekah was listening when Isaac spoke to Esau his son; and Esau went to the field to hunt game for his father.
parts: Now Rebekah was listening when Isaac spoke to Esau his son; and Esau went to the field to hunt game for his father.

verses.text: So Rebekah spoke to Jacob her younger son, saying, “Indeed, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying,
parts: So Rebekah spoke to Jacob her younger son, saying, “Indeed, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying,

verses.text: ‘Bring me game and make savory food for me, that I may eat it and bless you in the presence of the Lord before my death.’
parts: ‘Bring me game and make savory food for me, that I may eat it and bless you in the presence of the Lord before my death.’

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to what I command you.
parts: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to what I command you.

verses.text: Go now to the sheep and bring me from there two kids, choice and good, and I will make savory food from them for your father, such as he loves.
parts: Go now to the sheep and bring me from there two kids, choice and good, and I will make savory food from them for your father, such as he loves.

verses.text: Then you shall take it to your father, that he may eat it and bless you before his death.”
parts: Then you shall take it to your father, that he may eat it and bless you before his death.”

verses.text: Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, “Look, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth-skinned man.
parts: Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, “Look, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth-skinned man.

verses.text: Perhaps my father will feel me, and I shall seem to be a deceiver to him; and I shall bring a curse on myself and not a blessing.”
parts: Perhaps my father will feel me, and I shall seem to be a deceiver to him; and I shall bring a curse on myself and not a blessing.”

verses.text: But his mother said to him, “Your curse be on me, my son; only obey my voice, and go, get them for me.”
parts: But his mother said to him, “Your curse be on me, my son; only obey my voice, and go, get them for me.”

verses.text: So he went and got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother made savory food, such as his father loved.
parts: So he went and got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother made savory food, such as his father loved.

verses.text: Then Rebekah took the choice clothes of her elder son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son.
parts: Then Rebekah took the choice clothes of her elder son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son.

verses.text: She also put the skins of the kids on his hands and on the exposed part of his neck.
parts: She also put the skins of the kids on his hands and on the exposed part of his neck.

verses.text: Then she gave the savory food and the bread she had prepared into the hands of her son Jacob.
parts: Then she gave the savory food and the bread she had prepared into the hands of her son Jacob.

verses.text: Thus he went to his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am.
parts: Thus he went to his father and said, “My father.” And he said, “Here I am.

verses.text: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau your firstborn; I have done just as you told me; arise, sit and eat of my game, that your soul may bless me.”
parts: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau your firstborn; I have done just as you told me; arise, sit and eat of my game, that your soul may bless me.”

verses.text: But Isaac said to his son, “How is it you have found it so quickly, my son?” He said, “Because the Lord your God brought it to me.”
parts: But Isaac said to his son, “How is it you have found it so quickly, my son?” He said, “Because the Lord your God brought it to me.”

verses.text: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Come near, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are my son Esau or not.”
parts: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Come near, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are my son Esau or not.”

verses.text: So Jacob went near to Isaac his father, and he felt him and said, “The voice is Jacob's, but the hands are Esau's.”
parts: So Jacob went near to Isaac his father, and he felt him and said, “The voice is Jacob's, but the hands are Esau's.”

verses.text: Thus he did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like his brother Esau's hands; so he blessed him.
parts: Thus he did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like his brother Esau's hands; so he blessed him.

verses.text: Then he said, “Are you my son Esau?” He said, “I am.”
parts: Then he said, “Are you my son Esau?” He said, “I am.”

verses.text: He said, “Bring your game to me, my son, and I will eat from it, that my soul may bless you.” So he brought it near to him, and he ate; and he brought him wine, and he drank.
parts: He said, “Bring your game to me, my son, and I will eat from it, that my soul may bless you.” So he brought it near to him, and he ate; and he brought him wine, and he drank.

verses.text: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come near and kiss me, my son.”
parts: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come near and kiss me, my son.”

verses.text: So he came near and kissed him; and he smelled the smell of his clothing.
parts: So he came near and kissed him; and he smelled the smell of his clothing.

verses.text: Now it happened, as soon as Isaac finished blessing Jacob his son, and Jacob had scarcely gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
parts: Now it happened, as soon as Isaac finished blessing Jacob his son, and Jacob had scarcely gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

verses.text: He also had made savory food, and brought it to his father, and said to his father, “Let my father arise and eat of his son's game, that your soul may bless me.”
parts: He also had made savory food, and brought it to his father, and said to his father, “Let my father arise and eat of his son's game, that your soul may bless me.”

verses.text: And his father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” So he said, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”
parts: And his father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” So he said, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”

verses.text: Then Isaac trembled exceedingly, and said, “Who?
parts: Then Isaac trembled exceedingly, and said, “Who?

verses.text: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceedingly great and bitter cry, and said to his father, “Bless me—me also, O my father!”
parts: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceedingly great and bitter cry, and said to his father, “Bless me—me also, O my father!”

verses.text: But he said, “Your brother came with deceit and has taken away your blessing.”
parts: But he said, “Your brother came with deceit and has taken away your blessing.”

verses.text: Then Esau said, “Is he not rightly named Jacob?
parts: Then Esau said, “Is he not rightly named Jacob?

verses.text: Then Isaac answered and said to Esau, “Indeed, I have made him your lord, and all his brethren I have given to him as servants; with grain and wine I have sustained him.
parts: Then Isaac answered and said to Esau, “Indeed, I have made him your lord, and all his brethren I have given to him as servants; with grain and wine I have sustained him.

verses.text: Esau said to his father, “Have you only one blessing, my father?
parts: Esau said to his father, “Have you only one blessing, my father?

verses.text: Then Isaac his father answered and said to him:
parts: Then Isaac his father answered and said to him:

verses.text: Thus Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him; and Esau said in his mind, “Let the days of mourning for my father draw near, then I will kill my brother Jacob.” So the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah, and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, “Surely, your brother Esau is threatening to kill you.
parts: Thus Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him; and Esau said in his mind, “Let the days of mourning for my father draw near, then I will kill my brother Jacob.” So the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah, and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, “Surely, your brother Esau is threatening to kill you.

verses.text: So the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah, and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, “Surely, your brother Esau is threatening to kill you.
parts: So the words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah, and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, “Surely, your brother Esau is threatening to kill you.

verses.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee to Mesopotamia to my brother Laban in Haran.
parts: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee to Mesopotamia to my brother Laban in Haran.

verses.text: And stay with him a few days, until your brother's anger
parts: And stay with him a few days, until your brother's anger

verses.text: and wrath turn away from you, and he forgets what you did to him; then I will send and bring you from there.
parts: and wrath turn away from you, and he forgets what you did to him; then I will send and bring you from there.

verses.text: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth; if Jacob takes a wife from the daughters of this land, what good will my life be to me?”
