parts: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth; if Jacob takes a wife from the daughters of this land, what good will my life be to me?”

verses.text: Now Isaac called Jacob and blessed him, and charged him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.
parts: Now Isaac called Jacob and blessed him, and charged him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.

verses.text: Arise, go to Mesopotamia, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father; and take yourself a wife from there of the daughters of Laban your mother's brother.
parts: Arise, go to Mesopotamia, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father; and take yourself a wife from there of the daughters of Laban your mother's brother.

verses.text: May God bless you, and increase and multiply you, that you may be an assembly of nations;
parts: May God bless you, and increase and multiply you, that you may be an assembly of nations;

verses.text: and give you the blessing of Abraham, to you and your seed with you, that you may inherit the land of your sojourning, which God gave to Abraham.”
parts: and give you the blessing of Abraham, to you and your seed with you, that you may inherit the land of your sojourning, which God gave to Abraham.”

verses.text: So Isaac sent Jacob away, and he went to Mesopotamia, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.
parts: So Isaac sent Jacob away, and he went to Mesopotamia, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.

verses.text: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Mesopotamia to take himself a wife from there, and as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan,” and Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and had gone to Mesopotamia.
parts: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Mesopotamia to take himself a wife from there, and as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, “You shall not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan,” and Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and had gone to Mesopotamia.

verses.text: and Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and had gone to Mesopotamia.
parts: and Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and had gone to Mesopotamia.

verses.text: Also, Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan did not please his father Isaac.
parts: Also, Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan did not please his father Isaac.

verses.text: So Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife in addition to the wives he had.
parts: So Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife in addition to the wives he had.

verses.text: Now Jacob went out from the Well of Oath and went toward Haran. So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set.
parts: Now Jacob went out from the Well of Oath and went toward Haran.
So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set.

verses.text: So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set.
parts: So he came to a certain place and stayed there all night, because the sun had set.

verses.text: Then he dreamed, and behold, a ladder was set up on the earth, and its top reached to heaven; and there the angels of God were ascending and descending on it.
parts: Then he dreamed, and behold, a ladder was set up on the earth, and its top reached to heaven; and there the angels of God were ascending and descending on it.

verses.text: So behold, the Lord stood above it and said, “I am the Lord God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac.
parts: So behold, the Lord stood above it and said, “I am the Lord God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac.

verses.text: Also, your seed shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread abroad to the west and the east, to the north and the south; and in you and in your seed all the tribes of the earth shall be blessed.
parts: Also, your seed shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread abroad to the west and the east, to the north and the south; and in you and in your seed all the tribes of the earth shall be blessed.

verses.text: Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have spoken to you.”
parts: Behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done what I have spoken to you.”

verses.text: Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “The Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.” So he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place!
parts: Then Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “The Lord is in this place, and I did not know it.” So he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place!

verses.text: So he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place!
parts: So he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place!

verses.text: Now Jacob rose early in the morning, and took the stone he put at his head, set it up as a pillar, and poured oil on top of it.
parts: Now Jacob rose early in the morning, and took the stone he put at his head, set it up as a pillar, and poured oil on top of it.

verses.text: Thus Jacob called the name of that place Bethel; but the name of that city was Luz previously.
parts: Thus Jacob called the name of that place Bethel; but the name of that city was Luz previously.

verses.text: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, “If the Lord God will be with me, and keep me in this way I am going, and give me bread to eat and clothing to put on, and bring me back in safety to my father's house, then the Lord shall be my God.
parts: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, “If the Lord God will be with me, and keep me in this way I am going, and give me bread to eat and clothing to put on, and bring me back in safety to my father's house, then the Lord shall be my God.

verses.text: and bring me back in safety to my father's house, then the Lord shall be my God.
parts: and bring me back in safety to my father's house, then the Lord shall be my God.

verses.text: And this stone I set as a pillar shall be God's house to me, and of all You give me I will surely give a tithe to You.”
parts: And this stone I set as a pillar shall be God's house to me, and of all You give me I will surely give a tithe to You.”

verses.text: Now Jacob went on his journey and came to the land of the east, to Laban.
parts: Now Jacob went on his journey and came to the land of the east, to Laban.

verses.text: So he looked and saw a well in the field; and behold, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it, for out of that well they watered the flocks; and a large stone was on the well's mouth.
parts: So he looked and saw a well in the field; and behold, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it, for out of that well they watered the flocks; and a large stone was on the well's mouth.

verses.text: Now all the flocks would be gathered there; and they would roll the stone from the well's mouth, water the sheep, and put the stone back in its place on the well's mouth.
parts: Now all the flocks would be gathered there; and they would roll the stone from the well's mouth, water the sheep, and put the stone back in its place on the well's mouth.

verses.text: So Jacob said to them, “My brethren, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.” Then he said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.” So he said to them, “Is he well?” They said, “He is well.
parts: So Jacob said to them, “My brethren, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.” Then he said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.” So he said to them, “Is he well?” They said, “He is well.

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.”
parts: Then he said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “We know him.”

verses.text: So he said to them, “Is he well?” They said, “He is well.
parts: So he said to them, “Is he well?” They said, “He is well.

verses.text: Then he said, “It is still high day; it is not time for the cattle to be gathered together.
parts: Then he said, “It is still high day; it is not time for the cattle to be gathered together.

verses.text: But they said, “We cannot, until all the shepherds are gathered together, and they have rolled the stone from the well's mouth; then we will water the sheep.”
parts: But they said, “We cannot, until all the shepherds are gathered together, and they have rolled the stone from the well's mouth; then we will water the sheep.”

verses.text: Now while he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she was a shepherdess.
parts: Now while he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she was a shepherdess.

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban, his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother's brother, Jacob went near and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban, his mother's brother.
parts: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban, his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother's brother, Jacob went near and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban, his mother's brother.

verses.text: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice and wept.
parts: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice and wept.

verses.text: So Jacob told Rachel he was her father's relative and Rebekah's son, and she ran and told her father these words.
parts: So Jacob told Rachel he was her father's relative and Rebekah's son, and she ran and told her father these words.

verses.text: Then it came to pass, when Laban heard the report about Jacob, his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house.
parts: Then it came to pass, when Laban heard the report about Jacob, his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house.

verses.text: Now Laban said to him, “Surely you are my bone and my flesh.” And he stayed with him for a month.
parts: Now Laban said to him, “Surely you are my bone and my flesh.” And he stayed with him for a month.

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing?
parts: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing?

verses.text: Now Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
parts: Now Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

verses.text: Leah's eyes were delicate, but Rachel was beautiful in form and appearance.
parts: Leah's eyes were delicate, but Rachel was beautiful in form and appearance.

verses.text: Now Jacob loved Rachel; so he said, “I will serve you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.”
parts: Now Jacob loved Rachel; so he said, “I will serve you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.”

verses.text: So Laban said, “It is better that I give her to you than to another man.
parts: So Laban said, “It is better that I give her to you than to another man.

verses.text: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed only a few days to him because of the love he had for her.
parts: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed only a few days to him because of the love he had for her.

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her.”
parts: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her.”

verses.text: Now Laban gathered together all the men of the place and made a wedding feast.
parts: Now Laban gathered together all the men of the place and made a wedding feast.

verses.text: Thus it came to pass in the evening, he took Leah his daughter and brought her to Jacob; and he went in to her.
parts: Thus it came to pass in the evening, he took Leah his daughter and brought her to Jacob; and he went in to her.

verses.text: So Laban gave his maid Zilpah to his daughter Leah as a handmaiden.
parts: So Laban gave his maid Zilpah to his daughter Leah as a handmaiden.

verses.text: Then it came to pass in the morning, behold, it was Leah; and he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me?
parts: Then it came to pass in the morning, behold, it was Leah; and he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me?

verses.text: Laban replied, “It must not be done so in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
parts: Laban replied, “It must not be done so in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.

verses.text: Fulfill her week, and I will give you this one also for the service you will render me still another seven years.”
parts: Fulfill her week, and I will give you this one also for the service you will render me still another seven years.”

verses.text: Then Jacob did so and fulfilled her week.
parts: Then Jacob did so and fulfilled her week.

verses.text: Laban also gave his handmaiden Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as a handmaiden.
parts: Laban also gave his handmaiden Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as a handmaiden.

verses.text: Then Jacob also went in to Rachel, and he loved Rachel more than Leah; and he served with Laban still another seven years.
parts: Then Jacob also went in to Rachel, and he loved Rachel more than Leah; and he served with Laban still another seven years.

verses.text: But when the Lord saw Leah was hated, He opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
parts: But when the Lord saw Leah was hated, He opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.

verses.text: So Leah conceived and bore Jacob a son, and she called his name Reuben; for she said, “The Lord has surely looked on my humiliation.
parts: So Leah conceived and bore Jacob a son, and she called his name Reuben; for she said, “The Lord has surely looked on my humiliation.

verses.text: Then she conceived again and bore Jacob a second son, and said, “Because the Lord heard I was hated, He has therefore given me this son also.” So she called his name Simeon.
parts: Then she conceived again and bore Jacob a second son, and said, “Because the Lord heard I was hated, He has therefore given me this son also.” So she called his name Simeon.

verses.text: She conceived again and bore a son, and said, “Now this time my husband will be on my side, because I have borne him three sons.” Therefore she called his name Levi.
parts: She conceived again and bore a son, and said, “Now this time my husband will be on my side, because I have borne him three sons.” Therefore she called his name Levi.

verses.text: Now she conceived again and bore a son, and said, “Now I will give thanks to the Lord.” Therefore she called his name Judah.
parts: Now she conceived again and bore a son, and said, “Now I will give thanks to the Lord.” Therefore she called his name Judah.

verses.text: Now when Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister, and said to Jacob, “Give me children, or else I die.” So Jacob's anger was aroused against Rachel, and he said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?” She replied to Jacob, “Here is my maid Bilhah; go in to her, and she will bear on my knees, that I also may have children by her.” She then gave him Bilhah her maid as wife, and Jacob went in to her.
parts: Now when Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister, and said to Jacob, “Give me children, or else I die.” So Jacob's anger was aroused against Rachel, and he said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?” She replied to Jacob, “Here is my maid Bilhah; go in to her, and she will bear on my knees, that I also may have children by her.” She then gave him Bilhah her maid as wife, and Jacob went in to her.

verses.text: Thus Bilhah, Rachel's handmaiden, conceived and bore Jacob a son.
parts: Thus Bilhah, Rachel's handmaiden, conceived and bore Jacob a son.

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “God has judged me; and He has heard my voice and given me a son.” Therefore, she called his name Dan.
parts: Then Rachel said, “God has judged me; and He has heard my voice and given me a son.” Therefore, she called his name Dan.

verses.text: Now Rachel's handmaiden Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
parts: Now Rachel's handmaiden Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.

verses.text: Then Rachel said, “God has helped me, and I have wrestled with my sister; and indeed, I have prevailed.” So she called his name Naphtali.
parts: Then Rachel said, “God has helped me, and I have wrestled with my sister; and indeed, I have prevailed.” So she called his name Naphtali.

verses.text: Now when Leah saw she had stopped bearing, she took Zilpah her handmaiden and gave her to Jacob as wife.
parts: Now when Leah saw she had stopped bearing, she took Zilpah her handmaiden and gave her to Jacob as wife.

verses.text: So Jacob went in to her, and Zilpah, Leah's handmaiden, conceived and bore Jacob a son.
parts: So Jacob went in to her, and Zilpah, Leah's handmaiden, conceived and bore Jacob a son.

verses.text: Then Leah said, “Good fortune!” Thus she called his name Gad.
parts: Then Leah said, “Good fortune!” Thus she called his name Gad.

verses.text: Now Zilpah, Leah's handmaiden, bore Jacob a second son.
parts: Now Zilpah, Leah's handmaiden, bore Jacob a second son.

verses.text: Then Leah said, “I am blessed, for the women will call me blessed.” So she called his name Asher.
parts: Then Leah said, “I am blessed, for the women will call me blessed.” So she called his name Asher.

verses.text: Now Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother Leah.
parts: Now Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother Leah.

verses.text: But she said to her, “Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband?
parts: But she said to her, “Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband?

verses.text: Now when Jacob came out of the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You must come in to me, for I have surely hired you with my son's mandrakes.” So he lay with her that night.
parts: Now when Jacob came out of the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You must come in to me, for I have surely hired you with my son's mandrakes.” So he lay with her that night.

verses.text: Thus God listened to Leah, and she conceived and bore Jacob a fifth son.
parts: Thus God listened to Leah, and she conceived and bore Jacob a fifth son.

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has given me my wages, because I have given my handmaiden to my husband.” So she called his name Issachar.
parts: Then Leah said, “God has given me my wages, because I have given my handmaiden to my husband.” So she called his name Issachar.

verses.text: Now Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son.
parts: Now Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son.

verses.text: Then Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good endowment; now my husband will choose me, because I have borne him six sons.” So she called his name Zebulun.
parts: Then Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good endowment; now my husband will choose me, because I have borne him six sons.” So she called his name Zebulun.

verses.text: Afterward she bore a daughter, and called her name Dinah.
parts: Afterward she bore a daughter, and called her name Dinah.

verses.text: Then God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her and opened her womb.
parts: Then God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her and opened her womb.

verses.text: Thus she conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my reproach.”
parts: Thus she conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my reproach.”

verses.text: So she called his name Joseph, and said, “The Lord shall add another son to me.”
parts: So she called his name Joseph, and said, “The Lord shall add another son to me.”

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away, that I may go to my own place and to my country.
parts: Now it came to pass, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away, that I may go to my own place and to my country.

verses.text: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know the service I rendered you.”
parts: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know the service I rendered you.”

verses.text: Then Laban said to him, “If I could find grace in your eyes, I would seek for it divinely, for God has blessed me by your coming.”
parts: Then Laban said to him, “If I could find grace in your eyes, I would seek for it divinely, for God has blessed me by your coming.”

verses.text: So he said, “Name me your wages, and I will give it.”
parts: So he said, “Name me your wages, and I will give it.”

verses.text: Jacob replied, “You know how I have served you and how numerous your cattle became with me.
parts: Jacob replied, “You know how I have served you and how numerous your cattle became with me.

verses.text: For what you had before I came was little, and it has increased to a great amount; the Lord has blessed you since my coming.
parts: For what you had before I came was little, and it has increased to a great amount; the Lord has blessed you since my coming.

verses.text: Thus Laban said to him, “What shall I give you?” Jacob replied, “You shall not give me anything.
parts: Thus Laban said to him, “What shall I give you?” Jacob replied, “You shall not give me anything.

verses.text: Let me pass through all your flocks today, removing from them all the gray sheep, and all the spotted and speckled among the goats; and these shall be my wages.
parts: Let me pass through all your flocks today, removing from them all the gray sheep, and all the spotted and speckled among the goats; and these shall be my wages.

verses.text: So my righteousness will answer for me in time to come, when the subject of my wages comes before you: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and gray among the sheep, will be considered stolen, if it is with me.”
parts: So my righteousness will answer for me in time to come, when the subject of my wages comes before you: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and gray among the sheep, will be considered stolen, if it is with me.”

verses.text: Then Laban said to him, “Let it be according to your word.”
parts: Then Laban said to him, “Let it be according to your word.”

verses.text: So he removed that day all the male goats that were speckled and spotted, all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had some white in it, and all the gray ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hands of his sons.
parts: So he removed that day all the male goats that were speckled and spotted, all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had some white in it, and all the gray ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hands of his sons.

verses.text: Then he put three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.
parts: Then he put three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.

verses.text: Now Jacob took for himself rods of green poplar and of the almond and chestnut trees, peeled white strips in them, tearing off the bark.
parts: Now Jacob took for himself rods of green poplar and of the almond and chestnut trees, peeled white strips in them, tearing off the bark.

verses.text: Then he placed the rods he had peeled in the gutters of the watering troughs where the flocks came to drink, so they should conceive at the rods as they came to drink.
parts: Then he placed the rods he had peeled in the gutters of the watering troughs where the flocks came to drink, so they should conceive at the rods as they came to drink.

verses.text: So the flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks brought forth speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled.
parts: So the flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks brought forth speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled.

verses.text: But Jacob separated the male lambs, and placed a speckled ram before the sheep and all that were spotted among the male lambs.
parts: But Jacob separated the male lambs, and placed a speckled ram before the sheep and all that were spotted among the male lambs.

verses.text: Thus it came to pass, whenever the sheep conceived, that Jacob placed the rods before the sheep in the gutters, so they might conceive according to the rods.
parts: Thus it came to pass, whenever the sheep conceived, that Jacob placed the rods before the sheep in the gutters, so they might conceive according to the rods.

verses.text: But whenever the sheep had already given birth, he did not put them in.
parts: But whenever the sheep had already given birth, he did not put them in.

verses.text: So the man became exceedingly rich, and had many cattle and oxen, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.
parts: So the man became exceedingly rich, and had many cattle and oxen, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.

headers: The Agreement of Jacob and Laban

verses.text: Now Jacob heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, “Jacob has taken away all that was our father's, and from our father's property he acquired all this wealth.” So Jacob saw Laban's countenance, and indeed, it was not favorable toward him as before.
parts: Now Jacob heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, “Jacob has taken away all that was our father's, and from our father's property he acquired all this wealth.” So Jacob saw Laban's countenance, and indeed, it was not favorable toward him as before.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Jacob, “Return to your father's land and to your family, and I will be with you.”
parts: Then the Lord said to Jacob, “Return to your father's land and to your family, and I will be with you.”

verses.text: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field where the flocks were, and said to them, “I see your father's countenance, that it is not favorable toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.
parts: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field where the flocks were, and said to them, “I see your father's countenance, that it is not favorable toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

verses.text: and said to them, “I see your father's countenance, that it is not favorable toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.
parts: and said to them, “I see your father's countenance, that it is not favorable toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

verses.text: Now you know that with all my might I served your father.
parts: Now you know that with all my might I served your father.

verses.text: Yet your father deceived me and changed my wages ten times with respect to the male lambs, but God did not allow him to harm me.
parts: Yet your father deceived me and changed my wages ten times with respect to the male lambs, but God did not allow him to harm me.

verses.text: If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks bore speckled.
parts: If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks bore speckled.

verses.text: So God has taken away all your father's cattle and given them to me.
parts: So God has taken away all your father's cattle and given them to me.

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when the flocks conceived, I lifted my eyes and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats and the rams that were speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled were mating with the sheep and the goats.
parts: Now it came to pass, when the flocks conceived, I lifted my eyes and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats and the rams that were speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled were mating with the sheep and the goats.

verses.text: Then the Angel of God spoke to me in a dream, saying, ‘Jacob.’ Thus I said, ‘Here I am.’
parts: Then the Angel of God spoke to me in a dream, saying, ‘Jacob.’ Thus I said, ‘Here I am.’

verses.text: So He said, ‘Lift your eyes now and see, all the male goats and the rams mating with the sheep and the goats are speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled; for I have seen everything Laban is doing to you.
parts: So He said, ‘Lift your eyes now and see, all the male goats and the rams mating with the sheep and the goats are speckled, spotted, and ash-colored speckled; for I have seen everything Laban is doing to you.

verses.text: I am the God who appeared to you at Bethel, where you anointed the pillar and made a vow to Me.
parts: I am the God who appeared to you at Bethel, where you anointed the pillar and made a vow to Me.

verses.text: Then Rachel and Leah answered and said to him, “Is there still any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?
parts: Then Rachel and Leah answered and said to him, “Is there still any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?

verses.text: Are we not considered strangers by him?
parts: Are we not considered strangers by him?

verses.text: For all the riches and glory God has taken from our father are really ours and our children's; now then, whatever God has said to you, do it.”
parts: For all the riches and glory God has taken from our father are really ours and our children's; now then, whatever God has said to you, do it.”

verses.text: Then Jacob rose and set his sons and his wives on camels.
parts: Then Jacob rose and set his sons and his wives on camels.

verses.text: And he carried away all his livestock and all his possessions acquired in Mesopotamia, everything belonging to him, to go to his father Isaac in Canaan.
parts: And he carried away all his livestock and all his possessions acquired in Mesopotamia, everything belonging to him, to go to his father Isaac in Canaan.

verses.text: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel had stolen her father's idols.
parts: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel had stolen her father's idols.

verses.text: But Jacob had hidden from Laban the Syrian his intention of running away.
parts: But Jacob had hidden from Laban the Syrian his intention of running away.

verses.text: So he fled with all that he had, and crossed the river, and headed for the mountains of Gilead.
parts: So he fled with all that he had, and crossed the river, and headed for the mountains of Gilead.

verses.text: Then Laban was told on the third day that Jacob had fled.
parts: Then Laban was told on the third day that Jacob had fled.

verses.text: So he took all his brethren with him and pursued him for seven days’ journey; and he overtook him in the mountains of Gilead.
parts: So he took all his brethren with him and pursued him for seven days’ journey; and he overtook him in the mountains of Gilead.

verses.text: But God had come to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said to him, “Be careful that you do not speak evil things to Jacob at any time.”
parts: But God had come to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said to him, “Be careful that you do not speak evil things to Jacob at any time.”

verses.text: So Laban overtook Jacob.
parts: So Laban overtook Jacob.

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done, that you have stolen away unknown to me, and robbed me, and carried away my daughters like captives taken with the sword?
parts: Then Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done, that you have stolen away unknown to me, and robbed me, and carried away my daughters like captives taken with the sword?

verses.text: Why did you flee away secretly, and steal away from me, and not tell me; for I might have sent you away with joy and songs, with timbrel and harp?
parts: Why did you flee away secretly, and steal away from me, and not tell me; for I might have sent you away with joy and songs, with timbrel and harp?

verses.text: And you did not allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters.
parts: And you did not allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters.

verses.text: It is in my power to do you harm, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, ‘Be careful that you do not speak evil things to Jacob at any time.’
parts: It is in my power to do you harm, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, ‘Be careful that you do not speak evil things to Jacob at any time.’

verses.text: Now you have surely gone because you greatly long for your father's house, but why did you steal my gods?”
parts: Now you have surely gone because you greatly long for your father's house, but why did you steal my gods?”

verses.text: Then Jacob answered and said to Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I said, ‘Perhaps you would take your daughters and all my possessions from me by force.’ With whomever you find your gods, let him not live in the presence of our brethren.
parts: Then Jacob answered and said to Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I said, ‘Perhaps you would take your daughters and all my possessions from me by force.’ With whomever you find your gods, let him not live in the presence of our brethren.

verses.text: With whomever you find your gods, let him not live in the presence of our brethren.
parts: With whomever you find your gods, let him not live in the presence of our brethren.

verses.text: Thus Laban went in and searched Leah's tent, but found nothing.
parts: Thus Laban went in and searched Leah's tent, but found nothing.

verses.text: Now Rachel had taken the idols, put them in the camel's saddle, and sat on them.
parts: Now Rachel had taken the idols, put them in the camel's saddle, and sat on them.

verses.text: Then she said to her father, “Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise before you, for the manner of women is with me.” So he searched the entire tent but did not find the idols.
parts: Then she said to her father, “Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise before you, for the manner of women is with me.” So he searched the entire tent but did not find the idols.

verses.text: Then Jacob was angry and rebuked Laban, and Jacob answered and said to Laban, “What is my injustice?
parts: Then Jacob was angry and rebuked Laban, and Jacob answered and said to Laban, “What is my injustice?

verses.text: Although you searched all my things, what part of your household goods have you found?
parts: Although you searched all my things, what part of your household goods have you found?

verses.text: These twenty years I have been with you; your sheep and your female goats have not miscarried their young, and I have not eaten the rams of your flock.
parts: These twenty years I have been with you; your sheep and your female goats have not miscarried their young, and I have not eaten the rams of your flock.

verses.text: That which was caught by wild animals I did not bring to you; I bore the loss of any stolen by day or by night.
parts: That which was caught by wild animals I did not bring to you; I bore the loss of any stolen by day or by night.

verses.text: There I was.
parts: There I was.

verses.text: Thus I have been in your house twenty years; I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times with respect to the female lambs.
parts: Thus I have been in your house twenty years; I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times with respect to the female lambs.

verses.text: Unless the God of my father Abraham and the fear of Isaac had been with me, surely now you would have sent me away empty-handed.
parts: Unless the God of my father Abraham and the fear of Isaac had been with me, surely now you would have sent me away empty-handed.

verses.text: Then Laban answered and said to Jacob, “These daughters are my daughters, and these sons are my sons, and these sheep are my sheep; all you see belongs to me and my daughters.
parts: Then Laban answered and said to Jacob, “These daughters are my daughters, and these sons are my sons, and these sheep are my sheep; all you see belongs to me and my daughters.

verses.text: Now therefore, come, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it be a witness between you and me.” Then he said, “Look, there is no one with us.
parts: Now therefore, come, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it be a witness between you and me.” Then he said, “Look, there is no one with us.

verses.text: So Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar. Then Jacob said to his brethren, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a heap, and they ate and drank there on the heap; and Laban said to him, “This heap is a witness between you and me today.” Laban called it the Heap of Testimony, but Jacob called it the Witness Heap.
parts: So Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.

Then Jacob said to his brethren, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a heap, and they ate and drank there on the heap; and Laban said to him, “This heap is a witness between you and me today.”
Laban called it the Heap of Testimony, but Jacob called it the Witness Heap.

verses.text: Then Jacob said to his brethren, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a heap, and they ate and drank there on the heap; and Laban said to him, “This heap is a witness between you and me today.”
parts: Then Jacob said to his brethren, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a heap, and they ate and drank there on the heap; and Laban said to him, “This heap is a witness between you and me today.”

verses.text: Laban called it the Heap of Testimony, but Jacob called it the Witness Heap.
parts: Laban called it the Heap of Testimony, but Jacob called it the Witness Heap.

verses.text: Then Laban said, “This heap and this pillar are a witness between you and me this day.” Therefore its name was called This-Heap-Witnesses, and also The Vision, because he said, “May God watch between you and me when we are absent one from another.
parts: Then Laban said, “This heap and this pillar are a witness between you and me this day.” Therefore its name was called This-Heap-Witnesses,
and also The Vision, because he said, “May God watch between you and me when we are absent one from another.

verses.text: and also The Vision, because he said, “May God watch between you and me when we are absent one from another.
parts: and also The Vision, because he said, “May God watch between you and me when we are absent one from another.

verses.text: If you humble my daughters, or if you take other wives besides my daughters, although no man is with us—see, God is witness between you and me.”
parts: If you humble my daughters, or if you take other wives besides my daughters, although no man is with us—see, God is witness between you and me.”

verses.text: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Listen, this heap and pillar are a witness.
parts: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Listen, this heap and pillar are a witness.

verses.text: This heap is a witness, and this pillar is a witness, that I will not pass beyond this heap and this pillar to you, and you will not pass beyond this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.
parts: This heap is a witness, and this pillar is a witness, that I will not pass beyond this heap and this pillar to you, and you will not pass beyond this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.

verses.text: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor judge between us.” Thus Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.
parts: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor judge between us.” Thus Jacob swore by the fear of his father Isaac.

verses.text: Then Jacob offered a sacrifice on the mountain, and called his brethren; and they ate bread and drank and stayed all night on the mountain.
parts: Then Jacob offered a sacrifice on the mountain, and called his brethren; and they ate bread and drank and stayed all night on the mountain.

verses.text: So early in the morning, Laban arose, and kissed his sons and daughters and blessed them.
parts: So early in the morning, Laban arose, and kissed his sons and daughters and blessed them.

verses.text: So Jacob went on his way, and saw the hosts of God encamped.
parts: So Jacob went on his way, and saw the hosts of God encamped.

verses.text: When Jacob saw them, he said, “This is God's encampment”; and he called the name of that place Encampments.
parts: When Jacob saw them, he said, “This is God's encampment”; and he called the name of that place Encampments.

verses.text: Then Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
parts: Then Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir, the country of Edom.

verses.text: And he commanded them, saying, “Speak thus to my lord Esau, ‘Thus your servant Jacob says, “I sojourned with Laban and stayed there until now.
parts: And he commanded them, saying, “Speak thus to my lord Esau, ‘Thus your servant Jacob says, “I sojourned with Laban and stayed there until now.

verses.text: Then the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau, and he also is coming to meet you, and four hundred men with him.”
parts: Then the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau, and he also is coming to meet you, and four hundred men with him.”

verses.text: So Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed; and he divided the people with him and the oxen and sheep into two companies.
parts: So Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed; and he divided the people with him and the oxen and sheep into two companies.

verses.text: Thus Jacob said, “If Esau comes to the one company and destroys it, then the other company will escape.”
parts: Thus Jacob said, “If Esau comes to the one company and destroys it, then the other company will escape.”

verses.text: Again Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, the Lord who said to me, ‘Return to the land of your nativity, and I will deal well with you,’ let me be satisfied with all the righteousness and all the truth You have shown Your servant; for I crossed over this Jordan with my staff, and now I have become two companies.
parts: Again Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, the Lord who said to me, ‘Return to the land of your nativity, and I will deal well with you,’ let me be satisfied with all the righteousness and all the truth You have shown Your servant; for I crossed over this Jordan with my staff, and now I have become two companies.

verses.text: let me be satisfied with all the righteousness and all the truth You have shown Your servant; for I crossed over this Jordan with my staff, and now I have become two companies.
parts: let me be satisfied with all the righteousness and all the truth You have shown Your servant; for I crossed over this Jordan with my staff, and now I have become two companies.

verses.text: Deliver me from the hand of my brother, Esau; for I am afraid of him, lest he come and attack me and the mother with the children.
parts: Deliver me from the hand of my brother, Esau; for I am afraid of him, lest he come and attack me and the mother with the children.

verses.text: For You said, ‘I will surely treat you well, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.’ ”
parts: For You said, ‘I will surely treat you well, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.’ ”

verses.text: So he lodged there that same night, and took some of the things he had brought as a present for Esau his brother: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred sheep and twenty rams, thirty milk camels with their offspring, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals.
parts: So he lodged there that same night, and took some of the things he had brought as a present for Esau his brother: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred sheep and twenty rams, thirty milk camels with their offspring, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals.

verses.text: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred sheep and twenty rams,
parts: two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred sheep and twenty rams,

verses.text: thirty milk camels with their offspring, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals.
parts: thirty milk camels with their offspring, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals.

verses.text: Then he delivered them to the hand of his servants, each flock by itself, and said to his servants, “Go on before me, and put some distance between successive droves.”
parts: Then he delivered them to the hand of his servants, each flock by itself, and said to his servants, “Go on before me, and put some distance between successive droves.”

verses.text: And he commanded the first one, saying, “When Esau my brother meets you and asks you, saying, ‘To whom do you belong, and where are you going?
parts: And he commanded the first one, saying, “When Esau my brother meets you and asks you, saying, ‘To whom do you belong, and where are you going?

verses.text: Then you shall say, ‘Your servant Jacob's.
parts: Then you shall say, ‘Your servant Jacob's.

verses.text: So he commanded the first, the second, and the third, and all who followed the droves, saying, “In this manner you shall speak to Esau when you find him;
parts: So he commanded the first, the second, and the third, and all who followed the droves, saying, “In this manner you shall speak to Esau when you find him;

verses.text: and also say, ‘Behold, your servant Jacob is coming behind us.’ ” For he said to himself, “I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face; perhaps he will accept me.”
parts: and also say, ‘Behold, your servant Jacob is coming behind us.’ ” For he said to himself, “I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face; perhaps he will accept me.”

verses.text: So the present went on before him, but he himself lodged that night in the encampment.
parts: So the present went on before him, but he himself lodged that night in the encampment.

verses.text: And he arose that night and took his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons, and crossed over the ford of Jabbok.
parts: And he arose that night and took his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons, and crossed over the ford of Jabbok.

verses.text: He took them and crossed over the brook, and sent over what he had.
parts: He took them and crossed over the brook, and sent over what he had.

verses.text: Then Jacob was left alone; and a man wrestled with him until the breaking of day.
parts: Then Jacob was left alone; and a man wrestled with him until the breaking of day.

verses.text: Now when He saw He did not prevail against him, He touched the socket of his hip; and the socket of Jacob's hip was dislocated as he wrestled with Him.
parts: Now when He saw He did not prevail against him, He touched the socket of his hip; and the socket of Jacob's hip was dislocated as he wrestled with Him.

verses.text: Then He said, “Let Me go, for the day breaks.” But he said, “I will not let You go unless You bless me.”
parts: Then He said, “Let Me go, for the day breaks.” But he said, “I will not let You go unless You bless me.”

verses.text: So He said to him, “What is your name?” He said, “Jacob.”
parts: So He said to him, “What is your name?” He said, “Jacob.”

verses.text: And He said, “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have prevailed with God and with men.”
parts: And He said, “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have prevailed with God and with men.”

verses.text: Then Jacob asked, saying, “Tell me Your name, I pray.” And he said, “Why do you ask about My name?” And He blessed him there.
parts: Then Jacob asked, saying, “Tell me Your name, I pray.” And he said, “Why do you ask about My name?” And He blessed him there.

verses.text: So Jacob called the name of that place, the Form of God: “For I saw God face to face, and my soul was saved.”
parts: So Jacob called the name of that place, the Form of God: “For I saw God face to face, and my soul was saved.”

verses.text: When the Form of God passed by, the sun rose on him, but he limped on his hip.
parts: When the Form of God passed by, the sun rose on him, but he limped on his hip.

verses.text: Therefore to this day, the children of Israel do not eat the muscle that shrank, which is on the hip socket, because He touched the socket of Jacob's hip, in the muscle that shrank.
parts: Therefore to this day, the children of Israel do not eat the muscle that shrank, which is on the hip socket, because He touched the socket of Jacob's hip, in the muscle that shrank.

verses.text: Now Jacob lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau his brother was coming, and four hundred men with him.
parts: Now Jacob lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau his brother was coming, and four hundred men with him.

verses.text: Then he put the maidservants and their sons in front, Leah and her children behind, and Rachel and Joseph last.
parts: Then he put the maidservants and their sons in front, Leah and her children behind, and Rachel and Joseph last.

verses.text: He then crossed over before them and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
parts: He then crossed over before them and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.

verses.text: But Esau ran to meet him, embraced him, and fell on his neck and kissed him; and they wept.
parts: But Esau ran to meet him, embraced him, and fell on his neck and kissed him; and they wept.

verses.text: Then he lifted his eyes and saw the women and children, and said, “Who are these with you?” He replied, “The children God mercifully gave your servant.”
parts: Then he lifted his eyes and saw the women and children, and said, “Who are these with you?” He replied, “The children God mercifully gave your servant.”

verses.text: Then the maidservants came near, they and their children, and bowed down.
parts: Then the maidservants came near, they and their children, and bowed down.

verses.text: Leah also came near with her children, and they bowed down.
parts: Leah also came near with her children, and they bowed down.

verses.text: Then Esau said, “What are these things to you, all this company I met?” So he said, “That your servant might find grace in the sight of my Lord.” But Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.” But Jacob replied, “If I have now found grace in your sight, receive the present from my hands, inasmuch as I have seen your face, as though someone might see the face of God; and you were pleased with me.
parts: Then Esau said, “What are these things to you, all this company I met?” So he said, “That your servant might find grace in the sight of my Lord.” But Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.” But Jacob replied, “If I have now found grace in your sight, receive the present from my hands, inasmuch as I have seen your face, as though someone might see the face of God; and you were pleased with me.

verses.text: But Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.”
parts: But Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.”

verses.text: But Jacob replied, “If I have now found grace in your sight, receive the present from my hands, inasmuch as I have seen your face, as though someone might see the face of God; and you were pleased with me.
parts: But Jacob replied, “If I have now found grace in your sight, receive the present from my hands, inasmuch as I have seen your face, as though someone might see the face of God; and you were pleased with me.

verses.text: Receive my blessing I brought you, because God has shown me mercy; and I have enough.” Thus he urged him, and he took it.
parts: Receive my blessing I brought you, because God has shown me mercy; and I have enough.” Thus he urged him, and he took it.

verses.text: Then Esau said, “Let us take our journey; let us go, and I will go before you.” But Jacob said to him, “My lord knows the children are weak, and the flocks and herds with me are giving birth.
parts: Then Esau said, “Let us take our journey; let us go, and I will go before you.” But Jacob said to him, “My lord knows the children are weak, and the flocks and herds with me are giving birth.

verses.text: But Jacob said to him, “My lord knows the children are weak, and the flocks and herds with me are giving birth.
parts: But Jacob said to him, “My lord knows the children are weak, and the flocks and herds with me are giving birth.

verses.text: Let my lord go on ahead before his servant.
parts: Let my lord go on ahead before his servant.

verses.text: Then Esau said, “Let me leave with you some of the people with me.” But he said, “What need is there?
parts: Then Esau said, “Let me leave with you some of the people with me.” But he said, “What need is there?

verses.text: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.
parts: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.

verses.text: Then Jacob journeyed to Succoth, built houses, and made booths for his cattle.
parts: Then Jacob journeyed to Succoth, built houses, and made booths for his cattle.

verses.text: Then Jacob came safely to Salem, a city of Shechem, in the land of Canaan, when he came from Mesopotamia of Syria; and he took up a position in front of the city.
parts: Then Jacob came safely to Salem, a city of Shechem, in the land of Canaan, when he came from Mesopotamia of Syria; and he took up a position in front of the city.

verses.text: He then bought the parcel of land where he pitched his tent from Hamor, Shechem's father, for a hundred male lambs.
parts: He then bought the parcel of land where he pitched his tent from Hamor, Shechem's father, for a hundred male lambs.

verses.text: There he set up an altar and called on the God of Israel.
parts: There he set up an altar and called on the God of Israel.

verses.text: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
parts: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

verses.text: But when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, a ruler of the land, saw her, he took her, lay with her, and violated her.
parts: But when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, a ruler of the land, saw her, he took her, lay with her, and violated her.

verses.text: Now his soul was strongly attracted to Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the young woman and sought to win her heart.
parts: Now his soul was strongly attracted to Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the young woman and sought to win her heart.

verses.text: Then Shechem spoke to his father Hamor, saying, “Get this young woman as a wife for me.”
parts: Then Shechem spoke to his father Hamor, saying, “Get this young woman as a wife for me.”

verses.text: But Jacob heard Hamor's son had defiled Dinah his daughter.
parts: But Jacob heard Hamor's son had defiled Dinah his daughter.

verses.text: Then Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to speak with him.
parts: Then Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to speak with him.

verses.text: Now the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it; and the men were stunned and extremely grieved, because he had done a disgraceful thing in Israel by lying with Jacob's daughter, something that should never have happened.
parts: Now the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it; and the men were stunned and extremely grieved, because he had done a disgraceful thing in Israel by lying with Jacob's daughter, something that should never have happened.

verses.text: But Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem is passionately in love with your daughter.
parts: But Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem is passionately in love with your daughter.

verses.text: Make marriages with us; give us your daughters, and take our daughters for your sons.
parts: Make marriages with us; give us your daughters, and take our daughters for your sons.

verses.text: Dwell among us, and behold, the land before you is spacious.
parts: Dwell among us, and behold, the land before you is spacious.

verses.text: Then Shechem said to her father and her brothers, “Let me find grace in your eyes, and we will give whatever you ask.
parts: Then Shechem said to her father and her brothers, “Let me find grace in your eyes, and we will give whatever you ask.

verses.text: Make the dowry as great as you wish, and I will give it; only give me this young woman as a wife.”
parts: Make the dowry as great as you wish, and I will give it; only give me this young woman as a wife.”

verses.text: But the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father, and spoke deceitfully to them, because he had defiled Dinah their sister.
parts: But the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father, and spoke deceitfully to them, because he had defiled Dinah their sister.

verses.text: So Simeon and Levi, the brothers of Dinah and the sons of Leah, said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that would be a reproach to us.
parts: So Simeon and Levi, the brothers of Dinah and the sons of Leah, said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that would be a reproach to us.

verses.text: But on this condition we will consent to you, if you will become as we are, if every male of you is circumcised,
parts: But on this condition we will consent to you, if you will become as we are, if every male of you is circumcised,

verses.text: then we will give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us; and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
parts: then we will give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us; and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.

verses.text: But if you will not heed us and be circumcised, then we will take our daughters and be gone.”
parts: But if you will not heed us and be circumcised, then we will take our daughters and be gone.”

verses.text: Now their words pleased Hamor and Shechem, Hamor's son.
parts: Now their words pleased Hamor and Shechem, Hamor's son.

verses.text: So the young man did not delay to do the thing, because he delighted in Jacob's daughter.
parts: So the young man did not delay to do the thing, because he delighted in Jacob's daughter.

verses.text: And Hamor and Shechem his son came to the gate of their city, and spoke with the men of their city, saying,
parts: And Hamor and Shechem his son came to the gate of their city, and spoke with the men of their city, saying,

verses.text: “These men are at peace with us.
parts: “These men are at peace with us.

verses.text: Only on this condition will the men consent to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us is circumcised, as they are circumcised.
parts: Only on this condition will the men consent to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us is circumcised, as they are circumcised.

verses.text: Will not their livestock, their property, and every animal of theirs be ours?
parts: Will not their livestock, their property, and every animal of theirs be ours?

verses.text: Thus all who went out of the gate of their city heeded Hamor and Shechem his son; every male was circumcised in the flesh.
parts: Thus all who went out of the gate of their city heeded Hamor and Shechem his son; every male was circumcised in the flesh.

verses.text: Now it came to pass on the third day, when they were in pain, two sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, each took his sword and came boldly upon the city and killed all the males.
parts: Now it came to pass on the third day, when they were in pain, two sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, each took his sword and came boldly upon the city and killed all the males.

verses.text: They also killed Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah from Shechem's house, and went out.
parts: They also killed Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah from Shechem's house, and went out.

verses.text: Then the sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and plundered the city in which Dinah their sister had been defiled.
parts: Then the sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and plundered the city in which Dinah their sister had been defiled.

verses.text: They took their sheep, their oxen, and their donkeys, what was in the city and what was in the field;
parts: They took their sheep, their oxen, and their donkeys, what was in the city and what was in the field;

verses.text: and took captive all their wives, their children, and their servants and plundered whatever was in the city and in the houses.
parts: and took captive all their wives, their children, and their servants and plundered whatever was in the city and in the houses.

verses.text: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You made me an object of hatred, so as to be evil to all the inhabitants of the land, both among the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and since I am few in number, they will gather themselves together against me and kill me.
parts: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You made me an object of hatred, so as to be evil to all the inhabitants of the land, both among the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and since I am few in number, they will gather themselves together against me and kill me.

verses.text: But they said, “Should he treat our sister like a prostitute?”
parts: But they said, “Should he treat our sister like a prostitute?”

verses.text: Now God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there; and make an altar there to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.” Then Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Put away the foreign gods among you, purify yourselves, and change your garments.
parts: Now God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there; and make an altar there to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.”
Then Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Put away the foreign gods among you, purify yourselves, and change your garments.

verses.text: Let us arise and go up to Bethel and make there an altar to God, who answered me in the day of my tribulation, and was with me and saved me on the road I traveled.”
parts: Let us arise and go up to Bethel and make there an altar to God, who answered me in the day of my tribulation, and was with me and saved me on the road I traveled.”

verses.text: So they gave Jacob all the foreign gods in their hands, and the earrings in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the terebinth tree near Shechem.
parts: So they gave Jacob all the foreign gods in their hands, and the earrings in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the terebinth tree near Shechem.

verses.text: Then Israel departed from Shechem, and the fear of God was upon all the cities around them.
parts: Then Israel departed from Shechem, and the fear of God was upon all the cities around them.

verses.text: Now Jacob came to Luz (that is, Bethel), in the land of Canaan, he and all the people with him.
parts: Now Jacob came to Luz (that is, Bethel), in the land of Canaan, he and all the people with him.

verses.text: He built an altar there and called the place Bethel, because there God appeared to him when he fled from the face of his brother Esau.
parts: He built an altar there and called the place Bethel, because there God appeared to him when he fled from the face of his brother Esau.

verses.text: Now Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak.
parts: Now Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak.

verses.text: Then God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Mesopotamia, and blessed him. God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; your name shall not any more be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.” God also said to him, “I am your God.
parts: Then God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Mesopotamia, and blessed him.
God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; your name shall not any more be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.” God also said to him, “I am your God.

verses.text: God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; your name shall not any more be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.”
parts: God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; your name shall not any more be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.”

verses.text: God also said to him, “I am your God.
parts: God also said to him, “I am your God.

verses.text: The land I gave Abraham and Isaac I give to you; and to your seed after you I give this land.”
parts: The land I gave Abraham and Isaac I give to you; and to your seed after you I give this land.”

verses.text: Then God ascended from him in the place where He talked with him.
parts: Then God ascended from him in the place where He talked with him.

verses.text: So Jacob set up a pillar in the place where He talked with him, a pillar of stone; and he poured a drink offering on it, and he poured oil on it.
parts: So Jacob set up a pillar in the place where He talked with him, a pillar of stone; and he poured a drink offering on it, and he poured oil on it.

verses.text: Thus Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him Bethel.
parts: Thus Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him Bethel.

verses.text: Then Jacob departed from Bethel, and when there was but a little distance to go to Ephrath, Rachel labored with much difficulty in childbirth.
parts: Then Jacob departed from Bethel, and when there was but a little distance to go to Ephrath, Rachel labored with much difficulty in childbirth.

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said to her, “Take courage; you will have this son also.”
parts: Now it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said to her, “Take courage; you will have this son also.”

verses.text: So it was, as her soul was departing (for she died), she called his name Ben-Oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
parts: So it was, as her soul was departing (for she died), she called his name Ben-Oni; but his father called him Benjamin.

verses.text: Thus Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).
parts: Thus Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).

verses.text: Then Jacob set a pillar on her grave, which is the pillar of Rachel's grave to this day.
parts: Then Jacob set a pillar on her grave, which is the pillar of Rachel's grave to this day.

verses.text: Now Israel journeyed and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
parts: Now Israel journeyed and pitched his tent beyond the tower of Eder.

verses.text: So it happened, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine.
parts: So it happened, when Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine.

verses.text: Now the sons of Jacob were twelve: the sons of Leah were Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun; the sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin; the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's maidservant, were Dan and Naphtali; and the sons of Zilpah, Leah's maidservant, were Gad and Asher.
parts: Now the sons of Jacob were twelve: the sons of Leah were Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, and Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun; the sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin; the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's maidservant, were Dan and Naphtali; and the sons of Zilpah, Leah's maidservant, were Gad and Asher.

verses.text: the sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin;
parts: the sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin;

verses.text: the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's maidservant, were Dan and Naphtali;
parts: the sons of Bilhah, Rachel's maidservant, were Dan and Naphtali;

verses.text: and the sons of Zilpah, Leah's maidservant, were Gad and Asher.
parts: and the sons of Zilpah, Leah's maidservant, were Gad and Asher.

verses.text: Then Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, or Kirjath Arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
parts: Then Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, or Kirjath Arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.

verses.text: Now the days of Isaac were one hundred and eighty years.
parts: Now the days of Isaac were one hundred and eighty years.

verses.text: So Isaac breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people, being old and full of days.
parts: So Isaac breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people, being old and full of days.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Esau, who is Edom.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Esau, who is Edom.

verses.text: Esau took his wives from the daughters of the Canaanites: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite; Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;
parts: Esau took his wives from the daughters of the Canaanites: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite; Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;

verses.text: and Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.
parts: and Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.

verses.text: Now Adah bore Eliphaz to Esau, and Basemath bore Reuel,
parts: Now Adah bore Eliphaz to Esau, and Basemath bore Reuel,

verses.text: and Aholibamah bore Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
parts: and Aholibamah bore Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.

verses.text: Then Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the persons of his household, his cattle and all his animals, and all his goods he gained in the land of Canaan, and went to a country away from the presence of his brother Jacob.
parts: Then Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the persons of his household, his cattle and all his animals, and all his goods he gained in the land of Canaan, and went to a country away from the presence of his brother Jacob.

verses.text: For their possessions were too great for them to dwell together, and the land of their sojourning could not support them because of their abundance.
parts: For their possessions were too great for them to dwell together, and the land of their sojourning could not support them because of their abundance.

verses.text: So Esau dwelt in Mount Seir.
parts: So Esau dwelt in Mount Seir.

verses.text: Now this is the genealogy of Esau the father of the Edomites in Mount Seir.
parts: Now this is the genealogy of Esau the father of the Edomites in Mount Seir.

verses.text: These were the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, and Reuel the son of Basemath the wife of Esau.
parts: These were the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, and Reuel the son of Basemath the wife of Esau.

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
parts: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.

verses.text: Now Timna was the concubine of Eliphaz, Esau's son, and she bore Amalek to Eli-phaz.
parts: Now Timna was the concubine of Eliphaz, Esau's son, and she bore Amalek to Eli-phaz.

verses.text: These were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
parts: These were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

verses.text: These were the sons of Aholibamah, Esau's wife, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon.
parts: These were the sons of Aholibamah, Esau's wife, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon.

verses.text: These were the chiefs of the sons of Esau.
parts: These were the chiefs of the sons of Esau.

verses.text: Chief Korah, Chief Gatam, and Chief Amalek.
parts: Chief Korah, Chief Gatam, and Chief Amalek.

verses.text: These were the sons of Reuel, Esau's son: Chief Nahath, Chief Zerah, Chief Shammah, and Chief Mizzah.
parts: These were the sons of Reuel, Esau's son: Chief Nahath, Chief Zerah, Chief Shammah, and Chief Mizzah.

verses.text: These were the sons of Aholibamah, Esau's wife: Chief Jeush, Chief Jaalam, and Chief Korah.
parts: These were the sons of Aholibamah, Esau's wife: Chief Jeush, Chief Jaalam, and Chief Korah.

verses.text: These were the sons of Esau, and these were their chiefs, the sons of Edom.
parts: These were the sons of Esau, and these were their chiefs, the sons of Edom.

verses.text: These were the sons of Seir the Horite who inhabited the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
parts: These were the sons of Seir the Horite who inhabited the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

verses.text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
parts: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

verses.text: And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam.
parts: And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam.

verses.text: These were the sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
parts: These were the sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

verses.text: These were the sons of Zibeon: Ajah and Anah.
parts: These were the sons of Zibeon: Ajah and Anah.

verses.text: These were the children of Anah: Dishon and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
parts: These were the children of Anah: Dishon and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.

verses.text: These were the sons of Di-shon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
parts: These were the sons of Di-shon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

verses.text: These were the sons of Ezer: Balaam, Zucam, Jucam and Ucam.
parts: These were the sons of Ezer: Balaam, Zucam, Jucam and Ucam.

verses.text: These were the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
parts: These were the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

verses.text: These were the chiefs of the Horites: Chief Lotan, Chief Shobal, Chief Zibeon, Chief Anah,
parts: These were the chiefs of the Horites: Chief Lotan, Chief Shobal, Chief Zibeon, Chief Anah,

verses.text: Chief Dishon, Chief Ezer, and Chief Dishan.

verses.text: Now these were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel: Balak the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
parts: Now these were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel: Balak the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

verses.text: Balak the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
parts: Balak the son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

verses.text: So when Balak died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
parts: So when Balak died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.

verses.text: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
parts: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

verses.text: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Barad, who attacked Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Gethaim.
parts: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Barad, who attacked Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Gethaim.

verses.text: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
parts: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

verses.text: When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-by-the-River reigned in his place.
parts: When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-by-the-River reigned in his place.

verses.text: When Saul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
parts: When Saul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.

verses.text: And when Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor died, Harad the son of Barad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Phogor.
parts: And when Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor died, Harad the son of Barad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Phogor.

verses.text: These were the names of the chiefs of Esau, in their tribes and places, and in their countries and nations: Chief Timnah, Chief Alvah, Chief Jetheth, Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon, Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar, Chief Magdiel, and Chief Zaphoim.
parts: These were the names of the chiefs of Esau, in their tribes and places, and in their countries and nations: Chief Timnah, Chief Alvah, Chief Jetheth, Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon, Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar, Chief Magdiel, and Chief Zaphoim.

verses.text: Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
parts: Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,

verses.text: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
parts: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,

verses.text: Chief Magdiel, and Chief Zaphoim.
parts: Chief Magdiel, and Chief Zaphoim.

verses.text: Now Jacob dwelt in the land where his father had sojourned, in the land of Canaan.
parts: Now Jacob dwelt in the land where his father had sojourned, in the land of Canaan.

verses.text: This is the genealogy of Jacob.
parts: This is the genealogy of Jacob.

verses.text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons, because he was the son of his old age.
parts: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his sons, because he was the son of his old age.

verses.text: But when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, they hated him and could not speak civilly to him.
parts: But when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, they hated him and could not speak civilly to him.

verses.text: Then Joseph had a dream, and reported it to his brothers.
parts: Then Joseph had a dream, and reported it to his brothers.

verses.text: Thus he said to them, “Hear this dream I dreamed:
parts: Thus he said to them, “Hear this dream I dreamed:

verses.text: There we were, binding sheaves in the field.
parts: There we were, binding sheaves in the field.

verses.text: So his brothers said to him, “Shall you indeed reign over us?
parts: So his brothers said to him, “Shall you indeed reign over us?

verses.text: Then he dreamed still another dream and told it to his brothers, and said, “Look, I have dreamed another dream.
parts: Then he dreamed still another dream and told it to his brothers, and said, “Look, I have dreamed another dream.

verses.text: So he told it to his father and his brothers; and his father rebuked him and said to him, “What is this dream you have dreamed?
parts: So he told it to his father and his brothers; and his father rebuked him and said to him, “What is this dream you have dreamed?

verses.text: And his brothers envied him, but his father kept the matter in mind.
parts: And his brothers envied him, but his father kept the matter in mind.
