verses.text: Then his brothers went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.
parts: Then his brothers went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

verses.text: And Israel said to Joseph, “Are not your brothers shepherding the sheep in Shechem?
parts: And Israel said to Joseph, “Are not your brothers shepherding the sheep in Shechem?

verses.text: Then Israel said to him, “Go and see if it is well with your brothers and well with the sheep, and bring back word to me.” So he sent him out of the Valley of Hebron, and he went to Shechem.
parts: Then Israel said to him, “Go and see if it is well with your brothers and well with the sheep, and bring back word to me.” So he sent him out of the Valley of Hebron, and he went to Shechem.

verses.text: Now a certain man found him, and there he was, wandering in the field.
parts: Now a certain man found him, and there he was, wandering in the field.

verses.text: He replied, “I am looking for my brothers.
parts: He replied, “I am looking for my brothers.

verses.text: The man said to him, “They have departed from here, for I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.”’ So Joseph went after his brothers and found them in Dothan.
parts: The man said to him, “They have departed from here, for I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.”’ So Joseph went after his brothers and found them in Dothan.

verses.text: Now when they saw him afar off, even before he came near them, they conspired against him to kill him.
parts: Now when they saw him afar off, even before he came near them, they conspired against him to kill him.

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “Look, this dreamer is coming.
parts: Then they said to one another, “Look, this dreamer is coming.

verses.text: Come therefore, let us now kill him and cast him into some pit; and we shall say, ‘Some wild beast has devoured him.’ We shall see what will become of his dreams.”
parts: Come therefore, let us now kill him and cast him into some pit; and we shall say, ‘Some wild beast has devoured him.’ We shall see what will become of his dreams.”

verses.text: But Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, “Let us not kill him.” Again, Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit in the desert; and do not lay a hand on him”—that he might deliver him out of their hands, and bring him back to his father.
parts: But Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, “Let us not kill him.” Again, Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit in the desert; and do not lay a hand on him”—that he might deliver him out of their hands, and bring him back to his father.

verses.text: Again, Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit in the desert; and do not lay a hand on him”—that he might deliver him out of their hands, and bring him back to his father.
parts: Again, Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit in the desert; and do not lay a hand on him”—that he might deliver him out of their hands, and bring him back to his father.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped the tunic of many colors off him.
parts: So it came to pass, when Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped the tunic of many colors off him.

verses.text: Then they took him and cast him into a pit, which was empty; for there was no water in it.
parts: Then they took him and cast him into a pit, which was empty; for there was no water in it.

verses.text: They then sat down to eat a meal, and lifted their eyes and looked, and there was a company of Ishmaelite wayfarers coming from Gilead with their camels bearing spices, balm, and myrrh, on their way to carry them down to Egypt.
parts: They then sat down to eat a meal, and lifted their eyes and looked, and there was a company of Ishmaelite wayfarers coming from Gilead with their camels bearing spices, balm, and myrrh, on their way to carry them down to Egypt.

verses.text: So Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is there if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?
parts: So Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is there if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?

verses.text: Come and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh”; and his brothers listened.
parts: Come and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh”; and his brothers listened.

verses.text: Thus the Midianite traders passed by, and the brothers pulled Joseph up and lifted him out of the pit; and they sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of gold.
parts: Thus the Midianite traders passed by, and the brothers pulled Joseph up and lifted him out of the pit; and they sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of gold.

verses.text: Then Reuben returned to the pit, and when he saw Joseph was not in there, he tore his clothes.
parts: Then Reuben returned to the pit, and when he saw Joseph was not in there, he tore his clothes.

verses.text: So he returned to his brothers and said, “The lad is not there; and I, where shall I go?”
parts: So he returned to his brothers and said, “The lad is not there; and I, where shall I go?”

verses.text: Thus they took Joseph's tunic, killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the tunic in the blood.
parts: Thus they took Joseph's tunic, killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the tunic in the blood.

verses.text: Then they sent the tunic of many colors, and had it brought to their father and said, “We found this.
parts: Then they sent the tunic of many colors, and had it brought to their father and said, “We found this.

verses.text: So he recognized it and said, “This is my son's tunic.
parts: So he recognized it and said, “This is my son's tunic.

verses.text: Then Jacob tore his clothes, put sackcloth on his waist, and mourned for his son many days.
parts: Then Jacob tore his clothes, put sackcloth on his waist, and mourned for his son many days.

verses.text: Thus all his sons and daughters arose to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, and he said, “I shall go down into the grave to my son in mourning.” So his father wept for him.
parts: Thus all his sons and daughters arose to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, and he said, “I shall go down into the grave to my son in mourning.” So his father wept for him.

verses.text: Now the Midianites had sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and captain of the guard.
parts: Now the Midianites had sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and captain of the guard.

verses.text: It came to pass at that time that Judah departed from his brothers, and visited a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.
parts: It came to pass at that time that Judah departed from his brothers, and visited a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.

verses.text: Then Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he married her and went in to her.
parts: Then Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he married her and went in to her.

verses.text: So she conceived and bore a son, and called his name Er.
parts: So she conceived and bore a son, and called his name Er.

verses.text: She conceived again and bore a son, and called his name Onan.
parts: She conceived again and bore a son, and called his name Onan.

verses.text: She conceived yet again and bore a son, and called his name Shelah.
parts: She conceived yet again and bore a son, and called his name Shelah.

verses.text: Then Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
parts: Then Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.

verses.text: But Er, Judah's firstborn, was evil in the sight of the Lord, and God killed him.
parts: But Er, Judah's firstborn, was evil in the sight of the Lord, and God killed him.

verses.text: So Judah said to Onan, “Go in to your brother's wife and marry her, and as her brother-in-law raise up seed to your brother.”
parts: So Judah said to Onan, “Go in to your brother's wife and marry her, and as her brother-in-law raise up seed to your brother.”

verses.text: But Onan knew the seed would not be his; and it came to pass that whenever he went in to his brother's wife, he emitted his semen on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother.
parts: But Onan knew the seed would not be his; and it came to pass that whenever he went in to his brother's wife, he emitted his semen on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother.

verses.text: But the thing he did appeared evil in the sight of the Lord; therefore, He also put him to death.
parts: But the thing he did appeared evil in the sight of the Lord; therefore, He also put him to death.

verses.text: Then Judah said to Tamar his daughter-in-law, “Remain a widow in your father's house till my son Shelah is grown.” For he said, “Lest he also die like his brothers.” So Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
parts: Then Judah said to Tamar his daughter-in-law, “Remain a widow in your father's house till my son Shelah is grown.” For he said, “Lest he also die like his brothers.” So Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.

verses.text: Now in the process of time, the daughter of Shua, Judah's wife, died; and Judah was comforted and went up to his sheepshearers at Timnah, he and his shepherd, Hirah the Adullamite.
parts: Now in the process of time, the daughter of Shua, Judah's wife, died; and Judah was comforted and went up to his sheepshearers at Timnah, he and his shepherd, Hirah the Adullamite.

verses.text: So it was told Tamar, saying, “Look, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep.”
parts: So it was told Tamar, saying, “Look, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep.”

verses.text: Thus she took off her widow's garments, covered herself with a veil, made herself beautiful, and sat down near the gates of Ainan on the way past Timnah; for she saw Shelah was grown, and she was not given to him as a wife.
parts: Thus she took off her widow's garments, covered herself with a veil, made herself beautiful, and sat down near the gates of Ainan on the way past Timnah; for she saw Shelah was grown, and she was not given to him as a wife.

verses.text: When Judah saw her, he thought she was a prostitute, because she had covered her face and he did not recognize her.
parts: When Judah saw her, he thought she was a prostitute, because she had covered her face and he did not recognize her.

verses.text: Then he turned to her by the way, and said, “Let me come in to you”; for he did not know she was his daughter-in-law.
parts: Then he turned to her by the way, and said, “Let me come in to you”; for he did not know she was his daughter-in-law.

verses.text: He replied, “I will send a young goat from the flocks.” So she said, “Will you give me a pledge till you send it?”
parts: He replied, “I will send a young goat from the flocks.” So she said, “Will you give me a pledge till you send it?”

verses.text: Then he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” So she said, “Your ring and cord, and the staff in your hand.” Then he gave them to her, and went in to her, and she conceived by him.
parts: Then he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” So she said, “Your ring and cord, and the staff in your hand.” Then he gave them to her, and went in to her, and she conceived by him.

verses.text: So she arose and went away, and laid aside her veil and put on the garments of her widowhood.
parts: So she arose and went away, and laid aside her veil and put on the garments of her widowhood.

verses.text: Thus Judah sent the young goat by the hand of his shepherd the Adullamite to receive his pledge from the woman, but he did not find her.
parts: Thus Judah sent the young goat by the hand of his shepherd the Adullamite to receive his pledge from the woman, but he did not find her.

verses.text: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, “Where is the prostitute who was in Ainan by the roadside?” They replied, “There was no prostitute here.”
parts: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, “Where is the prostitute who was in Ainan by the roadside?” They replied, “There was no prostitute here.”

verses.text: So he returned to Judah and said, “I cannot find her.
parts: So he returned to Judah and said, “I cannot find her.

verses.text: Then Judah said, “Let her have them, lest we should become a laughingstock; for I sent this young goat but you did not find her.”
parts: Then Judah said, “Let her have them, lest we should become a laughingstock; for I sent this young goat but you did not find her.”

verses.text: Thus it came to pass, about three months after, that Judah was told, saying, “Tamar your daughter-in-law has committed fornication and is pregnant because of her adultery.” So Judah said, “Bring her out and let her be burned.” When she was brought out, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “By the man to whom these belong, I am with child.” So she said, “Determine whose these are—the ring, the cord, and the staff.” So Judah acknowledged them and said, “She has been more righteous than I, because I did not give her to Shelah my son.” But he never knew her again.
parts: Thus it came to pass, about three months after, that Judah was told, saying, “Tamar your daughter-in-law has committed fornication and is pregnant because of her adultery.” So Judah said, “Bring her out and let her be burned.”

When she was brought out, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “By the man to whom these belong, I am with child.” So she said, “Determine whose these are—the ring, the cord, and the staff.” So Judah acknowledged them and said, “She has been more righteous than I, because I did not give her to Shelah my son.” But he never knew her again.

verses.text: When she was brought out, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “By the man to whom these belong, I am with child.” So she said, “Determine whose these are—the ring, the cord, and the staff.”
parts: When she was brought out, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “By the man to whom these belong, I am with child.” So she said, “Determine whose these are—the ring, the cord, and the staff.”

verses.text: So Judah acknowledged them and said, “She has been more righteous than I, because I did not give her to Shelah my son.” But he never knew her again.
parts: So Judah acknowledged them and said, “She has been more righteous than I, because I did not give her to Shelah my son.” But he never knew her again.

verses.text: Then it came to pass, at the time for giving birth, that behold, twins were in her womb.
parts: Then it came to pass, at the time for giving birth, that behold, twins were in her womb.

verses.text: So it was, when she was giving birth, that the one put out his hand; and the midwife took a scarlet thread and bound it on his hand, saying, “This one came out first.”
parts: So it was, when she was giving birth, that the one put out his hand; and the midwife took a scarlet thread and bound it on his hand, saying, “This one came out first.”

verses.text: Then it happened, as he drew back his hand, that his brother came out unexpectedly; and she said, “How did you break through?
parts: Then it happened, as he drew back his hand, that his brother came out unexpectedly; and she said, “How did you break through?

verses.text: Afterward his brother came out, with the scarlet thread on his hand; and she called his name Zerah.
parts: Afterward his brother came out, with the scarlet thread on his hand; and she called his name Zerah.

verses.text: Now Joseph had been taken down to Egypt, and Potiphar, Pharaoh's eunuch and captain of the guard, an Egyp-tian, had bought him from the Ishmaelites who had taken him down there.
parts: Now Joseph had been taken down to Egypt, and Potiphar, Pharaoh's eunuch and captain of the guard, an Egyp-tian, had bought him from the Ishmaelites who had taken him down there.

verses.text: The Lord was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he was living in the house of his lord the Egyptian.
parts: The Lord was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he was living in the house of his lord the Egyptian.

verses.text: So his lord saw that the Lord was with him and the Lord made all he did to prosper in his hand.
parts: So his lord saw that the Lord was with him and the Lord made all he did to prosper in his hand.

verses.text: Thus Joseph found grace in his sight and was pleasing to him.
parts: Thus Joseph found grace in his sight and was pleasing to him.

verses.text: So it was, from the time he made him overseer of his house and all he had, that the Lord blessed the Egyp-tian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the Lord was on all he had in the house and in the field.
parts: So it was, from the time he made him overseer of his house and all he had, that the Lord blessed the Egyp-tian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the Lord was on all he had in the house and in the field.

verses.text: Thus he left all he had in Joseph's hand, and did not know what he had except for the bread he ate.
parts: Thus he left all he had in Joseph's hand, and did not know what he had except for the bread he ate.

verses.text: Then it came to pass after these things that his lord's wife cast longing eyes on Joseph, and she said, “Lie with me.” But he refused and said to his lord's wife, “Look, my lord does not know what is with me in the house and has committed all he has to my hand.
parts: Then it came to pass after these things that his lord's wife cast longing eyes on Joseph, and she said, “Lie with me.” But he refused and said to his lord's wife, “Look, my lord does not know what is with me in the house and has committed all he has to my hand.

verses.text: But he refused and said to his lord's wife, “Look, my lord does not know what is with me in the house and has committed all he has to my hand.
parts: But he refused and said to his lord's wife, “Look, my lord does not know what is with me in the house and has committed all he has to my hand.

verses.text: There is no one greater in this house than I, nor has he kept back anything from me but you, because you are his wife.
parts: There is no one greater in this house than I, nor has he kept back anything from me but you, because you are his wife.

verses.text: So it was, as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he did not heed her, to lie with her or to have relations with her.
parts: So it was, as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he did not heed her, to lie with her or to have relations with her.

verses.text: But it happened about this time, when Joseph went into the house to do his work, and none of the men of the house was inside,
parts: But it happened about this time, when Joseph went into the house to do his work, and none of the men of the house was inside,

verses.text: she caught him by his garment, saying, “Lie with me.” But he left his garment in her hand, and fled and ran outside.
parts: she caught him by his garment, saying, “Lie with me.” But he left his garment in her hand, and fled and ran outside.

verses.text: So it was, when she saw he had left his garment in her hand and fled outside, she called to the men of her house and spoke to them, saying, “See, he brought in to us a Hebrew to mock us.
parts: So it was, when she saw he had left his garment in her hand and fled outside, she called to the men of her house and spoke to them, saying, “See, he brought in to us a Hebrew to mock us.

verses.text: she called to the men of her house and spoke to them, saying, “See, he brought in to us a Hebrew to mock us.
parts: she called to the men of her house and spoke to them, saying, “See, he brought in to us a Hebrew to mock us.

verses.text: Thus it happened, when he heard that I lifted my voice and cried out, he left his garment with me, and fled and went outside.”
parts: Thus it happened, when he heard that I lifted my voice and cried out, he left his garment with me, and fled and went outside.”

verses.text: So she kept his garment with her until his lord came home.
parts: So she kept his garment with her until his lord came home.

verses.text: Then she spoke to him with words like these, saying, “The Hebrew servant you brought to us came in to me to mock me;
parts: Then she spoke to him with words like these, saying, “The Hebrew servant you brought to us came in to me to mock me;

verses.text: so it happened, as I lifted my voice and cried out, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”
parts: so it happened, as I lifted my voice and cried out, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”

verses.text: So it was, when his lord heard the words his wife spoke to him, saying, “Your servant did to me after this manner,” his anger was aroused.
parts: So it was, when his lord heard the words his wife spoke to him, saying, “Your servant did to me after this manner,” his anger was aroused.

verses.text: Then Joseph's lord took him and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were confined.
parts: Then Joseph's lord took him and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were confined.

verses.text: But the Lord was with Joseph and showed him mercy, and He gave him grace in the sight of the chief prison keeper. So the chief keeper of the prison put under Joseph's authority both the prison and all the prisoners, and whatever they did there.
parts: But the Lord was with Joseph and showed him mercy, and He gave him grace in the sight of the chief prison keeper.
So the chief keeper of the prison put under Joseph's authority both the prison and all the prisoners, and whatever they did there.

verses.text: So the chief keeper of the prison put under Joseph's authority both the prison and all the prisoners, and whatever they did there.
parts: So the chief keeper of the prison put under Joseph's authority both the prison and all the prisoners, and whatever they did there.

verses.text: The chief keeper of the prison did not look into anything under Joseph's authority, because the Lord was with him; and whatever he did, the Lord made it prosper.
parts: The chief keeper of the prison did not look into anything under Joseph's authority, because the Lord was with him; and whatever he did, the Lord made it prosper.

headers: Joseph Interprets the Dreams of the Prisoners

verses.text: Now it came to pass after these things, that the king of Egypt's chief cupbearer and chief baker offended their lord, the king of Egypt.
parts: Now it came to pass after these things, that the king of Egypt's chief cupbearer and chief baker offended their lord, the king of Egypt.

verses.text: So Pharaoh was angry with his two eunuchs, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.
parts: So Pharaoh was angry with his two eunuchs, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.

verses.text: Thus he put them in custody with the chief bodyguard in the prison, the place where Joseph was confined.
parts: Thus he put them in custody with the chief bodyguard in the prison, the place where Joseph was confined.

verses.text: Then the chief jailer committed them to Joseph, and he attended them; so they were in custody for a while.
parts: Then the chief jailer committed them to Joseph, and he attended them; so they were in custody for a while.

verses.text: Then the king of Egypt's chief cupbearer and the chief baker, who were confined in the prison, had a dream, both of them, each man's dream in one night and each man's dream with its own interpretation.
parts: Then the king of Egypt's chief cupbearer and the chief baker, who were confined in the prison, had a dream, both of them, each man's dream in one night and each man's dream with its own interpretation.

verses.text: So Joseph came in to them in the morning and looked at them, and saw they were troubled.
parts: So Joseph came in to them in the morning and looked at them, and saw they were troubled.

verses.text: Thus he asked Pharaoh's eunuchs, who were with him in the custody of his lord, saying, “Why do you look so sad today?”
parts: Thus he asked Pharaoh's eunuchs, who were with him in the custody of his lord, saying, “Why do you look so sad today?”

verses.text: So they said to him, “We each had a dream, and there is no one to interpret it.” Then Joseph said to them, “Do not interpretations belong to God?
parts: So they said to him, “We each had a dream, and there is no one to interpret it.” Then Joseph said to them, “Do not interpretations belong to God?

verses.text: Then the chief cupbearer related his dream to Joseph, and said to him, “Behold, in my dream a vine was before me,
parts: Then the chief cupbearer related his dream to Joseph, and said to him, “Behold, in my dream a vine was before me,

verses.text: and in the vine were three branches; it was as though it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and its clusters brought forth ripe grapes.
parts: and in the vine were three branches; it was as though it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and its clusters brought forth ripe grapes.

verses.text: Then Pharaoh's cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.”
parts: Then Pharaoh's cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.”

verses.text: And Joseph said to him, “This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days.
parts: And Joseph said to him, “This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days.

verses.text: Now within three days Pharaoh will remember your position and restore your office of chief cupbearer; and you will put Pharaoh's cup in his hand according to the former manner, when you were his cupbearer.
parts: Now within three days Pharaoh will remember your position and restore your office of chief cupbearer; and you will put Pharaoh's cup in his hand according to the former manner, when you were his cupbearer.

verses.text: But remember me when it is well with you, and have mercy on me; make mention of me to Pharaoh, and get me out of this prison.
parts: But remember me when it is well with you, and have mercy on me; make mention of me to Pharaoh, and get me out of this prison.

verses.text: For indeed I was stolen away from the land of the Hebrews; and I also have done nothing for them to put me into the dungeon.”
parts: For indeed I was stolen away from the land of the Hebrews; and I also have done nothing for them to put me into the dungeon.”

verses.text: When the chief baker saw the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, “I also had a dream, and there were three white baskets on my head.
parts: When the chief baker saw the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, “I also had a dream, and there were three white baskets on my head.

verses.text: In the uppermost basket were all kinds of baked goods for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head.”
parts: In the uppermost basket were all kinds of baked goods for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head.”

verses.text: So Joseph answered and said, “This is the interpretation of it: The three baskets are three days.
parts: So Joseph answered and said, “This is the interpretation of it: The three baskets are three days.

verses.text: Within three days Pharaoh will lift off your head from you and hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from you.”
parts: Within three days Pharaoh will lift off your head from you and hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from you.”

verses.text: Now it came to pass on the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants; and he remembered the positions of his chief cupbearer and chief baker among his servants.
parts: Now it came to pass on the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants; and he remembered the positions of his chief cupbearer and chief baker among his servants.

verses.text: Then he restored the chief cupbearer to his position, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.
parts: Then he restored the chief cupbearer to his position, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh's hand.

verses.text: But he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them.
parts: But he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them.

verses.text: Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
parts: Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.

headers: Joseph Interprets the Dreams of Pharaoh

verses.text: Then it came to pass, at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh had a dream; and behold, he stood by the river.
parts: Then it came to pass, at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh had a dream; and behold, he stood by the river.

verses.text: Suddenly there came up out of the river seven cows, fine-looking and fat; and they fed in the meadow.
parts: Suddenly there came up out of the river seven cows, fine-looking and fat; and they fed in the meadow.

verses.text: Then behold, seven other cows came up after them out of the river, ugly and gaunt, and stood by the other cows on the bank of the river.
parts: Then behold, seven other cows came up after them out of the river, ugly and gaunt, and stood by the other cows on the bank of the river.

verses.text: But the ugly and gaunt cows ate up the seven fine-looking and fat cows.
parts: But the ugly and gaunt cows ate up the seven fine-looking and fat cows.

verses.text: He slept and dreamed a second time; and suddenly seven ears of corn came up on one stalk, plump and good.
parts: He slept and dreamed a second time; and suddenly seven ears of corn came up on one stalk, plump and good.

verses.text: Then behold, seven ears of corn, thin and blighted by the east wind, sprang up after them.
parts: Then behold, seven ears of corn, thin and blighted by the east wind, sprang up after them.

verses.text: But the seven thin ears of corn devoured the seven plump and full ears.
parts: But the seven thin ears of corn devoured the seven plump and full ears.

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all the interpreters of Egypt and all its wise men.
parts: Now it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all the interpreters of Egypt and all its wise men.

verses.text: Then the cupbearer spoke to Pharaoh, saying, “I remember my sin this day.
parts: Then the cupbearer spoke to Pharaoh, saying, “I remember my sin this day.

verses.text: When Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and put me in custody in the house of the chief bodyguard, both myself and the chief baker,
parts: When Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and put me in custody in the house of the chief bodyguard, both myself and the chief baker,

verses.text: we each had a dream in one night, both he and I.
parts: we each had a dream in one night, both he and I.

verses.text: Now there was with us a young Hebrew servant of the chief bodyguard, and we related our dreams to him; and he interpreted them for us.
parts: Now there was with us a young Hebrew servant of the chief bodyguard, and we related our dreams to him; and he interpreted them for us.

verses.text: And it came to pass, just as he interpreted for us, so it happened.
parts: And it came to pass, just as he interpreted for us, so it happened.

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him quickly out of the dungeon; and he shaved, changed his clothing, and came to Pharaoh.
parts: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him quickly out of the dungeon; and he shaved, changed his clothing, and came to Pharaoh.

verses.text: Thus Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I had a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it.
parts: Thus Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I had a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it.

verses.text: So Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “It is not in me; God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.”
parts: So Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “It is not in me; God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Behold, in my dream I stood on the bank of the river.
parts: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Behold, in my dream I stood on the bank of the river.

verses.text: Suddenly seven cows came up out of the river, fine-looking and fat; and they fed in the meadow.
parts: Suddenly seven cows came up out of the river, fine-looking and fat; and they fed in the meadow.

verses.text: Then behold, seven other cows came up after them, poor and very ugly and gaunt, such ugliness as I have never seen in all the land of Egypt.
parts: Then behold, seven other cows came up after them, poor and very ugly and gaunt, such ugliness as I have never seen in all the land of Egypt.

verses.text: And the gaunt and ugly cows ate up the first seven, the fat cows.
parts: And the gaunt and ugly cows ate up the first seven, the fat cows.

verses.text: When they had eaten them, no one would have known they had eaten them, for they were just as ugly as at the beginning.
parts: When they had eaten them, no one would have known they had eaten them, for they were just as ugly as at the beginning.

verses.text: Again, I saw in my dream, and suddenly seven ears of corn came up on one stalk, full and good.
parts: Again, I saw in my dream, and suddenly seven ears of corn came up on one stalk, full and good.

verses.text: Then behold, seven ears of corn, withered, thin, and blighted by the east wind, sprang up after them.
parts: Then behold, seven ears of corn, withered, thin, and blighted by the east wind, sprang up after them.

verses.text: But the thin ears of corn devoured the seven good ears.
parts: But the thin ears of corn devoured the seven good ears.

verses.text: Then Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dreams of Pharaoh are one; God has shown Pharaoh what He is about to do: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven good ears of corn are seven years; the dreams are one.
parts: Then Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dreams of Pharaoh are one; God has shown Pharaoh what He is about to do: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven good ears of corn are seven years; the dreams are one.

verses.text: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven good ears of corn are seven years; the dreams are one.
parts: The seven good cows are seven years, and the seven good ears of corn are seven years; the dreams are one.

verses.text: But the seven thin and ugly cows that came up after them are seven years, and the seven empty heads blighted by the east wind are seven years of famine.
parts: But the seven thin and ugly cows that came up after them are seven years, and the seven empty heads blighted by the east wind are seven years of famine.

verses.text: This is the thing I have spoken to Pharaoh.
parts: This is the thing I have spoken to Pharaoh.

verses.text: Indeed, seven years of great plenty will come throughout all the land of Egypt;
parts: Indeed, seven years of great plenty will come throughout all the land of Egypt;

verses.text: but after them seven years of famine will arise, and all the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine will deplete the land.
parts: but after them seven years of famine will arise, and all the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine will deplete the land.

verses.text: So the plenty will not be known in the land because of the famine following, for it will be very severe.
parts: So the plenty will not be known in the land because of the famine following, for it will be very severe.

verses.text: Now the dream was repeated to Pharaoh twice because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
parts: Now the dream was repeated to Pharaoh twice because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

verses.text: Now therefore, let Pharaoh select a sensible and intelligent man, and set him over the land of Egypt.
parts: Now therefore, let Pharaoh select a sensible and intelligent man, and set him over the land of Egypt.

verses.text: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint governors over the land, to collect one-fifth of the produce of the land of Egypt in the seven plentiful years.
parts: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint governors over the land, to collect one-fifth of the produce of the land of Egypt in the seven plentiful years.

verses.text: So let them gather all the food of the seven good years that are coming, and store up grain under Pharaoh's authority, and let them keep food in the cities.
parts: So let them gather all the food of the seven good years that are coming, and store up grain under Pharaoh's authority, and let them keep food in the cities.

verses.text: That food shall then be as a reserve in the land for the seven coming years of famine in the land of Egypt, that the land may not perish during the famine.”
parts: That food shall then be as a reserve in the land for the seven coming years of famine in the land of Egypt, that the land may not perish during the famine.”

verses.text: Now this advice was good in the eyes of Pharaoh and in the eyes of all his servants. Thus Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a man as this, who has the Spirit of God in him?” Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Inasmuch as God has shown you all this, there is no one as sensible and intelligent as you.
parts: Now this advice was good in the eyes of Pharaoh and in the eyes of all his servants.

Thus Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a man as this, who has the Spirit of God in him?” Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Inasmuch as God has shown you all this, there is no one as sensible and intelligent as you.

verses.text: Thus Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a man as this, who has the Spirit of God in him?”
parts: Thus Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a man as this, who has the Spirit of God in him?”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Inasmuch as God has shown you all this, there is no one as sensible and intelligent as you.
parts: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Inasmuch as God has shown you all this, there is no one as sensible and intelligent as you.

verses.text: You shall be over my house, and all my people shall be ruled according to your word; only in regard to the throne will I be greater than you.”
parts: You shall be over my house, and all my people shall be ruled according to your word; only in regard to the throne will I be greater than you.”

verses.text: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”
parts: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh took the signet ring off his hand and put it on Joseph's hand; and he clothed him in garments of fine linen and put a gold chain around his neck.
parts: Then Pharaoh took the signet ring off his hand and put it on Joseph's hand; and he clothed him in garments of fine linen and put a gold chain around his neck.

verses.text: Then he had him ride in the second of his chariots; and they cried out before him, “Bow the knee!” So he set him over all the land of Egypt.
parts: Then he had him ride in the second of his chariots; and they cried out before him, “Bow the knee!” So he set him over all the land of Egypt.

verses.text: Pharaoh also said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, and without your consent no man may lift his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
parts: Pharaoh also said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, and without your consent no man may lift his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnath-Paaneah, and he gave him as a wife Asenath, the daughter of Poti-Pherah, priest of On.
parts: Then Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnath-Paaneah, and he gave him as a wife Asenath, the daughter of Poti-Pherah, priest of On.

verses.text: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt.
parts: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt.

verses.text: Now in the seven plentiful years the ground brought forth abundantly.
parts: Now in the seven plentiful years the ground brought forth abundantly.

verses.text: So he gathered up all the food of the seven years of prosperity in the land of Egypt, and stored the food in the cities; he laid up in every city the food of the fields that surrounded them.
parts: So he gathered up all the food of the seven years of prosperity in the land of Egypt, and stored the food in the cities; he laid up in every city the food of the fields that surrounded them.

verses.text: Joseph gathered very much grain, as the sand of the sea, until he stopped counting, for it was immeasurable.
parts: Joseph gathered very much grain, as the sand of the sea, until he stopped counting, for it was immeasurable.

verses.text: Now two sons were born to Joseph before the years of famine came, whom Asenath, the daughter of Poti-Pherah, priest of On, bore to him.
parts: Now two sons were born to Joseph before the years of famine came, whom Asenath, the daughter of Poti-Pherah, priest of On, bore to him.

verses.text: Joseph called the name of his firstborn Manasseh: “For God has made me forget all my troubles and all my father's house.”
parts: Joseph called the name of his firstborn Manasseh: “For God has made me forget all my troubles and all my father's house.”

verses.text: And the name of the second he called Ephraim: “For God has caused me to be fruitful in the land of my humiliation.”
parts: And the name of the second he called Ephraim: “For God has caused me to be fruitful in the land of my humiliation.”

verses.text: Then the seven years of plenty in the land of Egypt ended, and the seven years of famine began to come, as Joseph said.
parts: Then the seven years of plenty in the land of Egypt ended, and the seven years of famine began to come, as Joseph said.

verses.text: and the seven years of famine began to come, as Joseph said.
parts: and the seven years of famine began to come, as Joseph said.

verses.text: So when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread.
parts: So when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread.

verses.text: The famine was over all the face of the earth, and Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold to the Egyptians.
parts: The famine was over all the face of the earth, and Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold to the Egyptians.

verses.text: Then all countries also came to Joseph in Egypt to buy grain, because the famine was severe in all the earth.
parts: Then all countries also came to Joseph in Egypt to buy grain, because the famine was severe in all the earth.

verses.text: When Jacob found out there was grain for sale in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why are you standing idle?” Then he said, “Indeed, I heard there is grain in Egypt; go down there and buy for us there, that we may live and not die.” So Joseph's ten brothers went down to buy grain in Egypt.
parts: When Jacob found out there was grain for sale in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why are you standing idle?”
Then he said, “Indeed, I heard there is grain in Egypt; go down there and buy for us there, that we may live and not die.” So Joseph's ten brothers went down to buy grain in Egypt.

verses.text: But Jacob did not send Joseph's brother Benjamin with his brothers, for he said, “Lest some calamity befall him.”
parts: But Jacob did not send Joseph's brother Benjamin with his brothers, for he said, “Lest some calamity befall him.”

verses.text: Thus the sons of Israel went to buy grain with those who were going there, for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
parts: Thus the sons of Israel went to buy grain with those who were going there, for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

verses.text: Now Joseph was governor over the land; and it was he who sold to all the people of the land.
parts: Now Joseph was governor over the land; and it was he who sold to all the people of the land.

verses.text: Joseph saw his brothers and recognized them, but he acted as a stranger to them and spoke roughly to them.
parts: Joseph saw his brothers and recognized them, but he acted as a stranger to them and spoke roughly to them.

verses.text: So Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him.
parts: So Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him.

verses.text: Then Joseph remembered the dreams he dreamed about them, and said to them, “You are spies.
parts: Then Joseph remembered the dreams he dreamed about them, and said to them, “You are spies.

verses.text: But they said to him, “No, my lord, your servants have come to buy food.
parts: But they said to him, “No, my lord, your servants have come to buy food.

verses.text: We are all one man's sons; we are men of peace; your servants are not spies.”
parts: We are all one man's sons; we are men of peace; your servants are not spies.”

verses.text: But he said to them, “No, but you have come to map out the roads of the land.”
parts: But he said to them, “No, but you have come to map out the roads of the land.”

verses.text: Then they said, “Your servants are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and in fact, the youngest is with our father today, and one is no more.”
parts: Then they said, “Your servants are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and in fact, the youngest is with our father today, and one is no more.”

verses.text: But Joseph said to them, “It is as I spoke to you, namely, ‘You are spies!’
parts: But Joseph said to them, “It is as I spoke to you, namely, ‘You are spies!’

verses.text: In this manner you shall be manifested: By the life of Pharaoh, you shall not leave this place unless your youngest brother comes here.
parts: In this manner you shall be manifested: By the life of Pharaoh, you shall not leave this place unless your youngest brother comes here.

verses.text: Send one of you, and let him bring your brother; and you shall be kept in prison, that your words may be tested to see whether there is any truth in you; or else, by the life of Pharaoh, surely you are spies.”
parts: Send one of you, and let him bring your brother; and you shall be kept in prison, that your words may be tested to see whether there is any truth in you; or else, by the life of Pharaoh, surely you are spies.”

verses.text: So he put them all together in prison three days.
parts: So he put them all together in prison three days.

verses.text: Then Joseph said to them the third day, “Do this and live, for I fear God. If you are men of peace, let one of your brothers be confined to your prison house; but you, go and carry grain for the famine of your houses.
parts: Then Joseph said to them the third day, “Do this and live, for I fear God.
If you are men of peace, let one of your brothers be confined to your prison house; but you, go and carry grain for the famine of your houses.

verses.text: If you are men of peace, let one of your brothers be confined to your prison house; but you, go and carry grain for the famine of your houses.
parts: If you are men of peace, let one of your brothers be confined to your prison house; but you, go and carry grain for the famine of your houses.

verses.text: But bring your youngest brother to me; so your words will be verified, and you shall not die.” So they did so.
parts: But bring your youngest brother to me; so your words will be verified, and you shall not die.” So they did so.

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “We are truly guilty concerning our brother, for we saw the anguish of his soul when he pleaded with us, and we would not hear; therefore this distress has come upon us.”
parts: Then they said to one another, “We are truly guilty concerning our brother, for we saw the anguish of his soul when he pleaded with us, and we would not hear; therefore this distress has come upon us.”

verses.text: Reuben then answered them, saying, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘Do not sin against the boy,’ but you would not listen?
parts: Reuben then answered them, saying, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘Do not sin against the boy,’ but you would not listen?

verses.text: But they did not know Joseph understood them, for he spoke to them through an interpreter.
parts: But they did not know Joseph understood them, for he spoke to them through an interpreter.

verses.text: Then Joseph turned himself away from them and wept.
parts: Then Joseph turned himself away from them and wept.

verses.text: Joseph then gave a command to fill their sacks with grain, to restore every man's money to his sack, and to give them provisions for the journey.
parts: Joseph then gave a command to fill their sacks with grain, to restore every man's money to his sack, and to give them provisions for the journey.

verses.text: So they loaded their donkeys with the grain and departed from there.
parts: So they loaded their donkeys with the grain and departed from there.

verses.text: But as one of them opened his sack to give his donkey feed at the encampment, he saw his money; and there it was, in the mouth of his sack.
parts: But as one of them opened his sack to give his donkey feed at the encampment, he saw his money; and there it was, in the mouth of his sack.

verses.text: So he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned to me, and there it is, in my sack.” Then their hearts failed them, and they were afraid, saying to one another, “What is this God has done to us?”
parts: So he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned to me, and there it is, in my sack.” Then their hearts failed them, and they were afraid, saying to one another, “What is this God has done to us?”

verses.text: Then they went to Jacob their father in the land of Canaan and told him all that happened to them, saying, “The man who is lord of the land spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
parts: Then they went to Jacob their father in the land of Canaan and told him all that happened to them, saying, “The man who is lord of the land spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

verses.text: “The man who is lord of the land spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
parts: “The man who is lord of the land spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

verses.text: But we said to him, ‘We are men of peace; we are not spies.
parts: But we said to him, ‘We are men of peace; we are not spies.

verses.text: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is no more, and the youngest is with our father this day in the land of Canaan.’
parts: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is no more, and the youngest is with our father this day in the land of Canaan.’

verses.text: Then the man, the lord of the country, said to us, ‘By this I will know you are men of peace: leave one of your brothers here with me, take food for your households, and be gone.
parts: Then the man, the lord of the country, said to us, ‘By this I will know you are men of peace: leave one of your brothers here with me, take food for your households, and be gone.

verses.text: Now, bring your youngest brother to me; then I shall know you are not spies, but men of peace.
parts: Now, bring your youngest brother to me; then I shall know you are not spies, but men of peace.

verses.text: Then it happened as they emptied their sacks, that surprisingly each man's bundle of money was in his sack; and when they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
parts: Then it happened as they emptied their sacks, that surprisingly each man's bundle of money was in his sack; and when they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.

verses.text: So Jacob their father said to them, “You have bereaved me: Joseph is no more; Simeon is no more; and you want to take Benjamin.
parts: So Jacob their father said to them, “You have bereaved me: Joseph is no more; Simeon is no more; and you want to take Benjamin.

verses.text: Then Reuben spoke to his father, saying, “Kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you; put him in my hands, and I will bring him back to you.”
parts: Then Reuben spoke to his father, saying, “Kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you; put him in my hands, and I will bring him back to you.”

verses.text: But he said, “My son shall not go down with you, for his brother is dead, and he is left alone.
parts: But he said, “My son shall not go down with you, for his brother is dead, and he is left alone.

headers: Joseph's Brothers Return to Egypt with Benjamin

verses.text: Now the famine was severe in the land.
parts: Now the famine was severe in the land.

verses.text: So it came to pass, when they had eaten the grain they brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go back, and buy us a little food.”
parts: So it came to pass, when they had eaten the grain they brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go back, and buy us a little food.”

verses.text: But Judah spoke to him, saying, “The man solemnly warned us, saying, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’
parts: But Judah spoke to him, saying, “The man solemnly warned us, saying, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’

verses.text: If you send our brother with us, we will go down and buy you food.
parts: If you send our brother with us, we will go down and buy you food.

verses.text: But if you will not send him, we will not go down; for the man said to us, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’ ”
parts: But if you will not send him, we will not go down; for the man said to us, ‘You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.’ ”

verses.text: Then Israel said, “Why did you deal so wrongfully with me as to tell the man whether you had yet another brother?” But they said, “The man asked us pointedly about ourselves and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still alive?
parts: Then Israel said, “Why did you deal so wrongfully with me as to tell the man whether you had yet another brother?” But they said, “The man asked us pointedly about ourselves and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still alive?

verses.text: But they said, “The man asked us pointedly about ourselves and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still alive?
parts: But they said, “The man asked us pointedly about ourselves and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still alive?

verses.text: Then Judah said to Israel his father, “Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go, that we may live and not die, both we and you and all we have.
parts: Then Judah said to Israel his father, “Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go, that we may live and not die, both we and you and all we have.

verses.text: I myself will be surety for him; from my hand you shall require him.
parts: I myself will be surety for him; from my hand you shall require him.

verses.text: For if we had not lingered, surely by now we would have returned this second time.”
parts: For if we had not lingered, surely by now we would have returned this second time.”

verses.text: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, then do this: take some of the best fruits of the land in your vessels and carry down a present for the man—a little balm and a little honey, spices and myrrh, pistachio nuts and almonds.
parts: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, then do this: take some of the best fruits of the land in your vessels and carry down a present for the man—a little balm and a little honey, spices and myrrh, pistachio nuts and almonds.

verses.text: Take double money in your hand, and take back in your hand the money returned in the mouth of your sacks; perhaps it was an oversight.
parts: Take double money in your hand, and take back in your hand the money returned in the mouth of your sacks; perhaps it was an oversight.

verses.text: Take your brother also, and arise, go back to the man.
parts: Take your brother also, and arise, go back to the man.

verses.text: May God give you grace before the man, that he may release your other brother and Benjamin.
parts: May God give you grace before the man, that he may release your other brother and Benjamin.

verses.text: So the men took that present and Benjamin, and they took double money in their hand, and arose and went down to Egypt; and they stood before Joseph.
parts: So the men took that present and Benjamin, and they took double money in their hand, and arose and went down to Egypt; and they stood before Joseph.

verses.text: When Joseph saw Benjamin, his brother by the same mother, with them, he said to the steward of his house, “Take these men to my home, and slaughter an animal and make ready; for these men will dine with me at noon.”
parts: When Joseph saw Benjamin, his brother by the same mother, with them, he said to the steward of his house, “Take these men to my home, and slaughter an animal and make ready; for these men will dine with me at noon.”

verses.text: Then the man did as Joseph ordered, and the man brought the men into Joseph's house.
parts: Then the man did as Joseph ordered, and the man brought the men into Joseph's house.

verses.text: Now the men were afraid because they were brought into Joseph's house, and they said, “It is because of the money returned to our sacks the first time, that we are brought here to make a case against us and fall upon us, to take us as slaves with our donkeys.” When they drew near to the steward of Joseph's house, they talked with him at the door of the house, saying, “We entreat you, my lord, we indeed came down the first time to buy food; but it happened, when we came to the encampment, that we opened our sacks, and there to our surprise, each man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight; so we have brought it back in our hand.
parts: Now the men were afraid because they were brought into Joseph's house, and they said, “It is because of the money returned to our sacks the first time, that we are brought here to make a case against us and fall upon us, to take us as slaves with our donkeys.”

When they drew near to the steward of Joseph's house, they talked with him at the door of the house, saying, “We entreat you, my lord, we indeed came down the first time to buy food; but it happened, when we came to the encampment, that we opened our sacks, and there to our surprise, each man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight; so we have brought it back in our hand.

verses.text: When they drew near to the steward of Joseph's house, they talked with him at the door of the house,
parts: When they drew near to the steward of Joseph's house, they talked with him at the door of the house,

verses.text: saying, “We entreat you, my lord, we indeed came down the first time to buy food;
parts: saying, “We entreat you, my lord, we indeed came down the first time to buy food;

verses.text: but it happened, when we came to the encampment, that we opened our sacks, and there to our surprise, each man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight; so we have brought it back in our hand.
parts: but it happened, when we came to the encampment, that we opened our sacks, and there to our surprise, each man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight; so we have brought it back in our hand.

verses.text: And we have brought down other money in our hands to buy food.
parts: And we have brought down other money in our hands to buy food.

verses.text: But he said, “Mercy be on you; do not be afraid.
parts: But he said, “Mercy be on you; do not be afraid.

verses.text: So the man brought the men into Joseph's house and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their donkeys feed.
parts: So the man brought the men into Joseph's house and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their donkeys feed.

verses.text: Then they made the present ready for Joseph's coming at noon, for they heard he would eat bread there.
parts: Then they made the present ready for Joseph's coming at noon, for they heard he would eat bread there.

verses.text: Thus when Joseph came home, they brought the present in their hand to him in the house, and bowed down before him to the earth.
parts: Thus when Joseph came home, they brought the present in their hand to him in the house, and bowed down before him to the earth.

verses.text: Then he asked them about their well-being, and said, “Is your father well, the old man of whom you spoke?
parts: Then he asked them about their well-being, and said, “Is your father well, the old man of whom you spoke?

verses.text: So they answered, “Your servant our father is in good health; he is still alive.” Then he said, “Blessed be that man in God”; and they bowed their heads down and prostrated themselves.
parts: So they answered, “Your servant our father is in good health; he is still alive.” Then he said, “Blessed be that man in God”; and they bowed their heads down and prostrated themselves.

verses.text: Then Joseph lifted his eyes and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, “Is this your younger brother you said you would bring to me?” So he said, “May God grant you mercy, my son.” Now his heart yearned for his brother; so Joseph made haste and sought somewhere to weep.
parts: Then Joseph lifted his eyes and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, “Is this your younger brother you said you would bring to me?” So he said, “May God grant you mercy, my son.” Now his heart yearned for his brother; so Joseph made haste and sought somewhere to weep.

verses.text: Now his heart yearned for his brother; so Joseph made haste and sought somewhere to weep.
parts: Now his heart yearned for his brother; so Joseph made haste and sought somewhere to weep.

verses.text: He then washed his face and came out; and he composed himself, and said, “Serve the bread.”
parts: He then washed his face and came out; and he composed himself, and said, “Serve the bread.”

verses.text: So they set him a place by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; because the Egyptians could not eat food with the Hebrews, for that is an abomination to the Egyptians.
parts: So they set him a place by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; because the Egyptians could not eat food with the Hebrews, for that is an abomination to the Egyptians.

verses.text: Now they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright and the youngest according to his youth; and the men looked in astonishment at one another.
parts: Now they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright and the youngest according to his youth; and the men looked in astonishment at one another.

verses.text: Then he took servings to them from before him, but Benjamin's serving was five times as much as any of theirs.
parts: Then he took servings to them from before him, but Benjamin's serving was five times as much as any of theirs.

verses.text: Now Joseph commanded the steward of his house, saying, “Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put each man's money in the mouth of his sack.
parts: Now Joseph commanded the steward of his house, saying, “Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put each man's money in the mouth of his sack.

verses.text: Also put my cup, the silver cup, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, and his grain money.” So he did according to the word Joseph had spoken.
parts: Also put my cup, the silver cup, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, and his grain money.” So he did according to the word Joseph had spoken.

verses.text: As soon as the morning dawned, the men were sent away, they and their donkeys.
parts: As soon as the morning dawned, the men were sent away, they and their donkeys.

verses.text: When they had gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said to his steward, “Get up, follow the men; and when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why have you repaid evil for good?
parts: When they had gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said to his steward, “Get up, follow the men; and when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why have you repaid evil for good?

verses.text: Why have you stolen my silver cup?
parts: Why have you stolen my silver cup?

verses.text: So he overtook them, and he spoke to them these same words.
parts: So he overtook them, and he spoke to them these same words.

verses.text: But they said to him, “Why does my lord say these words?
parts: But they said to him, “Why does my lord say these words?

verses.text: Look, we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money we found in the mouth of our sacks.
parts: Look, we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money we found in the mouth of our sacks.

verses.text: With whomever of your servants it is found, let him die, and we also will be my lord's servants.”
parts: With whomever of your servants it is found, let him die, and we also will be my lord's servants.”

verses.text: Then he replied, “Now as you say, so it will be; he with whom it is found shall be my servant, and you shall be blameless.”
parts: Then he replied, “Now as you say, so it will be; he with whom it is found shall be my servant, and you shall be blameless.”

verses.text: Then each man speedily let down his sack to the ground, and each opened his sack.
parts: Then each man speedily let down his sack to the ground, and each opened his sack.

verses.text: So he searched the oldest and left off with the youngest; and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.
parts: So he searched the oldest and left off with the youngest; and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.

verses.text: Then they tore their clothes, and each man loaded his donkey and returned to the city.
parts: Then they tore their clothes, and each man loaded his donkey and returned to the city.

verses.text: So Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house, and he was still there; and they fell before him on the ground.
parts: So Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house, and he was still there; and they fell before him on the ground.

verses.text: Thus Joseph said to them, “What is this thing you have done?
parts: Thus Joseph said to them, “What is this thing you have done?

verses.text: Then Judah said, “What shall we say to my lord?
parts: Then Judah said, “What shall we say to my lord?

verses.text: But Joseph said, “Far be it from me that I should do so; the man in whose hand the cup was found, he shall be my servant.
parts: But Joseph said, “Far be it from me that I should do so; the man in whose hand the cup was found, he shall be my servant.

verses.text: Then Judah came near to him and said, “O my lord, let your servant speak a word in my lord's hearing, and do not let your anger burn against your servant; for you are even like Pharaoh.
parts: Then Judah came near to him and said, “O my lord, let your servant speak a word in my lord's hearing, and do not let your anger burn against your servant; for you are even like Pharaoh.

verses.text: My lord asked his servants, saying, ‘Have you a father or a brother?’
parts: My lord asked his servants, saying, ‘Have you a father or a brother?’

verses.text: Then we said to my lord, ‘We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, who is young; his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother's children, and his father loves him.’
parts: Then we said to my lord, ‘We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, who is young; his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother's children, and his father loves him.’

verses.text: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes on him.’
parts: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes on him.’

verses.text: But we said to my lord, ‘The lad cannot leave his father, for if he should leave his father, his father would die.’
parts: But we said to my lord, ‘The lad cannot leave his father, for if he should leave his father, his father would die.’

verses.text: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you shall see my face no more.’
parts: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you shall see my face no more.’

verses.text: “So it was, when we went up to your servant my father, that we told him the words of my lord.
parts: “So it was, when we went up to your servant my father, that we told him the words of my lord.

verses.text: And our father said, ‘Go back and buy us a little food.’
parts: And our father said, ‘Go back and buy us a little food.’

verses.text: But we said, ‘We cannot go down; if our youngest brother is with us, then we will go down; for we may not see the man's face unless our youngest brother is with us.’
parts: But we said, ‘We cannot go down; if our youngest brother is with us, then we will go down; for we may not see the man's face unless our youngest brother is with us.’

verses.text: Then your servant our father said to us, ‘You know my wife bore me two sons;
parts: Then your servant our father said to us, ‘You know my wife bore me two sons;

verses.text: and the one went out from me, and I said, “Surely he was eaten by a wild animal”; and I have not seen him since.
parts: and the one went out from me, and I said, “Surely he was eaten by a wild animal”; and I have not seen him since.

verses.text: But if you take this one also from me, and calamity befalls him, you shall bring down my gray hair with sorrow to the grave.’
parts: But if you take this one also from me, and calamity befalls him, you shall bring down my gray hair with sorrow to the grave.’

verses.text: Now therefore, when I come to your servant our father, and the lad is not with us, since his life is bound up in the lad's life,
parts: Now therefore, when I come to your servant our father, and the lad is not with us, since his life is bound up in the lad's life,

verses.text: it will happen, when he sees the lad is not with us, he will die.
parts: it will happen, when he sees the lad is not with us, he will die.

verses.text: For your servant became surety for the lad to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, then I shall bear the blame before my father all my days.’
parts: For your servant became surety for the lad to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, then I shall bear the blame before my father all my days.’

verses.text: Now therefore, let your servant remain instead of the lad as a servant to my lord, and let the lad go up with his brothers.
parts: Now therefore, let your servant remain instead of the lad as a servant to my lord, and let the lad go up with his brothers.

verses.text: For how shall I go up to my father if the lad is not with me, lest perhaps I see the evil that would come upon my father?”
parts: For how shall I go up to my father if the lad is not with me, lest perhaps I see the evil that would come upon my father?”

headers: Joseph Reveals Himself to His Brothers

verses.text: Now Joseph could not restrain himself before all those who stood by him, and he cried out, “Make everyone go out from me!” So no one stood with him while Joseph made himself known to his brothers. Then he wept aloud, and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard it.
parts: Now Joseph could not restrain himself before all those who stood by him, and he cried out, “Make everyone go out from me!” So no one stood with him while Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
Then he wept aloud, and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard it.

verses.text: Joseph then said to his brothers, “I am Joseph; does my father still live?” But his brothers could not answer him, for they were stunned in his presence.
parts: Joseph then said to his brothers, “I am Joseph; does my father still live?” But his brothers could not answer him, for they were stunned in his presence.

verses.text: But Joseph said to his brothers, “Come near to me.” So they came near.
parts: But Joseph said to his brothers, “Come near to me.” So they came near.

verses.text: Now therefore, do not be grieved or angry with yourselves because you sold me here; for God sent me before you to save life.
parts: Now therefore, do not be grieved or angry with yourselves because you sold me here; for God sent me before you to save life.

verses.text: For this is the second year of famine in the land, and five years still remain in which there will be neither plowing nor harvesting.
parts: For this is the second year of famine in the land, and five years still remain in which there will be neither plowing nor harvesting.

verses.text: For God sent me before you to preserve you as a remnant on the earth, and to sustain you as a great remnant.
parts: For God sent me before you to preserve you as a remnant on the earth, and to sustain you as a great remnant.

verses.text: So now, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.
parts: So now, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.

verses.text: “Hurry then and go up to my father, and say to him, ‘Thus says your son Joseph, “God made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me, do not tarry. You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near to me, you and your children, your children's children, your sheep and oxen, and all you have.
parts: “Hurry then and go up to my father, and say to him, ‘Thus says your son Joseph, “God made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me, do not tarry.
You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near to me, you and your children, your children's children, your sheep and oxen, and all you have.

verses.text: You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near to me, you and your children, your children's children, your sheep and oxen, and all you have.
parts: You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you shall be near to me, you and your children, your children's children, your sheep and oxen, and all you have.

verses.text: There I will provide for you, lest you and your household, and all you have, come to poverty; for five years of famine still remain.’ ”
parts: There I will provide for you, lest you and your household, and all you have, come to poverty; for five years of famine still remain.’ ”

verses.text: And behold, your eyes and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see it is my mouth that speaks to you.
parts: And behold, your eyes and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see it is my mouth that speaks to you.

verses.text: Therefore, you shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all you have seen; and you shall hurry and bring my father down here.”
parts: Therefore, you shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all you have seen; and you shall hurry and bring my father down here.”

verses.text: Then he fell on his brother Benjamin's neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
parts: Then he fell on his brother Benjamin's neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.

verses.text: Moreover he kissed all his brothers and wept over them, and after this his brothers talked with him.
parts: Moreover he kissed all his brothers and wept over them, and after this his brothers talked with him.

verses.text: Now the report of it was heard in Pharaoh's house, saying, “Joseph's brothers have come.” So it pleased Pharaoh and his servants well.
parts: Now the report of it was heard in Pharaoh's house, saying, “Joseph's brothers have come.” So it pleased Pharaoh and his servants well.

verses.text: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do this, load your conveyances and depart; go to the land of Canaan.
parts: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do this, load your conveyances and depart; go to the land of Canaan.

verses.text: Bring your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.
parts: Bring your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.

verses.text: Now you are commanded—do this, take carts out of the land of Egypt for your little ones and your wives; bring your father and come.
parts: Now you are commanded—do this, take carts out of the land of Egypt for your little ones and your wives; bring your father and come.

verses.text: Also do not be concerned about your goods, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’ ”
parts: Also do not be concerned about your goods, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.’ ”

verses.text: Thus the sons of Israel did so; and Joseph gave them carts, according to the command of Pharaoh, and he gave them provisions for the journey.
parts: Thus the sons of Israel did so; and Joseph gave them carts, according to the command of Pharaoh, and he gave them provisions for the journey.

verses.text: He gave to all of them, to each man, two changes of garments; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of gold and five changes of exceptionally fine garments.
parts: He gave to all of them, to each man, two changes of garments; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of gold and five changes of exceptionally fine garments.

verses.text: He also sent to his father these things: ten donkeys loaded with the good things of Egypt, and ten mules loaded with grain, bread, and food for his father for the journey.
parts: He also sent to his father these things: ten donkeys loaded with the good things of Egypt, and ten mules loaded with grain, bread, and food for his father for the journey.

verses.text: So he sent his brothers away, and they departed; and he said to them, “See that you do not become angry with each other along the way.”
parts: So he sent his brothers away, and they departed; and he said to them, “See that you do not become angry with each other along the way.”

verses.text: Then they went up out of Egypt, and came to the land of Canaan to Jacob their father.
parts: Then they went up out of Egypt, and came to the land of Canaan to Jacob their father.

verses.text: Thus they told him, saying, “Joseph your son is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” But Jacob's mind was completely stunned, for he could not believe them.
parts: Thus they told him, saying, “Joseph your son is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” But Jacob's mind was completely stunned, for he could not believe them.

verses.text: But when they told him all the words Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the carts Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived.
parts: But when they told him all the words Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the carts Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived.

verses.text: Then Israel said, “It is a great thing to me that my son Joseph is still alive.
parts: Then Israel said, “It is a great thing to me that my son Joseph is still alive.

verses.text: Now Israel took his journey with all he had, and came to the Well of Oath, and offered a sacrifice to the God of his father Isaac.
